Review Title: Great camera at a great price-point and simple to setup!
Review Text: I have the Nooie 1080P indoor camera and I've been quite happy with it so I had to give this 360-degree model a try. It takes the features of the static camera and adds the ability to pan and tilt the camera either manually or you can enable motion tracking easily through the app. I wrote a review for the static camera and many of the features carry over including its great video quality so if you've read that review, some of this will seem familiar.Setup -Setup was very simple using your phone or tablet, running the free Nooie Cam app. You first need to verify that your phone is connected to the 2.4Ghz access point in your home where you will be using the camera. You then simply start the Nooie Cam app and select the +Camera button. You select the Nooie Cam 360 option and it will walk you through the remaining, simple steps. Basically, you assure the camera is on, enter the password for the wireless access point/router your phone is currently connected to (this is the same one you will be connecting the camera to), click Next, and a QR code appears on the screen of your phone. You now hold the screen of your phone in front of the Nooie camera's lens and it provides an audible tone and LED light indicator when it is finished reading the QR code. The app will now inform you that it is pairing and will begin a countdown. When complete, the app will inform you that pairing has completed. It's that simple.Use -Now that the camera has been added, you simply select it to view the camera. To hear audio from the camera, you select the speaker icon within the app and now you are able to see and hear what's going on around the camera. The camera also has a built-in speaker that allows you to press the microphone button within the app and then speak through it. This is very useful and/or just fun depending on where you locate the camera. For example, I have the camera in my living room where my cat typically spends a good part of her day. If you have cats, I'm guessing yours is similar where she doesn't have one place that she always lays within a room. She instead has multiple locations that she'll randomly select. With this 360 degree camera, either from home, from work, a restaurant, wherever I have WiFi or cellular access I can pan the camera from left to right and up or down. It's range is great where you can literally place the camera in the center of the room and, from the app, turn it from it's left side behind it all the way around front, through to the right side behind it just by swiping across the screen with the camera's image live the whole time. You can pan it around to see the entire room. Beyond this, you have the ability to tilt the camera up and down from the app as well by swiping up and down on the camera's image live. I can scan the room for my cat, locate her, and then touch the microphone to talk to her. Being a cat, she chooses whether she wants to respond or not. Sometimes her ears just perk up and she whines (which you can hear through the camera's built-in microphone), but other times she'll choose to walk over to the camera and give it some love. :)If you choose to use the Motion Tracking feature, if your cat, or anything really, moves in front of the camera's lens, the camera will follow it. As the moving option moves close to the edge of the camera's current visibility, the camera will move to center the moving object within it's vew and continue doing this until the moving object either stops moving or moves behind something where the camera can no longer see it. One thing to note with automatic Motion Tracking is the camera can pan 360 degrees. If something moves and the camera ends up pointing in a different direction than the next moving object. The next moving option must move in front of the lens at some point for the camera to see it and start tracking it. Depending on where you mount the camera and your use, this may be fine or it may not. So, definitely think about this before placing the camera if you plan to enable Motion Tracking.Video and audio can be recorded to either a microSD card or to the cloud. Cloud storage is a paid service. Given my usage, microSD recording is fine for me so I haven't tried the cloud storage option. MicroSD recordings are easily accessed through the app via a scrollable tape across the bottom of the screen. You select the day and then scroll through to the time you would like to view. If at any time you are viewing live video or recorded video from the app and you would like to save the video to your device, you simply press the camera icon on screen to set the start point, continue watching the video as it plays, and press the icon again when you'd like to stop and the video will be saved to your device. It's VERY easy!Like other security cameras, you can also setup notifications based on sound and/or motion. This too is easy to configure by selecting None, Low, Medium, or High for each option and then selecting the timeframe that you would like to receive notifications. Note that you can enable disable notifications by day, but each day only has one start time and one end time that can be selected. Meaning, you cannot setup notifications from 8am-5pm and then again 10pm to midnight for the same day. You could do one or the other, but not both. I don't see this as a problem for me, but it's worth noting depending on your use case.There are a few additional notable settings. First is the ability to enable/disable audio recording. I haven't done much testing with this, but I'd imagine this could save some space on your microSD card, allowing you to possibly record more video if disabled. Second is the ability to enable/disable the small LED light on the camera. If you placed the camera in a visible location in your home, you may want to disable the LED to avoid the distraction of it. Last, there is a Rotate Image option. So, if you need to mount the camera under an overhang, cabinet, etc., you can simple tap this button to flip the image for mounting the camera upside down and now viewing it live or recorded video will display right-side up.Customer Service -I reached out to Nooie's customer service prior to purchasing my previous camera as I had a number of questions. I received quick, thorough responses the same day, shortly after I had sent them. I worked with Julia who was great to work with. Very friendly, personable, and understanding. Julia's customer service was great and made the decision to purchase this camera a complete no-brainer. As I'm sure many of you know, when you have questions or something goes wrong you really find out what a company is made of. I'm happy to say Nooie's support is great! Regarding this camera, I had a few questions for Nooie support prior to purchasing it and received the same great, prompt responses. This proved even moreso that their support is great! It wasn't just a one time fluke with the first camera.Summary -This camera works great and has clear video. The two-way communication capability is an added bonus and could open up its use to more than just a security camera. It's ability to automatically track motion as well as it's ability to turn 360 degrees while automatically tracking motion and/or by manually swiping the screen coupled with it's low price point of under $40 makes this a great buy in my book! I am definitely glad that I added this camera to my home. It will work well keeping track of not only the cat, but I can see when my teenager comes and goes when I'm not home.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 18, 2019

Review Text: At first I was a bit skeptic about the quality that this camera would have. I wasn't familiar with the brand Nooie, and with such an amazing deal on the purchase price, I just assumed that it was too good to be true. However, this camera has not only exceeded my original expectations, but it has also created a new standard on what I expect from any future camera or recording device purchase.The camera offers amazing video quality no matter which video resolution your using. The added night vision feature is just an amazing bonus to have, even more so with the clarity of the screen images. The downloadable app that goes along with the device works wonders, and has a nice amount of features to make your camera experience go above and beyond what most cameras will allow.The camera has video recording, still picture taking availability, voice activation, motion detection, motion activation, two way communication, cloud storage, sd card storage, sharing capability, and a lot more features that will make you fall in love with the camera as well as the available app. I definitely give this camera and its available app a 10 out of 10! I love it so much, I'm going to purchase 4 more!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2020

Review Text: PROS:Great priceQuality pictureEasy set upSelf-monitoringTwo-way audioLots of features in the appCONS:Limited to one range of time per day for monitoring.The manual does not specify which type of microSD cards is compatible.Your phone/monitoring device must be on same internet connection to set upI love this camera. It was easy to set up and use. I already have a Nooie 720P so adding this camera to the app was easy. If this is your first Nooie, you will need to download the app and create an account before using the camera. Once installed, you use the camera to scan a qr code that will appear on your app.  If you already have a Nooie, you can add this camera to the app by pressing the + sign for adding cameras in the app.The quality of the picture is good and the "follow" technology worked perfectly. When I first connected it, there was about a 15 second lag between the camera and viewing on my app. I suspect that was an internet-related issue because that disappeared quickly.I forgot to order a microSD card with the camera. If you want to be totally self-monitored, you will need a compatible microSD, The manual does not specify which type of microSD cards is compatible. The first one I ordered for my 720P did not work but the SanDisk card I ordered after reading comments here on Amazon, worked great. Other than this, the manual is simple and succinct, easy to follow.If you are watching live and want to take a still picture or video of what the camera is seeing real-time, there is an option in the app to do so. There is also a monthly monitoring service available for purchase at a reasonable cost through a company Nooie partners with.The camera arrives well packaged with recyclable cardboard material. Once removing the camera, there is a lower compartment that has the power connector and cable as well as hardware to mount on a ceiling or wall. The camera stands on its own when using on a table or shelf.Your phone/monitoring device must be on same internet connection to set up. Once set up, you can monitor from anywhere you have Internet.  That is not an issue for most, but I could not set it up in my office. Our WiFi system treats each login as a unique private network for security reasons. There is no way to plug into the camera for direct setup (an option many printers have, for example) so I am unable to use it in my office.For most, this is a VERY affordable, quality product that will meet your needs. I find myself favoring this camera over my SimpliSafe.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2019

Review Text: I bought this in early June to give to my son who has a diabetic cat.  As he was moving out of our home into his own apartment where the cat would be home alone all day. Review Text: On a whim, I decided to purchase an indoor camera to see what my cats got up to when I was sleeping or away. I learned they're actually pretty boring. haha! The camera was super easy to set up. Download the app, scan the code and voila! I installed a 128 micro SD card, but I also opted for the 3 day cloud service as a sort of backup. Plus, I like that the cloud catches incidents and I can move to each one. The videos are good quality and it's fun to capture videos and photos from the footage to share.In fact, I was so happy with the Cat Cam 1, I purchased a second one: Cat Cam 2 for another area of the house.I do have one teensy complaint or wish about the cameras. I wish that when you scroll through the saved videos, you could see what you're scrolling through, like when you grab the bar on YT to move it, the pictures you're moving through show. If that makes sense. On the Nooie 360, if you grab the bar to move it, it just skips to that place. Having the incidents notices on the cloud sort of works around that, but still. I also wish there was a way to see the live feed and/or have access to the cloud saves on the computer. I've tried different things, but can only see them on the app. If I want to view on the computer, I have to record the bit of footage I want to my phone, then send it through dropbox or email.Overall, great cameras. My family and I are having fun with them. We like to talk through the phone app to troll each other. You can also pan the camera all the way around from the live view in the app to check the room.  Just a great little camera set up to have fun with and also have an added bit of security.Photo1 - Hitting the picture/still capture off the video in app.Photo2 - Night vision works really well!Photo3 - This is a screen cap of the whole app as you would see it in use viewing the cloud captured footage.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2020

Review Title: Pairing was always a pain, then stopped working < 6 months in
Review Text: It worked fine for <6 months before it just stopped being able to connect.When it worked- pic quality was good both for day and night.- Relatively easy to swipe ur phone to get camera angle moving- easy to record video and photos- generally quiet, some whirring noise when movingWhat was a pain:- pairing it is a huge pain. Review Title: Be wary of Nooie and its minimalistic packaging: It truly is minimalistic, even in its features!!
Review Text: Pros: appearance, decent 1080p quality (as seen on photo)Cons: dysfunctional 2-way audio/voice capacity (you can make out 2 seconds worth of speech through receiving audio but it is impossible to send intelligible messages due to choppy and disconnected interference), extremely slow movement of camera (you literally have to swipe multiple times—super labored— to get the camera to move 1cm every 3 swipes).We really wanted to love this set and purchased 4 cams to monitor our pet throughout the day. If you have a pet turtle or a pet snail, or even a sleeping baby, it might work. But this is definitely not for dogs and moving babies because the camera will not move fast enough even though it claims 360° coverage. If you don’t want to hear your pet/baby bark or cry, then this may just work because you can still hear them, but just not long enough since the audio is limited to 2-3 seconds at a time. If you ever want to talk to anyone through the camera, it’s better to forget the feature altogether. Our house is on 660mbps internet which is pretty fast and should not be the reason to such poor 2-way communication. For its beautiful minimalistic appearance, I wished so badly to keep all 4 units. I even purchased the Nooie doorbell cam and the power strip but now am having second thoughts of following through with this company... There are other brands out there that will be way more reliable for your purposes of monitoring your loved ones than Nooie.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2021

Review Text: Bought this on impulse as one of those 24hr deal things and it was so worth it. We use ours to keep an eye on the kids' pet rabbit. set up was a breeze and I didn't even realize it had night vision until it automatically switched when the light got too low.My only complaint would be that the camera is slow to respond when you try to move it via the app BUT that's a feature we rarely use anyway because I set up the camera in a way that I can see the whole bunny enclosure without moving. Good thing, too, because she HATES when it moves. So heads up, your pet might see it turning and FREAK OUT. She's used to it by now but she still doesn't really trust that it's not going to eat her. Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2020

Review Title: Only ONE viewer allowed at a time greatly reduces the value of an otherwise VERY superior product.
Review Text: If you have more than one person in your family who will actively be wanting to keep an eye on things, too bad. Since this is portrayed as a "baby monitor", let's imagine a strange, odd, almost unheard of scenario... One involving TWO people!  A mom.... and.....? A Dad!!!!  Whoa.... [Mind. Blown.]  I know, crazy right... Let me add to the Twilight Zone-esque atmosphere a little bit here... Let's imagine that BOTH of those humans want to keep an eye on baby at the same time. Too bad!  It's not going to happen!  If mom is at work and she wants to log in to the app so she can observe the baby from her office while dad has his mobile device with him in the kitchen as he prepares lunch for the other children in the family, HE will be kicked out of the app once mom logs in. Or conversely, if mom was logged in first, SHE will be kicked out when dad logs in.  As you see from the other stars given to the product, the picture quality is great 1080! The motion detection works very well and even is capable of automatically following movement! The IR night vision is quite clear. not full color, but it is IR, and as I said, it is VERY crisp and clear.  Those are all VERY VERY great features and attributes for this device.  But for me and MY needs / uses of the device, more than one person should be able to log in to view.  I can appreciate that, perhaps this is a security measure, albeit NOT a very good one, since it does NOT deter unwanted login, it merely kicks out the current user to allow the next person logging in access to view.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2021

Review Title: A Must Have for your Pet!
Review Text: The Nooie camera is awesome. Its picture quality is very clear and the included features such as 360 degrees view, night vision, and motion detection make it an excellent all-around baby or pet monitor. Additionally, you can speak through the microphone to get your subject's attention. The slight delay in audio pickup is only noticeable if you are using the 2-way audio in the same room as the camera. In our case, this camera has helped tremendously in training our new puppy. Since he likes to eat everything in sight, it's great to be able to check in on him as well as be alerted when he barks or makes any sudden movements. As far as design goes, the camera looks very modern and its simplicity makes it easy to pair with any style, not to mention the Nooie camera recently won Gold in Home Interior Products/Electronic Device Accessory & Platinum in Media and Home Electronics/Consumer electronics and cameras from the European Product Design Award™.All in all, a great investment for anyone with a baby or pet, and at less than $50, it's a bargain. Highly recommend!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 22, 2020

Review Text: Update:After posting my review, Nooie reached out to me and offered to either refund my money or send me an updated outdoor camera to try out. I opted for the outdoor camera. They did not want the indoor camera back, and truly seem to just want to make me happy and offset my losses with the previous camera. I look forward to trying the new camera. I have to say, I am very impressed with the company. I will be upgrading my review to a 4 star. The camera is still 3 star, but the company is 5, so 4 is a fair rating.A little background:  My 5 year old son is afraid of monsters. He is REALLY afraid of monsters. He is so afraid that he doesn’t ever play in his room. He has to be able to hear me and know that I can see him. I bought this to give him some peace of mind and give myself some peace (period).We put the camera in his room, connected it to the WiFi, and I got the app.At first, we both loved it. But unfortunately, that didn’t last long.For starters, the picture quality is great. That’s the only feature I have been fully satisfied with.My biggest complaint is the lag. Often times, he would say something to me, and I would respond, but my response was so laggy that, by the time it reached him, he had gotten scared that I could not hear him and ran out of his room to find me.It freezes CONSTANTLY.The field of view is not great. We had it on his dresser, and when he was sitting on the floor, I couldn’t see him. This could be remedied by mounting the camera, but the camera has to be plugged in to work, and the cord is not long enough to reach the outlet from a mounted position.The motion sensor works well in terms of detecting motion, but the motion tracking was lacking. The horizontal tracking seems to work well, but I don’t think it works vertically.We did not try the night vision because, camera and intercom or not, there’s absolutely zero chance he’s going in a dark room alone.Finally, we abandoned the camera idea for now, until I can buy a better quality product.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 18, 2020

Review Text: Ok. First I am not the kind of person usually putting bad reviews. I truly think that each one deserve a good feedback for the work they are putting into their products. But this one really deserves no stars.I will try to explain why.First everything is considered the price of the camera. I would probably not react this way if it was a 20 bucks camera. For once that I invest the price....i am pretty upset.The camera seems to be solid.The pairing system to the network works but could be improved. I am an IT engineer and I can tell that I needed 3 attempts for the pairing.You have to create an account to even use your camera.Ok now starting all the true desappointements:- when you switch the network then you loose all the sharing you did with other people (let's say one for you and one with your wife...), Very annoying.- they way that you can not share with someone to an other county, it is not said before you buy it or anywhere in the description. That is bad, knowing that if you ask to the other person to put US instead of the real country of residence, it works. So it makes no sense.-finally you can share with max 3 persons!!!???!!!!!! You (master account), your wife or husband, then only 2 other persons!! Why this limitation??!! Make no sense!Finally if the bandwidth is not big enough on the network, the camera will freeze and never allow to reconnect except after a reboot.The design is nice, field of view is ok....but for this price I expected way better on the app side. My 30 bucks Chinese camera is more flexible!

Review Title: DONNOT buy for baby camera. App has a long delay.
Review Text: You pay for what you get. Camera is cute and sleek. Mounting it to the wall is ok but not to see a whole room the cord isn’t long enough. The night vision is works well. The motion and sound detection has 3 settings( we live close to an airport so that worked well for us) unfortunately if your using this for your baby DONT! It has a 2-4 second delay. The app never opens in a timely manner so your better off getting up and checking on them instead of using the camera. It updates and says it’s improved but it just seems to take longer and longer. There’s times the app doesn’t even open. Installing was not that difficult but the app and camera took some time to respond to each other. It also kept shutting down before it was synched to each other and we had to do it all over like four times. Over all I wish we had spend more money on something worth the trouble. Would definitely not recommend to anyone.

Review Text: TL;DR :A) Video quality is actually really good, but the setup is extremely flawedB) The audio is horrible - you'll need to buy a separate audio monitorC) The software is barely usable (see below) - this was a much bigger deal than I realizedD) The integration with alexa is not easy and the video is delayedI've been trying to use this software for about a month and here's what that process looks like for me:Step 1: Open Nooie Software on my phone and realize they logged me out (no face recognition option)Step 2: Find super secure password to copy and paste into appStep 3: Open baby camera - wait for video to loadStep 4: Realize it isn't loading, force quit appStep 5: Open app again, enter password again - video now worksStep 6: Continue monitoring baby for about 30 - 45 minutes until video feed stalls indefinitely(note: there is no notification that video feed has stalled. If you're not paying attention, it isn't obvious!!)Step 7: Repeat from Step 1I've tried using the integration with Echo Show, but the video quality is degraded and very delayed. Plus, the Show is not mobile and it's very difficult to go about my day while checking on a low-quality monitor in another room. I definitely rely on the phone app much more, but the app is simply not developed to the point where it is easy to use (see above).
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2021

Review Title: Not too shabby, but it could be way better.
Review Text: Ok, so just got our Nooie 360. Got it on sale for 38$. For 38$, it's great. Pairing went just fine. Using 2.4GHz network. In fact, pairing went fine with 3 different devices connected to the same network. Also, unplugging Nooie and moving it around the house, also went pretty easy. So far, so good. Picture quality is so-so, more meh than ok, especialy in low light, but that goes for any camera (more or less). Controlling the camera via the app is slow and sluggish. Nothing to brag about, in other words.Now, the biggest problem this device has is its limited installation options. Sure, you can set it on a desk. Sure, you can mount it to the wall, with the lens facing down at a 90 degree angle. Sure, you could mount it on ceiling, but here's where troubles arise when it come to this device. Lens has a limited vertical movement span, meaning if you mount it to the ceiling, you won't be able to point the lens straight down, but rather at an angle. In our case, bassinet is in the middle of the room, so no matter where we place Nooie 360, we just can't get a good view of the bassinet. This could be remedied if Nooie offered a custom mount, maybe even one with a rotating/pivoting arm or something, but of course they don't. Which is as much of a bummer as it is a missed oportunity by the manufacturer. And I don't think Nooie's mount is standard one, again... bummer.  If manufacturer has any new mounting ideas, and if they work, we'll bump our rating. Thus far, 3/5. Recommended-ish.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 30, 2020

Review Text: At first this camera I liked, it gets the job done it lets me know when there’s noise the quality of the picture and video is good, BUT! When it comes to trying to connect to my other tablets such as iPad or Alexa tablets it looks so blurry so I don't recommend on big tablets. If your wifi sometimes struggle that’s an issue because it sometimes doesn’t tell you there’s poor internet connection and it remains frozen so it makes me think my baby is okay, and if your internet is not all that it sometimes a whole minute late of showing you what’s going on. There have been a few times where I had to check on my baby and leave the room it still shows that I’m in the room when in reality I’m not anymore so it would freak me out making me think there was someone else in there with her. But I’m not blaming the Nooie exactly on that my wifi does suck BUT! The one main thing I very much don’t like about this camera is the APP!!! It tends to log me out like perhaps 3 times a week! And it deletes the device so I have to redo everything all over again almost constantly !!! That’s what upsets me the most ! The APP is my biggest issue and it frustrates me all the time. I am now just going to get a camera that does not require an app and wifi.

Review Title: Good video quality, but the app is glitchy
Review Text: The video quality in both the light and dark are great. The setup took a long time because the camera wouldn't sync with my phone and I had to look up instruction online. Eventually it did link, but the app is really glitchy. It signs me out at least once a week, which means when my baby is making a noise and I go to check the monitor, it asks me for my login credentials. It also disconnects or unlinks the camera from the app, so you have to go reset it and go through the whole setup again in the middle of the night. Obviously, this defeats the purpose of having a monitor. The app is also very slow to load - I could often walk downstairs to her room faster than it takes for the app to load. Finally, when you attempt to use the voice feature, the app stops working completely and just loads continually. I have an iPhone 12 and the fastest high speed internet available in my area, so it is not a phone or wifi issue. I like the portability of having the feed on my phone, but I wish it was faster and would stop constantly logging me out.UPDATE: Nooie contacted me and refunded me because I wasn’t fully satisfied with the purchase. Very impressed with their customer service and they seemed to take the feedback on the app seriously!

Review Title: Worked great for 6 months but now it quits working frequently!
Review Text: I really like this camera — picture quality is good (not good enough to see baby breathing, if you’re paranoid like I am you’ll find yourself checking on them with your own eyes), the night vision is really good, the app works well, you can move the camera around on the app, I really liked it for the first six months! But now it keeps quitting — I’ll go to the app to check on the baby and it either says it’s not plugged in, not connected to WiFi, or just shows a black screen. At first I tried restarting the camera, restarting my router, removing the camera from the app and reconnecting it, and nothing worked. Then I sent a support message on the app and only then did it start working again, so they must be able to fix it remotely. Now when it stops working that is what I do and it usually starts working again within a business day. It’s happening more frequently lately so I’ve requested a refund as the camera is still under warranty. Hopefully they’re cooperative!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2020

Review Title: DO NOT need to buy Amazon Echo Show 5 to use camera
Review Text: I primarily use this camera as a baby monitor and it has helped a lot! Reason why I'm giving it 4 stars is because it doesn't have an instruction manual. I learned (the hard way) that you do not need to purchase the Amazon Echo Show 5 and that you can have more than one phone to access the camera.I don't recommend for those of you to purchase the Amazon Echo Show 5 because the camera does not continuously stay on the monitor, especially if you want continuous monitoring at night. After about a couple of minutes, it will return to turn the home screen and you have to repeat the command again to show the camera. So if you want continuous monitoring, especially for babies or kids, I highly recommend to not purchase the Amazon Echo Show 5.You can have more than one phone access the camera by going to the main account that the camera is already calibrated to on the Nooie app, select the camera, and select the settings at the top right. There's an option for the main account to share it with other users who have a Nooie account. To share, have the other user download the Nooie app and create an account. Once that's done, just enter the email address of the other user and the other user will have to accept the invitation within the app. Once the invitation has been accepted, the camera should show on the home screen of the app. That's it!If you're worried that the camera won't stay on on your phone, especially at night, it does. Just make sure you're also charging your phone while the camera is on as it will drain your phone battery since your phone will stay on.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 9, 2020

Review Text: Tried to set up the product and I had a very difficult time getting it to pair. After multiple failed attempts it finally connected. We then had an issue with the firmware update. Review Title: Surprisingly great camera, app could use some tweaking
Review Text: I purchased this camera based on the reviews and features vs price - overall I'm VERY impressed with this camera. The night vision is surprisingly good, the regular daytime quality is very good to excellent, and the sound quality is pretty solid. The ability to pan/tilt/zoom is also great. Overall, I'm a big fan of this camera. Easy to set up, and so far it has worked reliably.There are a few negatives, but they don't greatly diminish the benefits:(1) The app could be more user friendly. You don't have the ability to open the app and go directly to your active camera, you have to select a camera to view even if you only have one. In addition, getting to the settings - specifically motion and sound detection - requires several steps before you can adjust them.(2) The motion detection is REALLY sensitive, even at its lowest level and with the detection zone limited. Moreover, it alerts CONSTANTLY if my daughter is moving around, even when I have the app open and I'm watching the feed. Sound detection is also pretty sensitive, but less annoyingly than the motion.(3) I haven't used the SD card feature, but if you want to use cloud storage, there's a monthly charge. It's not much, and I'm not deducting from the rating because most cameras charge for cloud storage.(4) The camera works well on my Google Home Hub. However, one feature I was expecting that isn't available is casting to Chromecast or another service like my Roku. I don't know if it's a problem with the app or with Chromecast, but I would LOVE to be able to cast this to the TV instead of to my Home Hub.Overall, I'd give this 4.25-4.5 stars. Highly recommended, and it would be damn near perfect if they'd revamp the app.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 9, 2021

Review Text: 1. This ONLY works with 2.4ghz routers. If you have a mesh router that flips between 2.4 and 5, this will NOT work.2. Your wifi password can only contain English letters and numbers (so no special characters like - or &, etc), so unless you're prepared to change your wifi password, look elsewhere.I spent 3 hours trying to set up this camera and in the process had to reset my router, clear my browser's cookies and cache, change my wifi password (much to the, uh, delight of my teen who is trying to get homework done online), reset the camera no less than 20 times, restart my computer, restart my router, restart my phone, download and delete the app no less than 6 times, and much, MUCH more.  And it is STILL not working.I'm no dummy about setting wifi devices up, but this one is NOT worth the time, money, and frustration.  Definitely look elsewhere if you want a wifi camera.

Review Title: Great camera for the price, love pan & tilt & noise notification
Review Text:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   I bought this camera to replace a Blink camera we have set up to watch over our dog that recently had surgery. I like the pan & tilt option as well as noise alerts. Motion detection is great and it follows the motion. Night vision and picture quality is comparable to our other cameras. My dislikes: the only way to look at recordings is either to add an SD card or subscribe to their cloud which is more than the current subscription we pay for. The integration with Alexa is not as easy to set up as other cameras and occasionally does not respond as expected but I think that's related to the skill. It DOES work well on both the Alexa Show 8 & 5. You can 'share' the camera with someone but they must make their own account under a different email address or it will sigma out the other user which is a little frustrating as others do not work that way if you have a joint email account for specific situations like this. The instructions could be more detailed but it's easy enough to figure out. The camera comes with a mount but we just have it sitting on a table and it works well this way.  Overall it's worth the money but get an SD card when making your purchase or plan on the subscription.

Review Text: UPDATE: i made another account so i can share this camera with my phone so now i get notifications on my phone for movement while i have the app already open on my ipad. Which we are getting an echo show (original reason why i even bought this specific camera) & i feel better about it this way bc my main thing was if my child moved & i couldn’t see it right awake bc it had to load then there’s no point bc i could just check on him by walking over. Review Title: Camera picture good...App not so much.
Review Text: I bought this camera to alert me at night if my elderly father gets up in the night.  He started falling after a recent stroke and it became necessary after a couple falls in the night to alert me if he's getting up.  It's also nice to be able to keep an eye on him as I do other things around the house.Setup for me was a snap and I had it up and running in about 5 minutes from the time I took it out of the box.  The camera picture is very good during the day and decent at night.  The night view is good but certainly is not as crisp as I would like it but 1080p can only do so good at night. The ability to move the camera around from the app is nice but it would be nice to be able to lock the camera in place via the app as to not move it accidentally.  I accidentally move it frequently when getting texts and other notifications while in the app.  Long story  short the camera itself does a pretty good job of doing what it's suppose to.  The cord is quite short so if your mounting high, have an outlet near or be prepared with an extension cord.Now the app.  Where do I start.  It's functional but how good depends on your needs.  I'll break down my issues each on it's own paragraph, app and camera.There is no supported option to view this on the web from PC.  There is however a work around.  Download BlueStacks to your PC which is an Android emulator.  Set it up with your Google account so you can download from the Play store.  Download the Nooie app and create a NEW account with a NEW email or other email you already have. It just shouldn't be the same as the original email you have the cameras registered to.  You can use the original email but you can only be logged in on 1 device at a time.  A new account keeps you logged in on all devices.  Follow the signup steps then invite yourself from the primary account.  I know it's a pain but it works.  iOS also has a emulator. I'm not familiar with those since I'm an Android user but it's an option for Apple users.The biggest problem for me is not all motion is detected and alerted.  I use the bathroom in the night and I enter the camera viewing area well inside the view area.  The camera does not send a motion alert when I walk through which takes about 5 seconds from the first sign of me on the camera.  This is on low and medium sensitivity but it should still detect an entire body moving.  I'm not a small person. Ultimately I don't need it too right now and it still detects and alerts to my father if he gets up or even rolls over in his sleep as he is mostly centered in the camera view. My needs will eventually change what I use these cameras for so that's a negative for me.I want it to record to SD card continuously until I stop the recording and it doesn't.  Everytime I open the app it stops recording.  I need to start recording again before leaving the app.  Sometimes I forget and it's really annoying.If I need to review past recordings it's a real pain.  It gives a timeline by date and you have to go into the date and scroll to  find what your looking for which can be a pain depending what your looking for.  If your looking for something and don't know the date it recorded... May god help you in your quest to find it.On a positive note if you get an alert you can view the alerts from WITHIN the app inbox and have it take you to what caused the alert.  This is ONLY if you were recording.  I suspect a lot of people don't know that from some of the bad reviews I read.  I found this when I had a moth flying by the camera setting off motion alerts (even on low sensitivity).  It had to fly right in front of the lense to set it off.  Flying 3 feet in front of it didn't at low sensitivity.  If you have alerts by sound detection then this will be more difficult for reasons mentioned below...unless the reason is a loud one.The ability to share the camera view with others is a really nice feature.  My father is getting home hospice care and it's nice to have family be able to give themselves piece of mind by checking in on him... especially the one that lives out of state and can't be here.  The company states they can't adjust the camera but they definitely can move it.  This is a big problem for me. They cannot adjust the settings but I have had to fix the view from them accidentally moving it many  times.  This would be another reason to be able to lock the position of the camera from within my app as the owner.  It would also be nice for them to be able to control their own alerts with their app.  Right now they are stuck with how I (as the owner) have it setup for me.The 2 way audio is lacking for me.  A family member was standing  5 feet in front of the camera and couldn't hear what I was saying to them, only that I was saying something.  I don't talk softly so the built in speaker is a negative for me.  The microphone is lacking as well but is more functional than the speaker.  Room noise from anything more than 5 feet is not great.  I was talking to a nurse 4 feet in front of the camera and my family watching could hear good but hearing the TV at 12ft is VERY faint, tinny and not distinguishable, even at a decent volume.  Take that for what it's worth for your situation.A missing feature that would be nice is being able to set a motion detection area for alerting.  I was hoping this app would  do that (not stated it does) but it doesn't.I'll update as I think of other things, these were just off the top of my head.  I just ordered another camera for another room even with my issues as now is not the time to reshop for a new brand of camera I would be happier with.  The camera serves its primary purpose but it could do so much better with work to the app.  I'll update for a 2 camera setup if needed but for now I would not recommend this camera.UPDATE2 camera setup has all the goods and bad mentioned for both cameras.  I moved the primary camera watching my father to 5ft away from where he sleeps instead of 12ft away and false/no alerts are much better.  So apparently alerts are only reliable within 5 or 6 feet of the motion.I upgraded to the latest beta software to try and make things better and now I have connection problems.  Sometimes it's slow to load video and sometimes it doesn't load at all.  If your having connection problems then unsubscribe from being a beta tester in Google play and reimstall to see if it helps.UPDATE 2Ok I'm done.  1 of the cameras now disconnect randomly and needs to be unplugged and plugged back in to reset it to get it to work again.  I wasn't wanting to find new cameras now but Nooie is just not cutting it so I will upgrade to a 2k camera from another company to provide the night details I would prefer and also get a more reliable camera..  The negatives are now drowning out the positives.  Reducing to 2 stars.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2020

Review Title: I liked it so much I got a second
Review Text: Pros: Almost everything about this camera is perfect- it has excellent picture clarity, a really decent app, it's affordable, and it picks up on motion and sound perfectly. I asked for this camera for my new baby (my last VTech baby monitor was over $100 USD and didn't even last 2 years before it started to short circuit) and I liked it so much I got a second for our living room and when we travel. I love how easy it was to set up and it has a fantastic roughly 350 degree view. Overall, I'm happy with these cameras and I use them daily. I also love you can buy an SD card instead of a monthly fee. The microphone is fantastic and I can use it as a mini intercom system with my husband when I need his help. The night vision is incredible and works better than anything I've ever seen. It auto turns to color in the daytime and it is crystal clear. You can pinch and zoom- and even manually turn the camera to look at things, which is great as well.Cons: so far, here are my concerns after using them daily for about 2 months: 1) the sound and volume on the app is almost totally non-existent. When my baby cries, I can't hear it barely at all when everything is turned all the way up and the sound icon is highlighted. I could whisper louder than the sound plays on my Google pixel phone- which can fill a full room with sound on the big speakers on the bottom. I entirely have to rely on the notifications saying a noise was detected because I can't hear anything. 2) I used one camera as a mini security while I was away for the weekend and it only lasted for about 12 hours before it stopped showing a screen. The camera occasionally needs to be unplugged and reset by hand (I've had to do it about 4 times in the 2 months so far)- and that happened while I was away making it totally ineffective as a home security camera. 3) when using this away from home, say while traveling in vacation, it's not easy to switch internet. You basically have to reinstall the camera each time (and pray they have a 2.4 internet speed connection because it can't connect to a 5 internet speed) which is a total pain... Because then you have to go home and reinstall it AGAIN.Overall: I really enjoy this camera a lot but there are some pretty annoying flaws that I wish would be fixed by the app developers. I will still recommend it because it's affordable and works decently well.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 19, 2021

Review Text: We used this product for 2 and a half months but the important things to note is that this thing is SLOW. It takes a REALLY long time to buffer. At the time of writing, we are getting 4 FPS. Sure some times we get towards 30 FPS but the do not expect a smooth live stream of your baby. Why the 1 star? Today we noticed that our baby was screaming and we didn't get the notification on the APP that our baby was moving or screaming. Luckily we live in a pretty small house but it made us feel pretty bad because if we had the TV louder or had headphones in then we wouldn't have known our baby was up and screaming. Would not recommendEdit: we have noticed this product having more and more issues with not notifying us. Makes us wonder how many times we missed our baby crying. Would not recommend

Review Text: First off, when this thing is working well it's pretty damn good. Review Text: We tried for hours to get this up and running, but it kept giving an error that it could not connect to WiFi. I triple-checked to make sure we were on 2.4ghz and not 5G. Sending it back.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 29, 2019

Review Title: Update not so great! GREAT Baby cam/Puppy Cam/Security Cam - I'm using to monitor puppy
Review Text: Updated review:Really disappointed in the camera now. I have not been able to use it at all because it just spins. Nooie is saying it's my wifi, but it's not. We have it on a 2.4ghz router and it is very unpredictable. We get an image, then it hangs up... spins, catches up, spins...it's unuseable!!  Makes me mad because I need this!! I really loved this camera but  the latest software updates made it no longer work  if they can't get this fixed it's going in the trash and I'll be out $50 :(.This is really a great camera system!  I bought this camera so I could hear if my puppy was crying in the other room when in her crate/playpen.  Works fantastic!  You can set it to notify on sound or motion detection or both and that feature works very very well.  I am able to talk to or correct the puppy with the 2-way voice as well.  You can control the camera from your cell phone and move it around too!  I also like that you can turn off the camera light indicator so that no one knows tha that camera is on and recording.  The puppy was seeing the light come on and that would gain her interest...also a GREAT feature if you use it for a security camera, which we will when the puppy is grown.  I bought a 128 sd card and that is plenty of storage.  You can purchase the cloud storage fro $5/mo but I don't see the need for that and perfer to not have my video stored in the cloud.  It's plugged in to an outlet and not battery op (HUGE plus)..  I have the BLINK system and use those cameras to monitor the animals in the barn (no electricity there), and had purchased an indoor camera to use to monitor indoors.  The Nooie is far superior to the blink camera...so much so that I will be purchasing more of these to monitor my home for security.  The picture quality is better, app software is better, electric and not battery,...Another GREAT feature is my husband and I can both be in the app monitoring the camera at the same time.  Easy to setup too.  All around great device that I'm very happy I purchased.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2019

Review Title: Good picture quality. Not great for seeing inside a crib due to lack of different mounting angles
Review Text: The camera itself works pretty well. I like that it tracks motion and sends notifications for sounds and motion. Picture quality is pretty good too. We had some difficulty with set up at first but we got it figured out. For the most part it meets our needs. Our biggest problem we have with it is the fact that we are unable to mount it at an angle to see both the inside of the crib as well as the rest of the room. It’s not entirely 360 degrees in its movability. It does turn all the way around horizontally, but does not have a very wide range of motion vertically. Because of this, it is hard to look down inside of a crib when you have it sitting on a shelf or mounted on the ceiling. If you mount it on the wall where it sticks sideways, you can only see inside the crib and not the rest of the room. Having an angled mount would solve these problems, but they do not make one and it is not compatible with any of the universal mounts. Overall this was a huge disappointment for us. We had to do our own makeshift mount out of wood to mount it at an angle.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 22, 2020

Review Title: Great little camera for remote check ins
Review Text: I purchased this product to replace a baby monitor that frequently disconnects. I like that I can check on my child from anywhere, even if I’m not home. The picture quality is great, much better than the monitor I’m used to. Night vision is also really great! I like the motion following function although I hardly use it now, I anticipate using it when we switch to a toddler bed. It’s also great to be able to talk to my child if she’s having a hard time sleeping then I don’t always have to go in her room. A couple things that I might change: make it easier to switch the camera to a new WiFi. It takes forever to set up and  if you’re away visiting grandma you’re spending 10 minutes setting up the camera for a nap for 1 day. You should be able to save multiple wifi since some people even have more than 1 router in their house. The other thing I would change is the loud start up noise! It’s not a beep it’s like a nice like melody but it comes every time it is plugged in and could potentially wake a sleeping baby if power was lost and reconnected during the night. We haven’t had the problem but some might like to know that this is a possibility. But overall, a great value and I’m very happy with the purchase!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2020

Review Text: First off, this camera took over an hour of repeating steps to even get it set up because it wouldn’t work. We finally got it activated and it worked great, but would only let you access the camera from one device at a time. The app kept logging me out and I kept having to log back in daily, which now I assume was from it being logged into on another device (not my own).  One night I was in my daughters room laying her down for bed and a man’s voice started talking from the camera and the camera was facing right at us. I instantly unplugged it and took it out of her room. I feel so gross thinking about someone hacking into this camera that was in my girls’ room and watching them!!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2021

Review Text: I could say so much about this thing! First of all, this is actually a really good monitoring camera for the price. I have it in my living room for a variety of reasons. Baby watching while cleaning since I have 3 floors, keep and eye on a 4 year old who likes to sneak into stuff, animals, and just security when gone.So before I get into the good, I have one bad. The app isn’t total trash but I wish moving the camera direction was a little bit easier. Other than that, I have no issues with the app either. I was able to share the camera device with my partner on his own account so we can both watch. But the method of turning your camera in any direction is annoying. You have to swipe up, down, left, or right on the video feed and it can be a bit of a hassle sometimes.Other than that one thing, I’ve had no issues with setup or anything! Pretty easy process. Simple app format (other than motion change). Night vision is actually pretty good and clear even when zooming in a bit. The clarity when it’s not using night vision is also surprisingly good for the price of this camera. I honestly wasn’t expecting that.So with it being a 360 motion camera, it has two extra options in the app. You can have motion sensor on and sound detection. The motion detection is pretty cool and I turn it on when I’m not home so keep an eye on my animals. It will alert you if it senses motion with a notification on your phone and also when you open the app to view the camera, it will follow the motion in the room. It’s not perfectly but it keeps up with my 4 year old so I’ll give it credit. The sound detection is actually pretty cool too. Again, it’s not perfect because it’s not an expensive camera but if you don’t have a tv on or loud background noise, it picks up baby crying and small noises like when my dogs were bumping into stuff and playing. Again, it will send alerts to your phone if in that mode. I have to turn sound detection off when I have the tv on though because I’ll get notifications like crazy.I guess that could be a con but it doesn’t bother me because I can turn it off and I would rather get all those notifications if I’m not home and be able to know when something is going on than not. But yeah, great camera for the price!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2021

Review Text: First and foremost this is NOT a baby monitor - I purchased this to keep an eye on my mother as she is elderly and her mind is wandering.  This will not work, for that or as a baby monitor.  I only purchased it because it came up in the search for a "baby monitor"  It is in actuality, an indoor security camera similar to a ring but no where near as good.  Benefits that it is Alexa compatible and works on iPhone for away from home viewing.  I purchased this after the monitor I had was just too small of a viewing screen - screen size obviously is much bigger as it is both on my Alexa and my phone, but the night vision is very bad.  The nigh vision on Alexa is even worse (Alexa echo show 5) Two photos one from my phone and the other from Alexa - can not even zoom in clearly on the Alexa, zoom is much better on phone.  The other issue with this is the sound quality - it picks up loud noises but not much else.  Not a good choice as a baby/elder monitor.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2021

Review Title: Worked well until they newest update - now it’s worthless
Review Text: I had this cam for less then a year and we absolutely loved it! It worked well every time, was so easy to set up and the app gave us no issues whatsoever.Then about a month ago they came out with a new “update” that actually forced me to delete the original app and download the new one. The cam itself went through a software update as well when I first connected it with the new app. It worked fine the first 2-3 days and then suddenly it will NOT pair with any of my devices. It’s been about a week now and I’ve still been unsuccessful in getting it to work. After it reads the QR code it fails to go to a steady white light indicating it is ready to pair...At one point it did go to the pairing page... but then after 40mins of it saying it was pairing it gave me the ‘failed to pair’ notice.So this camera I once would’ve recommended to just about anyone who asked, is now absolutely worthless. I don’t know what the update was for but whatever it was it destroyed the cam. I’m shopping around for another one now.... I’m going to see what the company is willing to do and I will update.

Review Text: I wanted to give it sometime before I reviewed this monitor. We’ve currently been using it for 6 months. I honestly have no complaints. The only times I’ve had issues with the camera is if my Wi-Fi was being  crazy(thanks Verizon). Other than that it’s been smooth sailing. I know others have complained about the night vision cutting out, but it’s as simple as sync the time with the app in your settings. I was really critical of the baby monitor I chose and ended up spending $200+ twice on monitors that just simply didn’t work. Like right out the box, nothing. So after that we decided to go with something cheap and hope for the best and that’s where we found success.

Review Title: The APP is its downfall (Update: turns out it was my phone!)
Review Text: The cameras themselves are great. Super easy to setup; the picture quality is great and so is the night vision! Love the two-way audio function. Now the bad part. When you are out and about, it is hit or miss if your phone will connect via the app.  Half the time, all you get is the pulsing Nooie N on screen waiting to connect (even though the individual cams show good wifi connection). When it does connect, the controls for movement are super large, and/ or drops. When it works it is awesome!  In good faith, however, I wouldn't recommend this system until they fix the issues with the app. Especially, if your buying this to keep an on a baby sitter, or any care giver that is working in your home taking care of your loved ones.Update 7-16-21: Changed from 3 to 4 ☆. Just got a new phone (Galaxy S21 Ultra), and the issue of the app not connecting has gone away. Looks like it was on my end with an older phone (Galaxy S9). To the company's credit, they did offer one of the following options to rectify the issue: full refund,  replacement camera(s) or outdoor cam. In all good conscious, I will not take them up on their generous offer. It was an issue on my end.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2021

Review Text: My 20 month old has asthma so I put his toddler bed in our room so I could keep an eye out and give him his rescue inhaler the moment he needs it. But he sleeps the best in his own room. As a mom, it's hard to be away when he could have an asthma attack.  This camera notifies me whenever there is movement and I can clearly hear his coughs, which is a precursor to his attacks. I can clearly see his face and the camera automatically follows any movement, in case he gets up from his bed.We both now sleep better knowing that I can see and hear him whenever he needs me.He even walks up to the camera (that sits on his dresser) and waits for me to come (no crying). It gives us both peace of mind.When I leave early for work, I can still monitor him and watch my husband get him dressed.The camera also has a microphone.  So I can tell my son to go back to bed, or tell my husband which socks to put on to match my son's outfit.We know that mom's run the home and this allows me to keep everyone safe and together.When we get a larger house, I plan to get a couple more.Two negatives,  it buffers sometimes and both me and my husband can't view the camera on separate devices.

Review Title: They watch over you, spy on you and record your babies and you with this camera !!!
Review Text: I will start by telling that we bought it for our couple's room, the one we share with our newborn.  Suddenly I began to see pictures of myself on my cell phone taken from my monitor, in the room with my baby.  Days later I noticed how the camera moved by itself. To focus, I entered the application to see what happened, but it was nothing, just me in the same place.  I mentioned this to my husband but he told me that he had movement so I let it pass (it should be clarified he was disabled).  Last week I had in my tray two photos of me in my underwear on my cell phone taken from the monitor, I thought that I had taken it from capture and again I let it pass.  Yesterday my mother-in-law took care of the baby at night and tells us in the morning that the camera moved completely from where she had it.  Today my husband and I were in the Bedolla and out of nowhere he began to move to focus.  To finish soon, my husband told me what was happening and I told him all the times that happened to me and I showed him the photos which were never screenshots.  (I never took the time to check whether or not they were captures, I just took it for granted but when reviewing that album) all the photos were taken from the monitor.  I believed that this only happened in movies.  This camera is a danger ⚠️ please do not buy your babies are in danger of child pornography or worse.
