Review Title: Not great as a baby monitor
Review Text: Picture quality is great so if you only want it for that then cool.I didn't really try out the motion capture but wanted to know how this would work with baby 2 on the way.The speaker quality is awful, we usually have white noise on and it fades in and out from the camera mic.The app is also not very great considering that's how you interact with it.You can view multiple cameras but you don't get the sound, screen must be on in order to get the sound. Other apps for baby cameras let you turn the sound off.Overall I think I could use it for basic pet monitoring, but I wouldn't use it for babies.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2021

Review Text: This is a product that looks very polished, and its performance is very good (particularly considering its very reasonable price).  Besides the Nooie, we also have an 8-camera security surveillance system which is NOT HD quality, but pretty good SD.  When my wife first saw the video that the Nooie produced, she kept exclaiming how CLEAR the picture was! The other features that it has are also very impressive.Setup was a breeze.  The only issue I had was that I selected the 1080P option when setting up the camera in the app, when I should have selected the 360. Once I figured that out, the camera and app were ready to go in about 2 minutes.  So far the app has performed very well.  About the only suggestion I would have for the developer is to discontinue CONSTANTLY asking the user to upgrade the camera firmware.  I’m of the opinion that ”if it ain’t broke, don’t fix it”, so I am not interested in taking on the risk of fouling up the operation of a device which so far works well.The motion tracking feature works pretty well. It even tracks my cat well.  Manual pan and tilt through the app is a bit laggy as some reviewers have reported, but it’s not terrible.  The motion of the pan and tilt is very smooth and very quiet. I’ve seen similar cameras in which the movement was pretty loud, particularly though the camera’s mic.I also like the loop recording to the SD card. I threw in a 32 GB card and used about 5.2 Gigs in 17 hours, so a little less than a third of a Gig per hour. That should give me a little over 4 days of recording before new data starts to overlay the older footage. Perhaps future versions of the app will have an option to only record footage to the card when motion is detected?All in all I am extremely satisfied with the Nooie 360, and definitely would recommend it to others!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 6, 2019

Review Title: Great camera, but crap for monitoring.
Review Text: TL:DR- Great video quality, crappy notification system.The only redemption of this camera is the video quality, which is great, especially if you're just using it to check in on your kid playing by himself in another room. If you plan on using this for a night time monitor, I don't recommend it. You can technically leave the app constantly running, showing you the live feed, but unless you leave your phone on the charger and don't go into other apps, you don't get to have constant access to the camera. Instead of a constant live stream that you can leave on, like other monitors, you have to open the app whenever you get a notification about movement or sound and sometimes doesn't connect to the feed. It never notifies me when my 4yr old gets out of bed at 3am or is crying. But for some reason, will send multiple alerts 15min after leaving his room for story time that there was motion/sound detected. It will even alert me to movement when there's nobody home. I have done jumping jacks in front of the camera and still received no alerts. If it comes unplugged, you have to go through the WHOLE set up process again. Definitely wouldn't recommend this.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2022

Review Text: Purchased for baby monitoring but could be used for more. This camera is everything we’re missing in our bottom of the line home security system.There is significant delay with audio, and it would be nice to have a web portal to log in for a dedicated machine to give visual output, rather than having to keep opening the app on a mobile device to check in on baby. Picture quality is fine and it supports at least 1TB microSD, which is more than plenty of space for this reasonable quality video. Night vision is also surprisingly clear.Adding users leaves them with fewer permissions so it may not be idea if both/all parental partners are tech-inclined and like to tinker, but it’s actually a plus for giving others access–ensures they don’t mess up your settings. App has a sleek and highly usable user interface, especially compared to a lot of other similar devices on the market.Perhaps the best feature is that it takes micro USB power supply, so a $10 battery pack makes this usable all over the house. Disconnect/reconnect from power supply only takes about 10 seconds to resync with phone app. Pleasantly surprised at the versatility.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2021

Review Text: I have a Galaxy S10+ and a decent internet connection using an airport express for the wifi (generally, the wifi from your modem won't work as well) and this thing works GREAT for my setup. It moves towards the motion or sound and when you go to check the camera, what you need to see is already on screen! I haven't experienced any noticeable lag, it moves well and sounds great! I replaced a more expensive camera with this one as this one works flawlessly comparatively. The one I had before cost over $100 and had all sorts of features but they did not work well, and it was a battery hog when running in the background. I don't notice a difference with the Nooie cam. The night vision is spectacular! I checked in our sleeping newborn last night and was able to see her a momma sleeping away, clearly! I use this as a supplement to my dedicated baby monitor, plus I can check this when on the road or out and about. I love this and am SO happy I purchased it! I had no problems setting it up or using it. Just remember, this is a new camera using new techology with a HD connection. Everything will be affected if you have an old phone, a slow internet connection, poor wireless or a bad modem. This wouldn't be the fault of the device, it would be on the consumer to optimize their environment for HD wifi cameras; they aren't magic. With optimized everything, I have to say that I love this camera!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 6, 2019

Review Title: Pretty good camera and customer support seems ok
Review Text: I wanted a way to watch my home without having to pay a storage provider and this camera is what I found.Pros:- Inexpensive and mostly easy to setup.- Movement tracking and recording is pretty good and can spot, track and record moving objects in the cameras view.- Uses local micro USB cards for video storage for when you have an incident and need video evidence.- Supports on-going software updates with minimal user intervention. (Could be good or bad.)- Clarity seems good. Have a look at the picture I included with this review. Probably won’t be able to read a license plate at distance.- Night vision uses powerful infrared (I think) lights to illuminate dark areas but won’t project out more than 20 feet but that’s good. They work in the dark.- Customer support is responsive, even months after a purchase but they seem to delay useful responses with information that doesn’t lead to a solution. (Like half answers. Maybe it’s a language barrier.)- Provides sound and visual movement detection and recording for events.Cons:- Setup can be tricky if you run multiple wireless access points at home and aren’t on the same network. (Won’t work)- My SD card was full of empty videos of nothing happening and seemed to trigger for no reason, leading to many useless videos and a full SD card. (I think they overwrite older videos but I need to verify that.)- Left to right motors may fail after a short period of time.- Nagware tries to get you to purchase their cloud storage in tricky ways like masquerading buttons for buying their service.- Cameras are often unresponsive, even when on the same wireless network locally and lag out.- Night vision won’t work through a window. No surprises, just the nature of reflective glass and IR lights.Was running a wireless packet capture to see if the camera was talking more than necessary to a remote server, possibly gathering information about my activities or exporting our videos to them but didn’t see anything unusual yet.I guarantee that if I uncover evidence that this camera spies on us and reports back to some station somewhere, I will post it here. I hate that.They do check for software updates, that’s common but I haven’t witnessed undue network activities to outside my local wireless network yet.Anyhow, these are a good solution for monitoring your home if you’re away or obtaining evidence around your home automatically through the motion and sound detecting.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2021

Review Text: Updated May 2021: I changed changed me review from 3 stars to 5. I would do 4 1/2 if it let me. Like I said in my original review, the video is amazing quality! After some great customer service they sent me out a replacement camera and told me they updated their app and software to help fix the audio and connection issues. After testing it out for a few days I can say the Audio and connection has greatly improved. It is no longer choppy and works great. I would take half a star off if I could, due to the 2 way audio still being delayed and choppy but that is not a feature that I need for an inside camera. So it is not a big deal.For the price I would for sure recommend this camera! I am glad the audio and connection issues have been improved. This now would make a great baby monitor.Original ReviewThe camera has amazing quality and I love how it can tilt, rotate, and zoom, but sadly I had to return it. I wanted to use it as a baby monitor and the sound was horrible. It was choppy and would be useless for hearing a baby cry. The 2 way communication was also choppy. It also lost connection several times briefly while testing it out. To bad since the camera quality is so great. If your just needing it for video than it could make a great camera.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2021

Review Text: Honestly, I wasn't expecting much, I actually had another brand's camera set up before this one, but I kept running into some connectivity issues and then finally realized that it could not be set up with Alexa at all.Well, I finally had the chance to set this one up after realizing that this could be used with Alexa, and wow...for 1/3rd the price, it had way more features than the other hoot cam. I mean, yeah, it doesn't have a temperature readout, but honestly, I have enough temp sensors and other things that can read temps, so it's not a loss at all.But really, other than being able to use this with Alexa, the ability to record and/or take pictures is a HUGE plus. How is this feature not in every single camera at all? Also, you can add an SD card to record locally if you so desire versus your phone instead. It also has cloud storage (paid) if you want/need that.Do NOT hesitate, this is a great baby cam (or however you want to use it!)
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2021

Review Text: Sent the unit back. What we wanted was a baby monitor and this doesn’t fit the use.  The only way to “monitor” you sleeping baby is to have the app open on your phone, draining your battery. You can have sound and motion detection turned on, but it comes as a notification to you phone or tablet.  What they don’t tell you is to get the advanced features, you have to pay a monthly subscription fee. We wound up buying just an old style audio monitor that also acts as an intercom. The units picture quality was fine, but controlling the movement of the camera is difficult and frustrating.  Nooie has a lot of room for improvement on this one.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2020

Review Title: Worked for a little over two months on echo show, then just completely stopped.
Review Text: We have been using this camera for almost three months now, and other than the occasional lost connection that we'd have to restart, it worked fairly well. We had to do a reset of the camera, our phone and echo show connected to it a few weeks ago, but other than that issue we haven't really had much to complain about. Out of nowhere, two nights ago, the echo just lost complete connection to the camera and now says "the camera isn't responding." We use it as a baby monitor, so this was very unexpected and has changed how we can watch her.We have reset the camera three times so far, as well as completely disconnected it to Amazon altogether and restarted everything. Our internet was recently upgraded in the last month as well, but that didn't help the occasional connection loss. We reset the router too just in case. So far, nothing has worked. I reached out to customer service via email and as of right now they have just said to reset the camera which I've told them I have already done. I'm still able to use the camera on my phone, but we viewed it to check on her on the echos quite a bit so I am at a loss and hope they will help me resolve the issue or fix my camera. Will update my review if this gets resolved.4/7 - So far still happening, and the only response I've been left with was to show a video of the problem after they told me to reset the camera. I'm quite frustrated with this waste of $50.5/11 - This camera is a complete waste of money IF you are trying to use it with an Echo Show. I can use it on my phone but it gives us constant problems on the show. Spend a bit more on something reliable.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2021

Review Text: I was on the market for a baby monitor, and stumbled across this camera as a Lightning Deal. It seemed too good to pass up: a really good camera (with night vision!), motion tracking, and sound detection -- all at a really good price. I went ahead and ordered it, with the thought that I might eventually order a few more, possibly for the outside of my home.When it arrived, I was eager to tear into the box and get it set up. It requires a wireless connection, and I assumed it would be pretty easy to set up. (I was wrong.) You have to first download the Nooie app, and from there, you pair the camera to your wifi network. I have multiple devices across my home, and none gave me NEARLY as much trouble as this. You are given a QR code for the camera to scan, and from there, the camera searches for a wifi signal. I spent almost 45 minutes trying to get it set up. (I even set the camera beside the router, and it still didnt connect.) After consulting YouTube, and finally getting lucky, the camera connected with a loud, but pleasant chime. I opened the app, and saw the camera. I was pleasantly surprised with the quality of the video. I could pinch to zoom, control the direction of the camera from my phone, use the microphone to speak, connect to the cloud (or record locally with a SD Card), and I even had the option to set up motion alerts for when I was away. It checked every box for me.The next day, when I was away from home, I opened the app just to see what was going on, and the camera feed never loaded. I waited and waited, but the feed never loaded. I closed the app, tried it again, and much of the same. When I went home for lunch, I tried the camera again, and it worked perfectly - the camera opened right up, no issues. I went back to work that afternoon, tried to open the app again, and experienced the same things that I had that morning. I try the camera again the next day, and I have the same experience: the feed doesn't load. (On some of my tries, the app force closed, and others, the feed didn't load.) I try on the third day, and the camera finally works when I'm away from home. The next day, I come home to find the camera had disconnected fron the network. I reconnect, and have the same issues I hav before. (Mind you, none of the other devices connected to my wifi were having any problems.)As the days go by, the app becomes less responsive, I'm not getting motion alerts (or if I do, the camera won't load), and the camera still won't stay connected to the network for mode than a day. The app had been updated while all of this was going on, so I hesitate to blame it just on the app. So maybe the unit was defective? I don't really know, but I do know that I was let down by what I thought would be a really nice product.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2019

Review Title: Not consistant, disconnects from internet, but great features
Review Text: There are definitely pros and cons to this camera. I want to love it so much, but there is one con that just seems to outweigh the pros.The major con? It does not stay connected to the internet consistently. I have had it not connected many many times in the last 2 weeks of owning it, and I couldn't hear or see my baby crying. I don't have issues with other devices staying connected to the internet, just this camera. Also, note that it doesnt connect to a 5Ghz connection. I knew that before I bought it, but double check your router/modem to ensure it is a 2.4Ghz connection , as most updated ones are 5.The pros on this carmera are great. It has awesome picture quality, as you can see in other reviews, including the night vision. You can adjust the position of the camera from your phone. It covers a large area for viewing, unlike most tiny baby monitors. You can adjust the motion and sound by low, med, high. So if you don't want it to pick up the car moving down the street, don't pick high. You can pick the times you want it to monitor for sound or motion. You can also turn them off all together. It was also easy to set up to my Amazon echo.I don't know if you can change how it notifies you, but the sound my phone makes wouls not wake me if I was sleeping hard. I wish it had the option of opening the camera automatically to active sounds and stayed open so I could hear the room instead of just relying on hearing the short ding sound and having to open the app to see what was going on. Sometimes it takes a while to pull up the active view, when I would like it more instant. happening.Overall this camera is mostly wonderful and has great features, but those features are worthless to me if I cant use them because it won't stay connected to the internet.Also, I bought a Wi-Fi detention for the baby room to see if that helped the camera stay connected and it did not!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2020

Review Text: Quality is in line with price.Pros:- Mirco-USB so you won't have to chase around a replacement cord. In addition the cord that it comes with sits flush with base, a round housing keeps it secure. Very unique.- Simple initial set up.- Upon power loss, roughly 2-3 min to resync with wifi and your phone.- Phone app is handy, notifications for audio and visual triggers are accurate. Sensitivity levels are nice.Cons:-Night vision is very moody. Switches often.- Control of camera is a bit clunky, movement is slow and awkward.- Streaming quality can be hit or miss, (fast internet, close proximity to router, still skips and struggles at times.)- Microphone feature is basically useless. When you attempt to use it, it will drop your camera picture entirely- it is simply too much data for the device to handle, it cannot process the video and transfer the audio out. (This is very small for me, didn't even realize it had this option until I received it)Lastly, I can't call this a con, it is a bit weird though, they really push their cloud service on to you. You can still record and save from the app into your photos, but for constant recording, an SD card or their service is required. If you want constant surveillance, this probably isn't your product. If you just need to keep an eye on something and spot check it, it really is a good bang for your buck.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2021

Review Text: ***Updated*** I did get a response,  I needed to update the app, and it works fine since then.  I think they weren't seeing my messages because I was using the older app (but never received any notice to update it). For what I paid for the camera,  plus 3$/month for 3 day recording,  it works very well.  Provided extra peace of mind on vacation, being able to keep an eye on my cats, and knowing the house was still there.It worked OK for almost a year, although I found out that "works with Alexa" does not mean it can be controlled with Alexa, which is misleading.  Customer service used to be very responsive despite being located overseas.  However I was recently forced to cancel my subscription in order to reset my camera.  Now  it took away the less expensive plan I was using,  but still won't even let me select any option at all. Customer service has stopped responding to messages in the app except with occasional excuses for not responding.  Overnight my camera shut off, logged me out of my account,  and wont let me log back in.  Throwing it out today, along with the second one I bought and didn't set up yet.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2021

Review Text: It does what it says. It’s pretty much like a ring camera. It’s awesome if you aren’t home and have a sitter watching your kid, you can check in on them, but if you’re home and just need to be away from baby but also need your phone or tablet or whatever device you’re using, it defeats the purpose and you may as well get an actual camera monitor that comes with its own monitor…Overall the picture and sound quality is great, it can notify you for sounds but I wouldn’t put it on if you have multiple kids because it’s sensitive and catches noise quite easily and your device will be notifying you all day…same with movement if you have kids in the same room. But it definitely detects both. The zoom feature is definitely a good feature to have. I’ve been able to catch moments of spit up and I caught baby rolling over for the first time. It’s a good camera to have, but if you’re looking to have consistent monitoring, this may not be the right one.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2021

Review Text: Works pretty well as a baby monitor- the app allows me to stay on it for continuous monitoring. The app stays open for the purpose of using it as a baby camera. I love the pan/tilt ability, and the motion detection works well.We use this as a baby camera since it can be repurposed later when baby is all grown up. Overall pleased with this purchase.Only wish there was an easy mounting option that let me use one of those universal mounts that attach to the crib. But it does have a wall mount plate and drywall anchors for you to drill into the wall/ceiling.4 month update:Removing one star because every now and then the camera changes to “daytime mode” in the middle of the night when the lightning hasn’t changed, and it causes the picture to go black so I can’t see my baby. I can still hear baby if he cries, but very annoying that there isn’t a way to manually pick which mode to keep the camera on.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2021

Review Text: I initially got this camera and had issues hooking it up without a hotspot because I lived in a community residence where you had to login to their internet then use a secondary login for your apartment. This camera couldn't handle it so I returned it. Customer service was quick to respond and said they believe they fixed the issue (they did not) and had sent me a free camera.  I have since moved into a house with direct internet so I waited to update my review because I didn't know if my issues were related to the hot spot or not.The camera will run ok for a few days then crap out - that's happened since the beginning.  It basically disconnects from the internet so you have to reset it often.  I used the app to watch as well as move the camera.  Some times it was super responsive but a lot of the times it was not.  The camera wouldn't move, it'd get stuck.  The app constantly was loading and spinning so you couldn't see the image.  So I'm not sure if the issue was the camera itself or the app.  I recently decided to pay for cloud back up and paid 1 month.  I got charged an extra fee from my bank because this is an International company. I've now had this camera for 5 or 6 months and the thing no longer moves no matter what I do.  I have had enough, unplugged it and purchased a product from a different maker.  I canceled the back up to save myself the extra fees.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2021

Review Text: I guess saying it was “Alexa enabled” was misleading or I didn’t read enough. Unless you have an Alexa tv or echo show you can’t enable it. It doesn’t give you notifications like our ring doorbell does so if I don’t have my phone on me I don’t know it’s going off. On the app it turns on by itself after I’ve shut it off. The notifications stopped all together at one point and I was told to reboot the whole thing and now the sound notifications don’t work. I tried to subscribe to view clips and it tells me to select a plan after I already selected one. Tonight my 3 month old was turned around from how I put him in the crib and I can’t even view how he did it. The picture quality itself is great but there are too many issues with the app
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 19, 2021

Review Text: Update: Reduced rating from 5 stars to 3. We purchased this just about a year ago now, almost on the dot, and the movement of the camera up/down has stopped working fully. It will not rotate down past a certain point anymore without having to physically move it. Very disappointed that it didn’t even make it to a year without an issue. Has been great otherwise! We’ll likely continue to use it while we can, and hope we can get some more life out of it before having to replace it.Original review: This camera works great so far, and we've had no issues! I read some reviews that said setup was difficult, and we did have to try twice to get it to read the QR code for our password correctly, but it seemed to be a matter of just holding it steady at the right distance of 8-10" (I held it too close the first time, I think), and making sure you click on the "full screen" so it puts the QR code against a plain white background. Otherwise, the picture has been great, the night vision is way better than cheaper camera's we've had in the past, and I love the fact that you can adjust the camera position & view by moving it with your finger right on the screen of the app. We don't use the motion or noise detection on it, so I can't comment on that, but talking through it via the app worked just fine and in general if we turn on the noise to hear what's going on in the room it comes through clear. If we come across any issues, I'll update the review!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 31, 2020

Review Title: Amazing Camera it was extremely helpful with my grandmother!
Review Text: My poor 90yr grandmother was in home hospice care and I was her main care giver. Towards the end she started to hallucinate and kept trying to get out of bed all though the night. Like a toddler escaping a crib but instead it was a 90yr women with cancer trying to get out of bed and leave the house. But she could no longer walk or stand so we couldn't let out. I set up the sound detection and motion detection and set the motion area to just around her in bed. It worked wonders! The camera would ping me on the phone and I could run into the room and catch her before she climbed out. It was such a stressful time, but knowing I could be alerted was a major help!I was really nervous because of the price of this camera compared to other more expensive ones, i was also super nervous about the bad review the app seemed to have as well. But everything worked as needed! The night vision, the app, the motion detection, everything worked great just when it was needed.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2021

Review Title: Read the Reviews from the App Store First!!
Review Text: The number of good reviews is clearly an algorithm. Check the App Store first, look at the reviews from there for the camera and you’ll learn all you need to know.My issues: Only one person can look at it at a time, unless you create multiple accounts and share the camera. So if you’re using this as a baby monitor to share with your spouse, it’s a pain in the butt to do. You can’t both log in to view, it will force a logout for the other person. Also, this camera HAS to be mounted upside down in order to get any good vantage point on a crib. The scope of the camera down is total garbage. Lastly, if you want to make the camera rotate, there are literally NO INSTRUCTIONS except from users on YouTube on how to do it. It’s a piece of junk. We’re going to try to return it, such a waste of time and money.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 10, 2021

Review Text: Easy to set up. Great "live" picture. But it gives a motion sensor alert to the TV and the cat walking by. Changed the settings, still happening. I get 20 "alerts" a day, 10 seconds of video and no way to delete them. There's no way to fast forward through a video either. I finally figured out how to put in the SD card. There's not a good Q&A section, no real help, even Google failed me. I emailed customer service and never heard back. This thing goes back.

The media could not be loaded.
                




   It probably works fine if you are casually watching pets, but if you are looking to use for a baby monitor or ceiling mount look elsewhere. Review Text: I bought the camera a few months ago and have established that this camera fully sucks.  I have managed to access the video feed from my phone maybe three times.  I have had to disconnect and reinstall it multiple times to get it to work, and even then it doesn't want to.  I will say the motion detector works great, but unfortunately when I get the alert that the motion sensor was activated, I cannot see what tripped it because all I get is a swirly n (think spinning wheel of death) on the screen as it tries to load, which it rarely does.  I bought this in an effort to save money, since I really only need to use it once a week, but that money is wasted as this camera is useless.  I can't imagine needing to use it as a baby monitor, as it is advertised. You'd never know what was happening in the nursery until you got up to check, which rather negates the need for a camera.  Don't waste your money on this piece of garbage.

Review Title: Great for caregivers for loved ones with dementia
Review Text: I bought this for the overnight staff who care for my dad in his home. I bought a motion detector to let them know when he gets out of bed. Once the bell goes off, they use the iPad to see dad's bedroom on camera. The picture at night is so clear! You also can touch the iPad screen with your finger and turn the camera.You do need to plug this camera in, so think about where you plan to place the camera. I put mine on my dad's dresser. You could also mount this on the ceiling. The caregiver's LOVE it. They are not technology users and learned how to use it very quickly.I have been using Blink cameras which have the advantage of being battery operated. I love that this one allows you to move the camera. The price is good for what you get, also bought one for  friend's baby.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2021

Review Text: This camera is amazing for the price!! Summary: it’s not a $200 camera so it won’t act like one, but it’s pretty darn good for how cheap it is. You can see the baby from anywhere in the app, as long as the camera is connected to the home wifi, and you have data or internet on your phone (or tablet). It was exactly what I needed without breaking the bank. Some notes:- The night vision is great- You can manually move the camera from your phone to see what’s going on in the room without physically going in there.- If you have a sound machine, you can’t use the sound detection, it will notify you every like 20 seconds, even with low sensitivity- The motion detection was ok, I feel like it was correct 50% of the time, but that could be because it was viewing through play pen mesh. It would probably be better if I mounted it on the wall.- They fixed the app so that you can add another person so you can both view at the same time, they just have to make an account on the app which isn’t hard. It logs you out if you log into your own account from another device.- The speaker is great, I was at the store and had a convo with my husband through the camera lol- It really does only work on 2.4 internet, I tried the other one and it wouldn’t connect.- Connecting it was a pain sometimes, but lots of the time it was because the camera didn’t have a good enough view of the QR code on my phone. Just reset and try again. I got it to work every time it was on the correct internet (not 5G)
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2022

Review Text: We bought this camera device to help us have some peace of mind while my husband and I are out of the house for a weekend. We have 4 furbabies so I get worried when we are away too long.Honestly though, this was so easy to install and hook-up we use it every day! The 2-way speaker is awesome for when he's home and Im out of the house and cant get him to answer his phone. Lmao!!! Also it is funny to see the doggie's reaction when we talk to them.Motion detect is great, night vision is phenomenal, sounds are awesome, and there is notifications but my pets move so much that the notifications spam too much Lmao.Highly recommend getting the SD card for storage so you dont have to worry about subscribing to their cloud. The 128gb sd can cover up about a day or 2 of footage so yeah! 👍Anyway, off to buy another one. Lol!

Review Text: This camera monitor is AWESOME! I have been using victure bideo baby monitors for a few years and they were okay... but this Nooie camera is 10x better and half the price. The camera picks up on motion in the room and FOLLOWS it. You can mount to wall or ceiling- mounting this was way easier than the victure ones. It works with my alexa show unlike the victure, and i can view the feed from my iphone- also unlike victure. It will notify you of sounds and motion but you can also turn these features off or schedule them to only monitor at certain times. If you pair with alexa then you can tell her when youre leaving and she will put on guard mode and notify you of glass breaking or smoke alarms or movement. AMAZING value for the price. I use for a special needs adult who needs to be monitored at night but it would be great for little kids or pets too!

Review Text: I wanted to get a camera device to watch our baby while we were in another room. Having had a really bad experience with some of the infant gadgets like the Owlet, I was skeptical to spend the hundreds of dollars for some of the other infant cams.The Nooie came in a simple box with everything inside. Even has a wall mount and screws in the box.Setup was a breeze. Did a lookup cia the Camera app on the iOS QR code that was in the instructions, downloaded the app, created an account and within a minute I had the device powered on, added to our mesh WiFi and got the live stream from the cam. Super easy!App required very little configuration with night mode enabled by default. The other controls were simple to use such as motion detection and sound detection. The only drawback on the app is not being able to go landscape mode but that’s not a deal breaker for me.You do not need a subscription to live stream from your own network. This is a huge benefit as many of the other devices seem to also require some sort of cloud subscription.If you’re like ya and want something simple that allows you to peek in to see baby while in another room, walking the dog or while you are working this fits that to a T. We are looking at the other Nooie devices after the great experience with the Nooie Cam 360.

Review Title: See updated review. Very happy with the camera now
Review Text: I will be returning this camera as the app is so horrible it's impossible to use. It freezes constantly (search these reviews for the word freeze) which defeats the whole purpose. When the app is functioning it provides a clear picture. But as soon as I try to zoom in or pan around, the picture freezes and I'm unable to control the camera or see what's happening anymore. Review Text: The new app made all the difference- customer support at Nooie was very helpful! The new app named just 'Nooie' has to be installed replacing the old app 'Nooie cam'.Edited--The seller reached out to me and sent me a new device which I thought was great customer service. My new camera connected quickly and within seconds was ready to use. I use it as a baby monitor and the sound and motion detection feature with a control setting for detection is pretty on point as is the night vision setting. With multiple kids, it's a simple scroll across my phone when I want to pan between the cribs spaced across the room, zoom in to see which one is awake and trying to wake up the sibling! All in all, I'm very pleased with my new camera!This video monitor was difficult to connect to our home WiFi, and takes a long time to connect each time I turn it on. When it does come on, it pans the room very slowly and is quite glitchy, even when I scroll on the app. So much so that I prefer to use my old non WiFi, stationary monitor which is a lot more reliable. I definitely wouldn’t recommend this one.

Review Text: For the most part this is a great monitor. The night vision and picture clarity is awesome! There are a few minor flaws but mostly with the app required to use this camera. When you use the feature that allows you to talk it freezes so you’re unsure if your message got through and you can’t hear your child’s response. The camera feed lags occasionally, freezing and unfreezing. However that is more to do with my WiFi rather the camera. So my suggestion is to make sure you have a good internet provider. I really love that you can choose the sensitivity of the sound and motion detection. The app will send a notification alert to your phone letting you know sound or motion has been detected. Which is really helpful because you can use your phone and not have the video feed up the entire time your child is sleeping. For the price I highly recommend this camera. It’s a great value.

Review Title: Works well and has good features
Review Text: Disclosure: I am writing this review at the company's request but the opinions are my own.I bought this at a discounted price and it's been totally worth it. I bought it to keep an eye on my new dog when I leave the house and I was worried I'd regret the purchase but it's been invaluable. The speaker/microphone has been VERY useful in soothing him during separation anxieties. The motion tracking follows him as he paces back and forth so I don't have to move the camera around manually to find him. The alerts can be a little too repetitive so I keep those off most of the time but I do use them occasionally since they include screenshots.The only negative I have found so far is that the power cable is far too short so placement is limited. I will need to purchase a longer one to get a better view of the room.Overall I would definitely recommend this product if you're in the market for a camera for your pet or baby!

Review Text: I needed a camera to check in on my puppy in her crate while we potty train. Initially I thought of getting an indoor Nest camera because I have others and they work well, but I couldn't justify spending over $100 on a camera for a dog. I ordered this camera because it had great reviews, and it's greatly exceeded my expectations. The video quality is great in both normal and night vision modes, I love that I can speak through it, and it's been very reliable. I didn't even realize at the time that the camera turns and you can also angle it up and down, which is a huge added benefit. I eventually figured out how to have 2 different accounts access the camera at once, which has been very helpful. The only slight downside for me is that I bring this camera wherever we go with our dog where she might nap in another room (home, work, friends houses...) and theres no easy way to change WiFi networks without completely removing the camera and adding it again. This is a pain to do, but thankfully it's not a daily occurrence for me.

Review Text: This camera offers excellent coverage area (adjustable remotely up and down) and 360 deg span.Somewhat difficult to set up but you will get it done by yourself if you just persist .. customer service is not helpful and way too slow. Review Text: This product was made well and overall works really well. I am using it as a baby monitor and if the app is up all the time on my phone, its perfect. But it does not work well as night monitor because the alerts aren't loud and annoying enough or even customizable in sound, vibration, or duration of alert. (So if baby wakes up in the middle of the night in distress and you aren't a super light sleeper, you will sleep through it [on my phone it is a very light vibrating sound]. Which defeats the purpose of having a baby monitor for me.)The picture quality is great, motion and voice detection is great. Had an issue setting up and connected to Wi-Fi but my husband had no issues. It does lose WiFi occassionally (the cam is upstairs and on the opposite side of the house).The thing that I would really want in a baby monitor is customized alerts. Currently when motion or voice is detected, I get a light vibrating alert that lasts a second. Other monitors have the screen turn on or have reminder alerts so that if you are sleeping and want to be woken up when the baby is awake, you can be.Also you are currently unable to schedule motion detection or sound at multiple times ina day (like morning and night or before work and after work).Overall great camera though just wish the app worked a little better.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2019

Review Text: I love this thing.  We needed a camera to monitor a pregnant feral cat that we are fostering.  The kitty needs her privacy (she's not too wild, but still scared of humans) but we need to keep an eye on her.  We needed a wifi camera so we could leave the house.  This little camera fit the bill.  And we didn't want a subscription service to record the cuteness.Set Up: I found setting up the nooie cam straightforward and quick.  Plug and play in less than 15 minutes.  Once you play with the nooie app a bit, it's intuitive.  One thing that was a bit tricky was adding another user.  Each person has to set up a nooie account and be invited to that specific device.  I believe there is a way to share the whole nooie ecosystem, but we only have this one camera.Picture Quality:  Very sharp in daylight and surprisingly clear at night in a pitch black room. We have not had any major buffering issues, maybe a second or two.Recording: Recording live video is a breeze and the pictures and videos go right to our iphone's photo app.  I did go buy a 128 gig microSD so we can do playback.  It's not seamless, but it does work.  The camera records in 5 min segments and it takes some patience to find moments you want to see.All in all we are super happy with this cute camera.  The price point is amazing for all the features you get.  It's so good I'm considering buying the nooie doorbell and plug adapters.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2021

Review Text:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   This is my first time ever buying a video camera but color me impressed! I don’t know about all the other bells and whistles that others may prefer in a video camera but if you only need this for monitoring purposes, and considering the price, then this video camera is amazing. I truly don’t understand the negative reviews. Agreed that setup with the barcode was a bit frustrating but for the price, it’s totally worth it. We only use this to monitor our cat and house when we’re away. I’m really impressed with the quality of the picture at night. My favorite feature is the 360 view that you can control on your device from long distances! I accidentally knocked this little guy off the table but it was durable enough to withstand my clumsiness. I happily give this product my stamp of approval. For all you video camera newbies like me, see below for information I wish I had known (and some of which may have already been addressed in prior reviews).-Unless you’re looking to actually keep a lot of footage over time, you don’t need to purchase cloud storage or an SD card. In fact, there’s a video camera icon on the screen that allows you to record the feed you’re looking at. It automatically saves to your device! Same deal with taking a picture. I don’t know if there are any time limits (but would think there aren’t any) as I’ve only done this for 30 second increments.-As I said above, you can control the camera from your device and it swivels for 360 degrees! I verified this when we were a state away recently. Keep your finger on the screen of your device and swipe to whichever direction you want the video camera to show you. It also goes up and down.-Setup: You’ll need to download the Nooie app and set up an account. Once you do this, a QR code will appear on your device that you’ll need to hold up in front of the video camera to connect it to your device. I highly recommend doing this on a table so you can place the code evenly in front of the camera and so you can see its reflection squarely in the camera. Once the camera connects to the code, you’ll hear a sound to let you know it was successful. From there, setup truly is a breeze.-Love the speaker feature as well. We actually use this to communicate with each other when we’re not in the same room!-Finally, you can download the Nooie app on multiple devices but can only log into the video camera’s feed from one device at a time.

Review Text: This video camera is an great choice for the price. Video quality is clear in day or night vision. The app allows you to adjust it to most your liking. Installation is a breeze and can be mounted on the base on the wall or just on top of a solid flat surface. Set up wasn't complicated either and had it up and running in a matter of minutes. We originally purchased the Owlet camera and sock as a bundle. However, we didnt think it was all worth the high amount after trying it for a week and returned it. This camera is just as good or better because it can be adjusted. The microphone and speaker so you can speak with your baby are also great features.The only real problems we had with it was that the app was a little tricky to get it to adjust the camera. It was too sensitive and would move more than you wanted. The second issue is that only 1 person can log on to view the camera(s) at a time. Not sure if maybe more accounts can be created to monitor the same camera?

Review Title: Just what we needed! Works seamlessly with Echo Show
Review Text: I bought this camera for our room to keep an eye on our baby while he naps/sleeps and I’m so glad I did. The camera has a nice aesthetic look, easy to set up and the Nooie app is user-friendly as well.The picture quality is better than your average baby monitor (see attached photo taken early morning, with blinds slightly closed). I love how I am able to record live clips and screenshots of what’s happening in the room (my toddlers love standing in front of the camera for “photos”). I also like how I am able to switch the view with just a light swipe via the Nooie app.The two-way communicator is great for when I need to calm baby on my way up or call the hubs down for dinner 😆For the price point, it’s a great little camera! Review Text: Bought this camera to replace the one we had received when our son was born. The Nooie 360 has immediately been so much better and allowed me to truly sleep at night. This camera has not had many if really any lags or has come disconnected from the WiFi. The times I can recall we’re due to my internet service and had nothing to do with the camera. The motion detection is super sensitive (it can pick up on the fish swimming behind it) as is the sound recognition so I am alerted fairly frequently, which is exactly what I wanted. If I know that I don’t need to be concerned with what’s going on then I just turn off the notifications on my phone or turn off the volume. You can adjust the sensitivity or turn these detections off completely in the Nooie app. I have already recommended this camera/brand to friends with/without babies, pets etc. I have not had to contact customer service because this camera is incredibly user friendly as is the app and I haven’t had any issues. I have an SD card which records movement and sound on a loop which is fine since I’m only using it to monitor my son during his naps and at night. This camera is truly perfect, especially for the price, compared to those incredibly overpriced, name brand “baby monitors” with a separate handheld device, specifically for the monitor. I love that I can check on things if I’m not home or my parents can sign in to watch him dancing or doing something that a video just won’t truly capture.1/8/21 Update: camera is still going strong. Works great, connects without any issues. We have since purchased many of Nooie's other smart products and they all work great and the home app combines all of the devices and cameras perfectly. Cannot wait to see what they will think of next.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2020

Review Text: At first I thought Nooie was the best invention since sliced bread. But over time a severely flawed app effects performance that it is completely worthless as a baby monitor.The night vision and picture quality are great. But the app does not remember/save your motion/sound detection settings. Despite deleting and reloading the app the problem persists. What this has meant is my toddler was able to wake up, leave his crib and room, without the Nooie app sending one notification or alert. Making it completely pointless.In addition- if you ever travel with it- you cannot simply just change the internet connection. You must delete and re-install the camera to your app. Which is simple enough but takes 5-10 minutes. Which becomes a cumbersome task because you have to re-do it again once you return home.This camera has so much potential. Between the price point and the quality of the camera. But ultimately- because of a non-functional app- this will end up in the trash bin where it belongs.

Review Title: Affordable, reliable, and excellent customer service
Review Text: I am not compensated in any way for this review.I have purchased four of these cameras since January, and I recommend them to others on a regular basis. I gave two as gifts and use the two I have for baby monitors, one in the nursery and one in the living room so that I can still have a visual on my daughter if I have to leave the room momentarily (WFH/STAHM). They have been a lifesaver, set up in minutes and are easy to maintain.Recently, I noticed a bit of a delay in connecting to the camera feed after the iPhone app updated. I emailed Nooie’s customer support and in very short order had a reply from Alma who helped me get back up and running in no time. They pushed out a firmware update and the problem immediately went away. I was provided with prompt, excellent service and am completely satisfied with my experience.I’m not sure why anyone is complaining about Nooie’s support quality. I’ve contacted a few times and always receive the help I need. I have also seen some negative product reviews but frankly cannot understand why. I’ve had minimal issues and everything was either related to needing to run an available update or a network problem on my end.

Review Text: The Nooie 360 camera was easy to set up, however, the documentation that came with it and available on line is very minimal.  I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 for this reason.  The app works pretty well, however the pan / tilt operation is a little sporadic.  With little or no documentation on the web site, you just have to play with it to figure out how the controls work.  The Mic and Sound icons really don't look like a mic and a speaker, and they aren't identified in the manual.On the plus side, the picture quality is excellent.  The night vision is excellent also.  Motion detection works good, and the sound is good for such a small device.My overall opinion is that this is a very good camera, that I would recommend and buy again, but the documentation and app need work!  I am impressed enough that I'm planning on purchasing a couple of the outdoor cameras and when it becomes available, one of the doorbell cameras.

Review Text: I really like the sleek modern design of the 360 Nooie camera. We have nicknamed ours R2.The motion tracking is great (you do need to turn on Motion Tracking in the app). The only issue is when more than one motion is going on, the camera has a hard time decided which one to follow. The ability for the camera to pan helps eliminate the need for multiple cameras because it will cover a much larger portion of the room.You can use a SD card or cloud service to record or you can save directly to your phone (if you hit the record button in the app) Note: automatic motion detection and audio detection recordings need storage, can be either SD card or cloud service.You can adjust the sensitivity to low, medium or high for either motion or sound in the app settings.You can share the camera with a second person as long as they have a Nooie account set.The night vision footage is very clear.It would be nice if the camera supported more than 2.4g. I would also like to see some kind of on camera ability to record if the power or internet goes down.

Review Title: Compatibility with echo show not consistent
Review Text: The main reason why we got this camera was the compatibility to our echo shows. The set up to our echo shows worked so we can see our baby in her room, however the echos screen just shuts off the nooie skill randomly without us asking it to shut off. Ex. I turn the baby camera on before I go to bed so I can hear and see my baby if she cries at night, but when I wake up to check the show the baby camera is not on. We constantly have to keep asking our echo shows to show baby room. It defeats the purpose of why we got the camera.The footage on the echo shows are also  super delayed. The older version of my echo show there is about a 30 second delay, my newer version is about a 15 second delay. It may not seem much but as a new mom I would like to address if my baby is crying immediately.I also have to keep restarting the app on my phone to show the baby camera, the footage doesn't always show up the first time, it just shows a black or green screen. I did make sure all apps and skills were up to date.One other item I wasn't a fan of is you can't have multiple people viewing the camera in the phone app at the same time . Ex. My husband watches our little one and logs into the app to see the camera. I am at work and want to see the baby. If I did this it would force my husband to log out of the app. I understand they probably put this measure in place for security reasons, but they should have a setting or parameters where you could give permission to allow multiple people to view the camera using the same log in.All in all the camera works fine, picture quality is nice and night mode is great, however if you are using it for the sole purpose of seeing your baby on the echo show, I would not reccommend it. It is not consistent enough for me to trust it.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2021

Review Title: Great infrared vision! Reasonable price! BUY IT!!
Review Text: I got this camera a week ago, and so far I really love it! The setup was a breeze, I only need to follow the instructions and less than 15 mins I got the camera ready and connected to my phone.Pro(+) Easy installation(+) Almost 360 degree visual making it very easy to monitor my baby and his surroundings(+) Infrared vision is top notch! Review Text: I bought this out of frustration after returning "the tesla of baby monitors" which was a total dud. I paid $50 so my expectations were that it would work 50% of the time. I was wrong. This works flawlessly and is incredibly easy to set up. It was different by having to use a QR code to set it up but it worked just fine. The night vision and zoom are great. We use an old Kindle Fire tablet in the living room and it works just fine without any delay. With night vision it's incredibly sharp. I can zoom in on the mesh of the co-sleeper and it's not blurry at all. I constantly get motion/sound alerts so it means it's working. It's silent when you move from side-to-side. I thought there'd be a loud mechanical sound. The two things I can think of that could be improved is the noticeable sound delay (by about a second) and the microphone sensitivity. Overall, I would highly recommend this camera as a baby monitor or to just use around the house.EDIT: I completely forgot about the short power cable. I bought an extension cord because the cable was too short to reach halfway across the room. This is what we do when we place our baby in the co-sleeper.

Review Text: This baby monitor works well maybe 75% of the time but it's really unreliable the other 25%. It occasionally will not connect despite the app saying the internet connection is good. Review Title: So much better than Lollipop at a fraction of the price
Review Text: It was important to us to have a monitor that we could watch from our phones. I got the Lollipop monitor when my baby was born 17 months ago, and it never worked right. Constantly disconnected from wifi, consumed lots of battery, just problem after problem. I even thought the problem might be with our home wifi bandwidth, so I decided to pickup a "cheap" wifi monitor on Amazon to test that theory. Enter Nooie: perfect from the beginning. 3 minutes of setup and haven't had to think about it since - it just works, and it is less battery-intensive than the Lollipop at less than a third of the price. I am not being paid to write this review, just had to share. The only thing I would improve would be to have the ability to stay logged into the app on more than one device simultaneously using the same account. My husband has his own account that he uses on his phone, but sometimes I like to monitor from my tablet and it's annoying to have to login to my account every time I switch between my phone and tablet. I could create another account using my secondary email address, but I feel like that's an unnecessary step. Other than this relatively minor inconvenience, I can't recommend it enough!

Review Title: Video viewing on microSD is a deal breaker
Review Text: The good:-decent image quality-good motion tracking-good panning up and down-decent night vision-can take microsd card of 64 gigsThe bad (and man, it is awful):-The video files recorded are not shown to the user as a file that can be clicked on. You are given a time-line that has a tiny vertical slit to indicate a file where there was motion recorded. You will spend about 10 minutes to try to line up the time line with the vertical slit so you can actually view the video that was recorded. Perhaps the worse file viewing experience I have ever had - this makes it a deal breaker. I should be able to just click in a file that represents the recording and view it instantly. If they did that, then this product would probably get 5 stars.***Wow, just realized that there are NO VIDEO CONTROLS AT ALL. You cannot pause the video. You cannot stop the video. You cannot fast forward, rewind, jump to another part of a video, etc...It is just play or move onto another "time line" period. Wow. I wish some basic thought would have been put into the video player, it would be a great product if they had.

Review Title: Only device on my wifi that has problems.
Review Text: I have a very powerful WiFi setup at home, using WiFi 6 protocol. All devices on my WiFi (all across my home) are very stable, except for these cameras. I have three of them, in three different rooms. All three give us problems when trying to connect to them to view our kids. The video stream buffers and spins. Sometimes it doesn't connect at all. I think the wifi module these cameras have are very cheap, and perform very poorly. Not to mention, it also only supports 2.4ghz band, not 5ghz band. Outdated, unreliable network module in these.Look elsewhere if you're looking for a reliable video feed to check in on your loved ones.

Review Text: After testing this camera for a couple weeks I must say this is a pretty good investment for the price. The monitor I originally wanted was over $160 and I can't justify spending that much money on something ill only use at night or occasionally during the day. Pairing it to my phone was super easy, the picture quality is amazing (i can see my LO breathing), and night time vision is even better. The alerts I get sent to my phone are right in target when my LO wakes up, moves or makes any sort of noise. I love that I can customize the motion and sound settings to pick up low, medium, high motions/sounds. The 360 view is amazing as well and I love that I can zoom in on our LO. Even after we done using this as a baby monitor, I love the fact that we can continue to use it in our home while we are away as security or even for our pets. Would definitely recommend!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2020

Review Title: Good hardware, good price, limited app
Review Text: Love the camera hardware. The company does not seem sketchy. The only reason I’m giving it 4 stars is the controls(or lack there of) within the app. Know this:1.) only one account can be logged into the camera at one. You have to re log in if you get booted.2.) can’t send e-mail or photo alerts. Just video streaming from SD or amazon cloud.2B.) unless you pay for cloud service all a thief would need to do is take the camera. Now you don’t have the video or a photo3.) no way other than the app to access camera.4.) minimal visualization of advanced network config.5.) no preset position on camera. To move the camera you have to swipe across the screen. It isn’t exact and it’s laggy. Annoying.6.) motion tracking is pretty cool and works well.7.) set up was easy, but again, you can only use the app.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2019

Review Text: This thing is a lifesaver. My babe takes naps in his room. Tiny naps. Micro naps. So whenever I manage to get him down, I'm running around trying to get things done. While I'm loading the dishwasher I can check on him. When I'm scarfing down a bagel I can check on him. When I'm vacuuming I can check on him. Just a few hang ups: It's not all that consistent. I'll get a failed message many times that I'm trying to check the live feed, so I'll reset the app on my phone before I can get it to work. Also, it makes a startup noise when it's plugged in and takes a bit before I can get an image, so moving it from room to room can be a bit difficult. But the night vision is clear, the ability to move the camera is useful, and I'm able to talk to my baby as well as hear him. There's a few seconds of lag, but whatever. Getting it set up wasn't all that hard. Overall, given how many camera options out there, this is a solid choice for the price
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 10, 2020

Review Text: The camera is a great value for the price and works well for our baby. HD video, night vision, sound and motion alerts, and 2-way audio were all features I wanted. Pan and tilt plus motion tracking is a plus!The only thing holding this back is a mediocre app. Often times, I have to close and reopen the app because alert notifications open to a blank version of the app where I'm logged out for some reason. Simply closing and reopening refreshes and the app remembers I'm logged in. Also, there's no snooze alerts button anywhere. Would love to be able to snooze alerts if we're in the room with baby, then turn them back on easily once we leave. App takes a little while to load the video, but should be good enough to monitor baby. Also, no background audio either, which I feel like is an app limitation. Good to have 2 factor authentication and the image is very clear.

Review Text: Got this camera back in April cause my 2 yr old transitioned to a toddler bed and was easily getting out and crying for us but we didn’t know what he was getting into since we only had the stationary camera from a different brand. Spoke with Alma, who tried to assist me and talk me though what to troubleshoot and try to fix. Overall great product and customer service!

Review Text: Set up took a couple of tries. It’s worked well except when we had a power outage it kicked my mom off the camera. I had to send her a new invitation. Set up instructions left a little to be desired. DO NOT download the gray Nooie app. Download the blue one. Instructions did not specify this. The blue works much better. I couldn’t even use the 360 movement on the gray one and it kept cutting in and out. Moving the pic with your finger is WAY to sensitive. It is hard to get the camera pointed this way. I also don’t like the motion and sound detection. They are too sensitive also but my son is almost two so that wasn’t as important at this point. He’s a loud screamer anyway so I chose to keep the camera. It does enough for me. Hope this helps.

Review Title: Gets the job done even if it's not always working at 100%
Review Text: I got this product to check in on my pup in my open floor plan apartment when I first started leaving her out and as we transitioned back to working world. While I can't say that the camera is 100% perfect, it absolutely does the job. Sound detection is fantastic (sometimes a little too good when I got nonstop notifications for a visiting barking dog), motion detection is usually good about 75% of the time (occasionally it will just send off in an opposite direction when my dog is squarely in same position). The audio levels are perfectly fine, but the voice feature doesn't work. The few times I've tested it, it comes in very garbled and mightttt pick up half a word. Luckily, I don't want to use that feature because I think it just teases my dog more. Playback via the app (I use SD, haven't tried cloud) is rough - I still haven't really figured it out, but thankfully I don't need it often.However, the panning and zooming ability is fantastic. It's exactly what I wanted/needed. I love that it's SO easy to turn on and off when I want wherever I want so it isn't filming me when I'm just sitting at home. The night vision is fantastic and I've had others comment on how good the picture quality is overall.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2021

Review Title: To see or not to see...
Review Text: Ok, so I purchased this camera so we'd be able to use it for our new addition to the family. I ordered it prior to the baby's arrival so I could test it out and see if it will work for the purpose of a baby monitor as it is described to do.I can tell you as of right now a little into a week of owning this thing that it's awesome. Being able to see what is going on Live in my house and move the camera with a swipe of my finger on my phone's screen is pretty darn cool. Also, having the ability to listen and watching at the same time live is a nice way to keep tabs on the kids when you have to run to the store.Lastly, using it as a two-way radio is a pretty nice feature too. We were able to call out to our daughter on the way home from the store and ask her to turn the oven on to get it preheated for dinner.Yes, it connects to your home WiFi network.Yes, you can access it through the Nooie app from outside of your home network using your cellular data. And yes you can tell Alexa or Google assistant to do something through the 2-way radio.If it continues to work this awesome after the baby arrives, I'm going to be getting a few more just to post up around the house in random spots.

Review Title: The peace of mind this device has given me is priceless!
Review Text: Makes home security seem easy!I had originally received a unit to do a review on but it worked so well I bought 3 more of them and subscribed to the $5 a month 7-day cloud storage back up which works seamlessly with this device. So I can open the app and look back up to 7 days which is very helpful for my second home. If there was ever a break-in I would have footage. Also the sensors on this device, the motion and soundtracking, work very well so with both those on if someone did breach my security and get into my home it will send me warning that its detected motion and or sound which would prompt me to look at the camera, if the camera had been located and disabled by an intruder I would have footage leading up to that from the cloud service and would be notified via the sound and motion sensor. This unit also offers a two-way mic so you can listen and talk and it will rotate 360 degrees so depending on where you place them you can really cover a huge range.  I'm telling you the peace of mind this device has given me is priceless!

Review Text: UPDATED REVIEW:(After a few months of continuous use)Monitor no longer rotates fully and will not connect to any devices. Review Text: I purchased the Nooie Cam 360 as a security camera. I examined tons of different models from a variety of brands. This camera met all of my needs and is definitely the most bang for the buck. I caught a special Amazon "Lightning Deal" and got it for $32.99. With Dynamic Noise Reduction and Color Enhancement, the 1080p video quality is excellent. The night vision is nothing short of stunning. It uses "Gamma Correction", so the infrared images are not washed out or grainy and have plenty of contrast. The night vision literally looks as crisp, clear and clean as daylight, only in B&W. The camera is ridiculously easy to set up. Using a QR code was a brilliant idea. Just make sure you're on a 2.4 Ghz network for the setup and pairing process. This is only for the setup process. Once paired, you can switch your smartphone back to 5 Ghz, if you're using a dual-band router. The Nooie will remain connected to your 2.4 Ghz band. This is the #1 reason people give this camera negative reviews. They don't read the setup instructions and don't realize this. The built-in speaker is loud and clear. The microphone is sensitive enough to hear the faintest room activity through your phone. My router is about 20 ft. away from the camera, but it's on a different floor of my house. The connection is rock solid and stable. It's never lost connection. The camera will send alerts to your phone if it detects motion and/or sound. You can turn these features on/off, and even set a schedule for when to detect either. This way, the camera's not sending you alerts when you're home and within camera view. The motion tracking pan & tilt is whisper quiet, so as not to attract attention if recording a home intrusion. That, combined with the ability to deactivate the "Status Light" makes this unit stealthy. The app is well executed, includes all of the necessary features and yet is simplistic in design. The camera's design is inconspicuous and elegant. People have commented that it looks somewhat like an air freshener. I can see the resemblance. The entire base of the camera has a rubber ring, running the full circumference, so it stays put and won't mar your furniture. I honestly can't find one thing to complain about with this camera, and believe me, I've tried. So, if you're looking for an inexpensive, quality camera to monitor your baby, pet or house, look no further. Buy the Nooie Cam 360. You won't regret it!Setup Tips:If your first attempt to pair the camera with the app is unsuccessful, reset the camera first before trying again.  There's a tiny pin hole on the body.  Just insert a straightened paperclip into the hole and press for about two seconds.I keep reading reviews complaining that this camera won't work on a 5GHz network.  These people are obviously not very tech savvy.  Otherwise, they would know the reason for this.  The difference between 2.4 GHz and 5GHz is range and bandwidth. 5GHz provides a faster data transfer rate, but at a shorter distance. 2.4GHz offers a greater range, but at a slower speed.  When talking about WiFi cameras, range is the primary concern, not speed.  The wireless signal must penetrate through walls and/or floors.  The data transfer speed (for this purpose) is irrelevant.  You will not see any visible different between the two frequencies.  As long as the video image is smooth and not choppy, the added speed of a 5GHz network offers no benefit.  To the contrary, the decrease in range is a detriment.  This is the reason every WiFi camera I've seen on Amazon, also only works on a 2.4GHz network.Some people have stated that this camera will not connect to a dual-band router.  This is NOT true.  Most modern routers are dual-band.  You have to know how to "force" your cellphone to connect (and stay connected) to only the 2.4GHz band during the pairing process.  If your WiFi password for your 5GHz network is "stored" in your phone, you must select "Forget Network".  This doesn't actually forget the network.  It merely deletes the WiFi password for the 5GHz band.  This forces the phone to only connect to the 2.4GHz band.  Once camera pairing is complete, you can reverse that process if you'd like your phone to stay on the 5GHz band.Usage Tips:When manually panning the camera via the app, you can't touch the phone's screen and drag your finger "in one motion".  It takes a second for the app to detect your finger.  You have to touch the screen and give it a second to recognize your finger.  Then, slowly drag your finger in the desired direction.  Remember, this touch control command is being sent over a wireless network.  It's not the same as a "local" touch command on a phone app, thus the added time needed.Nooie Cam App:I noticed a problem with the app disconnecting from the camera after being closed for several minutes.  There were a few other minor bugs.  I contacted Nooie Support and received a reply within hours.  I was advised that they were aware of the issues and were working on fixes.  There have been three updates to the app, including two beta releases, all within the last two weeks.  I tested the different versions and reported back to Nooie Support.  They addressed everything in a timely matter.  Due to their quick reply and fixes, I didn't let this affect my rating of the camera.  For anyone who isn't familiar with how beta versions work, here's the deal.  Beta versions are still in the testing mode.  The developers will collect input from actual users, implement fixes and test the final result.  Only then, will it be released to the general public.  This is a normal process with all software development.  They'll likely make other tweaks and enhancements in future versions, so check Google Play and the App Store regularly.Latest Version:  1.7.7, Released 9/28/19
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2019
