Review Title: So far it's great, especially for the price.
Review Text: Update: The camera is still great and the night vision is very good. Highly recommend.So far so good. This camera was very easy to set up and pair with my phone. I failed the first time because I picked the wrong camera type, but that's on me. You have to set up an account with Nooie in order to use this camera, which I don't like, but it wasn't very invasive (didn't ask many personal questions). The picture is very clear and responsive, only about a second of delay. I love the option to turn the status light on or off. It's not bright, but you might not want people to immediately be drawn to the camera. I haven't tried the night vision yet, so no comment there but I'll update this review once I do. The motion sensing works great and notifications on my phone are very fast.  It's especially nice that you can set days & times for that to be on or off.  The only real negative I've found so far is that the power cord is a little short. I simply swapped it out for a longer one I already had since it's a standard Micro USB to USB cable. But the one that came with this camera has a circular end to fit all fancy like in the camera. Unfortunately, that means I can't repurpose it for my phone, but whatever. In summary, so far this camera is great, especially for the price. I'll be sure to update if that changes.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2019

Review Text: I had bought this for 2 purposes. One was because my wife and I were planning to have a baby and to use it for when the baby was born. The second reason was that my father was on his way out of this world and didn't have very long left to live. He was given a time from anywhere between 1-6 months. So we figured we would get it and set it up in my house to help keep an eye on my father when I needed to go to work so that I can check on him frequently whenever I had a chance. The fact that I could talk to my father through the Nooie cam when I was at work to reassure him that everything was okay and to call for help if I saw anything afoot. About a month later he passed away but during the time I was using it, it worked like a dream and made it easier for my peace of mind when I had to work. I highly love this product and recommend it to anyone thinking about it.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2021

Review Title: A huge improvement from my last camera
Review Text: I have used a different brand camera for the last couple years in my kid's room. Although the previous camera was ok, it had several different issues both with the app and the camera itself. So far I really like this camera. It has great picture quality, is very smooth with it moves and doesn't draw attention to itself. The only issues I see are small ones, 1st the screws provided are very flimsy and strip easily even when just using a screwdriver, so I had to find other screws. Then 2nd, if the camera is mounted on the wall it has some limitation in how much you can view. For instance, I have my camera mounted on the wall opposite the door for my kid's room, I can see most of the room, but I can't see up to the wall or door that are across the room because of the angle limitations of the camera. It's not a big deal though, since the main purpose of the camera is to see inside the room.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 3, 2020

Review Text: Loving this camera so far! Got it for a baby monitor in my youngest room and it works great. I can’t think of any complaints. I turned off the motion notifications just because it would blow up my phone and its not necessary for us. I keep it on live when she’s napping/at night and it works like any other baby monitor. I have used the Kasa one in the past and didn’t like it because while on live view it times out every 30 minutes and stops so you have to constantly push continue. Which that is a big deal to me and the Nooie doesn’t time out it stays live all night long.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2022

Review Title: Not good for what I wanted
Review Text: I was looking for something we could use as a portable baby monitor and this will be perfect.Update... we unplug ours regularly, and maybe that is our problem but I wanted something we could take with us easily on vacations or to friends houses or out to our shop or even in different rooms in our home but everytime I try to use it, it struggles to connect and if I can get it connected, it struggles to stay connected as I move around.  We have a big house and a lot of land so I have my normal internet and the internet extension along with another router in our machine shop/bar and I was told by customer service, that once connected on the same internet that I should be able to hop between them and stay connected but that has never worked for me.  They were trying to work with me early on but eventually just stopped responding and I never had my issues resolved... about to just toss it.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2021

Review Text: ***update stopped working after about a month. Tried resetting and updating but couldn't get it up and running again. Customer service has not responded either.Just set it up last night so far so good! For the price I am pretty happy with the picture quality. I setup the motion detection and sound detection and doesn't seem to be working that well with my pet even on high but pretty happy with the purchase otherwise. Set up was pretty easy as well. Haven't tried the night vision yet.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2019

Review Title: Works great with Echo Show for constant viewing
Review Text: I got this because the Blink camera offered in promo's with the Echo Show would only stay active for 5 minutes of viewing. I work from home and with Covid I need to be able to watch my children from my work space in the house while they are in the living room/kitchen area. I plan to buy another to put in the kitchen. The motion detection is a great idea until it catches motion in a mirror and then stops there while my children are on the other side of the room. I haven't tried mounting it to the wall but I have it sitting on my entertainment center and it doesn't show the whole room the way the Blink camera does. I don't know if that can be solved with a lens or if that is it's limit but it's still worth it! The "live" view is slightly delayed by a couple of seconds or so, I can see my children walking to my room to knock on my door as they are already knocking. Overall, as a "baby monitor, pet monitor, live monitor" for long viewing this is the camera to get. If you want something for short viewing or just motion detection recording I would go with Blink.Comparing the two cameras is like apples and oranges so if there is a camera that could incorporate all the aspects of each that would be my choice but for now I will have both the Blink and Nooie.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2021

Review Title: Overall worth the money - good picture quality with a little lag in alerts
Review Text: Pros:1. Setup is pretty straightforward. Instruction is clear. I have a dual band WiFi router and one thing I notice is I just need to connect to 2.4G WiFi at the initial pairing. After I set it up, I can still have my phone on 5G while connecting to the camera.2. I also like it being able to be moved around the house and plug in anywhere without additional pairing.3. Night version is not perfect but not bad at this time.Cons:1. I use it to monitor my son’s sleep. The sound and motion detection functions are a little laggy. The alert always come a few seconds after he actually cries.2. The voice it passes is too sharp to turn on, especially when he cries.3. Drag to move is a little laggy but ok.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2020

Review Title: Doesn’t work with Alexa. 1 user camera
Review Text: A year later and the camera is just so-so. I use the app because it DOES NOT work with Alexa. Only I can turn it on/off and I have to delete and re-add the camera on the app most times when I have turned it off and it hasn’t been used in a few days. My husband can only see live view when I added him as a user and has no control over the device which is a bummer. If it was able to be controlled through Alexa, he’d have access to it like we both do using our Ring cameras via Alexa. Overall, it’s good when it actually works. Alerts me when there is motion. We mostly got it for when we are away or when we need to monitor our children/pets. Night vision is pretty good.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2021

Review Text: I wanted to love this camera. I give it a three because the quality of the image day and night is great! But what’s the point in a good image if the app never loads. By the time the app loads my son is already out of bed and down the hall and we are chasing him. Sometimes I have to close the app down multiple times before it loads, and then feature to pan the room freezes the app up. We have two other WiFi monitors in our house and I regret not just buying the same one.This will be a really nice camera if they can work through the glitches in the app. I have started my return and will buy the monitors we’ve been using for over a year with no issue.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2021

Review Title: Faulty cam replaced for free from support
Review Text: #Edited 10/24Had a random email from support that Nooie sent me, offering free camera replacemnt and support.  My old unit was obviously faulty, because the new one sent to me connected without a single hiccup or issue.  Back to good ol' 5 stars.It was working.  Now no matter what I will never connect to 2.4 ghz.  Reset everything and still no go. Passwords match exactly.  I connected all my smart home lights and dare I say blink cameras with ease and no problem.  Now it just sits there as a failure to connect paperweight.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 22, 2021

Review Title: Camera quality is nice but that’s it
Review Text: The camera quality is great. That said, the rest is not. I’ll be sitting silently next to the camera and it will alert me to a sound. But my daughter will be screaming and I get no notification.  The app is slow. It takes a while to load, and often freezes while I’m adjusting the settings (turning off/on the sound detection) so if I get a notification and try to open the app it takes a while to open and I end up just going into babies room to see what’s going on. Which I try not to do because if she isn’t awake I don’t want to wake her. I can’t trust this camera at all and am disappointed with this purchase
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2021

Review Text: For such a cheap piece of hardware, I thought I was in for some pretty shoddy quality. Fortunately, this has become one of the cameras most used for keeping an eye on the dogs while we are away. The motion detection does a surprisingly great job alerting to and following movement from our two pups at home.  The camera quality is adequate at 1080p, and the microphone and speaker allow for two-way communication. The app is easy to use and you are able to pop a sim-card in for storing video without having to pay for a cloud subscription, however, that IS an option if you so please.The one and only small gripe I have with the application's software is a semi-buggy "swipe to pan and tilt" function. Sometimes, it's a bit too sensitive. If there were a virtual direction pad paired with the swipe functionality, this would be perfect. Sometimes, when swiping left or right to swivel the camera, it will suddenly move 180º and fully up to the ceiling.Other than that, this camera is perfect!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2019

Review Text: UDATED REVIEW:NOOIE customer service reached out via email and communicated options to help better my experience with their products. They sent me a new cam to try and thankfully it’s working much better than the first one I bought. I recommend you try Nooie if it’s something you’re interested in. Customer service very helpful.PREVIOUS REVIEW:I don’t usually take time to write reviews, since I have other important matters to take care of, but really feel this is needed.Please do not buy. I don’t know why this always randomly disconnects. Once I open the app, it doesn’t show camera at all or says may be offline. Even after trying to refresh it doesn’t work so I’ve had to delete and start over in connecting the nooie cam (just like when you first set up) numerous times and I’ve had this only for 3 months. Sadly, it’s just wasting my time to connect and I’m very patient and give all products the benefit of the doubt. Only great thing, when it works, it really works well. Please invest in a different cam.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 5, 2021

Review Text: We purchased this camera to use as a granny cam to be able to check in on my 97 year old mom who lives by herself.  This has provided tremendous peace of mind to us especially when we aren't able to reach her by phone (because she can't hear the phone or her phone battery has died).  It was super easy to set up EXCEPT required the wireless internet be on 2.4GHz no 5.0 Ghz which was a bit of a pain for us to figure out but with some help from the cable company we did it!  We can log in on our phones or tablets and check in on her and it has been wonderful.  Great range of motion - it follows movement pretty well - or you can scroll the screen - 360 degrees pretty amazing.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2020

Review Text: The camera has a good picture. Configuring to your wifi is simple, possibly insecure. Use is pretty intuitive. Overall it works well enough.My complaints are that moving back and forth in video in recorded video is hard. There is a progress bar line you drag and it is hard to hit an exact time by a full minute or more. The motion tracking is exaggerated. When something moves, the camera often shifts past the movement and then back. It also doesn't track up and down, just side to side. There is also no option to only record movement, causing hours of useless video to look through. Lastly, there is no web interface. Everything must be done through the phone.Update: after a recent update, the camera constantly becomes unavailable and requires a reboot. Now suddenly it has been removed from my phone altogether and will require being completely setup.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2020

Review Title: Returned, not good for baby camera
Review Text: Returned this camera for several reasons. First off, you cannot log in to view this camera from different devices without forcing a logoff from other devices. Meaning you have to log in every single time to view the camera unless you view it from the same device constantly. Night Vision is good but daylight quality is awful and pixelated. When the camera switches between night vision and regular it makes a loud clicking noise. It seems sensitive to any light source for night vision and sometimes will click back and forth over and over. One of the main issues we have with this camera is that it will freeze and you have no idea its frozen. We use this as a nursery cam, so your sleeping baby is just a frozen picture and they could actually be wailing crying!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2019

Review Text: This is an amazingly good quality little camera.  We use it to check on our little dog and just keep an eye on the place when we are gone.  Both day and night picture quality is outstanding, tracking motion around the room is good.  I just wish there was a way to turn it on and off without logging out of the app; it would be nice to disable it when we are home with the push of a button rather than logging out and having to log back in when we want to see it.  There are several options available for how much you want it to record and store footage, for a reasonable monthly fee.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2022

Review Title: The best home security/nursery camera on the market now!
Review Text: Oh my god i cannot rave enough about this product! I wish i had known about this camera back in 2018 when i was shopping for a camera for my first sons nursery. This camera is AH-MAZING!!! The video quality is amazing itself way better than the competitors like the cocoon cam i bought for my first sons nursery. Which was also $150 more expensive than the Nooie which comes in at $50. The motion sensing is the right kind of sensitive. My 2nd son is 5 months old and now sleeping in his own crib and the Nooie cam gives me peace of mind knowing I can check on him and even see his breathing due to the great camera quality then relax myself to get some sleep. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON ANOTHER CAMERA FOR YOUR HOME! I also love the 360 view of this camera because it honestly has great reach. I love this camera and will be buying another one or two.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2020

Review Title: Affordable, Easy To Use Camera. Buy It--You Won't Regret It.
Review Text: I purchased two of these cameras after reading and watching several positive reviews. I bought them specifically to monitor my dog while I'm away from home. I love that I can move the camera around to see other angles of the room and the night vision is spectacular. The Nooie cam app is very user friendly and I could easily add multiple cameras to it.  The motion detection is spot on. However, I haven't received any sound alerts yet but that might require changing some settings in the app. I really like that it has the ability to save footage on a micro SD card and that I'm not required to pay for cloud storage (however, it is an option) and I don't have to pay any monthly subscriptions. The app is 100% free. You can also take pictures or video from the live feed in the app and they will save directly to your photo gallery for easy sharing with family or on social media.To be honest, I really wanted to buy a furbo camera so I could also send treats to my pup while I'm away but Nooie's specs were literally identical to furbo without the treat popping ability. It was a no brainer to purchase the Nooie 360 when considering the price point and good reviews. You can buy 2 for half the price of the other. I'm really happy I did. Maybe Nooie will create an affordable dog treat dispensing camera too? I'd buy it for sure. :) @brianna.cvt
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2019

Review Text: I am very happy with this camera. We use it as a monitor in our toddler’s room. The alerts can be a little sensitive so I turned the sensitivity down to low. I don’t think this monitor is ideal for a baby but for a toddler that just needs to be checked on occasionally it works just fine. I leave the app closed at night and am alerted if he wakes up via notifications. You cannot be logged into the camera from 2 devices at one time. It is also annoying to have to go through setting up via a new WiFi network when we go out of town but that’s not that often so not a huge complaint.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2022

Review Title: when it works it's great, but it doesn't usually work
Review Text: I got this camera to watch my son in his crib because he's starting to roll over but he can't always roll back and if I go in and check on him every time he makes a noise he will never go to sleep. I bought a holder for it just in case and that is very useful since I don't want to wall mount it cause I live in an apartment. I don't use the motion detection because he sleeps in our room and then we would get notified everytime we walk in our room. I did try it out though and I like that you can select a small square of the screen for motion detection instead of the whole area. the picture quality is good and so is the night vision. the actual camera is great but the stream and connectivity is horrible. when this works it's great, and I really enjoy the range of coverage you can get, even though I wish the horizonal movement could be more. if there is any large movement the stream loads constantly which kinda makes it useless. it takes a while to set up as the company barely send instructions with the package. I had to reinstall the app 4 times for it to work consistently and still there can be long load times. there is a two way audio which works fine one way but I can't hear audio from the stream. you have to pay a subscription to get previous playback which I have no problem with cause that's not what I got it for and the subscription seems reasonably priced. all in all it's ok, but since I'm using it to check on my baby and not an empty house or a dog I'm going to return it and get a nest camera instead.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2021

Review Text: The camera and all its functions are good. I actually bought a second for another room but when I kept the motion detection on I kept noticing a weird noise. When I did a bit of detective work, I discovered it was coming from the camera every time it would rotate to follow anything!  It was a kind of creepy moaning noise so I had to turn off the motion detection!  The first one still works like a charm and is very quiet and respectful!  The picture quality of both is good. If you’re looking to be able to carry on a conversation with someone through the camera, don’t buy this one though. Even my dogs can’t hear me speak to them through in the middle of the night when things are very still!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2020

Review Text: We have had our monitors for a year now. I love being able to check in when I am not home. The picture quality is awesome, night vision is great! The motion detection is ok but not amazing. Sometimes it over rotates when tracking things. We currently have 6 Camera's.  The set up is super easy.  (Samsung phone) Also note if you do not have good wifi, then make sure to get a booters. Keep in mind, if you have a poor wifi connection it doesn't connect well. It is not device messing up, it's the wifi connection. We have wifi booter and all 6 camera's work great. When setting up make sure to switch over to the 2g wifi when connecting. Then you can turn your phone back over to your 5g connection after set up. The one thing, I hope they can improve is being able to view multiple monitors at the same time. I wish, I could watch at least 2 at the same time. Then tap the screen to veiw one if I needed to see something closer. That would make this set up perfect. But other then minor things. I highly recommend this monitors. I will say it's really easy to switch in between cameras.Update! They came out with a New app and yes there are few things they are working out but now we have live veiw on multiple cameras now. Which is a game changer for me. They have great customer service and Enola helped me and was fast on response and help solve my issues. I love that Nooie is constantly improving. I would 5 star it but it's not quite perfect yet because but it's getting close! I love my cameras!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 6, 2020

Review Title: Didn’t work! Super delayed, horrible picture quality.
Review Text: I was very disappointed with this product. It wouldn’t connect to my WiFi long enough to work. I’ve had a few cameras like this (different brands) and never had a problem. I bought this to watch the puppy in his crate since he likes to escape and it was horrible. The picture was all blurry, the night vision made everything look dark so I couldn’t actually see him in his crate and it was so delayed. I could walk in front of the camera and then five minutes later I would see myself doing that on my phone. Would not recommend! *** To replace this one I went to target, bought a hi-tech nanny cam that came with a screen AND connects to my phone (that requires the same internet as this camera) and the footage is clear as day (even the night vision). *** So I wouldn’t recommend this camera, there are cameras for $20 more that are 100x better.

Review Title: Great quality camera, couple minor things, excellent value
Review Text: I got this to replace an older arlo baby monitor from 2 years back. I was looking for improved video streaming quality and with a second one getting their own room soon, I wanted to test this out on my older 2 year old daughter before committing to a second. I was very pleased with the quality at any price, the price toys low only made it a no-brainer. I like that it came with a wall mount but the camera is limited with the angle it can point up, I solved with a wedge to propt it up slightly, now we can see the whole room if she climbs out of bed. I also thought the cable was nicely made but way too short,it's micro usb so I had an older cable I lent to its use. My wife and I ended up ordering a second one for our newborn.

Review Text: We absolutely love our nooie camera! We use it in our sons room and the picture and two-way sound are super clear. The wide angle view is pretty good but I really love how easy it is to move the lens around to see other areas of the room. It comes with a mount kit which makes it easy to move out of the way so my son doesn’t mess with it. I also love that there is not a required subscription model like some other cameras. We ended up putting an SD card in it so we can see historical footage although, it works great as a toddler camera without it. We plan on  purchasing a second one for the living room!

Review Text: Oh, can't wait to share this. Got the product today, and set up right away, elegant design, so cute. The most important is easy setup, fatherhood is a busy role, no time to spend long time to study Bible size user manual, I love this easy set up Wi-Fi camara
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 14, 2019

Review Title: Worked okay for 9 months and then it stopped working saying incorrect wifi password
Review Text: I bought this camera in September 2020 and it worked well during the daytime. The motion detection worked but not all the time it was selective. I used it as a security camera and it worked well enough during the daytime that I paid the $5 per month for recordings, but there was absolutely no night vision once the sun went down there was nothing but a black screen until dawn.  Still I was satisfied until it began not working intermittently and chirping "incorrect wifi password" when it wasn't working. I was busy and didn't have time to deal with it. I emailed the company and asked for help and never received a response so I cancelled the $5 a month recording that I was paying them and stored the camera away until I had more time to figure it out. (I got tired of it working and then not working and chirping at me throughout the day.) Well last week I had time to deal with it and pulled the camera out and reinstalled it from scratch on my new cell phone and guess what - it won't even install saying "incorrect wifi password".  I checked and double checked and my password is indeed CORRECT. I will send one last email to the manufacturer and if they help me this time, I will change this review. Otherwise, I'm going to throw this camera away.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2022

Review Text: I got my first camera to use in my office and share with friends.. I liked it so much... I'm ordering my second camera.. I like the ease you can review or play back the video.. I have a number of cameras I use but this one will keep its connection on my Smart Home Alexa devices monitoring screens. Tracking movement with motion and sound is better than my other cameras..The cloud storage and a microSD card slot if you want continuous, local recording. The value of those free features alone is a big deal to me.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2020

Review Text: We bought this to replace our Danale camera, which is the same company this one comes from. The problem with the Danale one is that if it ever got disconnected from the WiFi, it would LOUDLY say "wifi disconnected" while my son was sleeping and disturb him. The Nooie camera doesn't make any noise if it becomes disconnected and has to reconnect. The picture quality is also far superior, as is the zoom ability. We like that we can turn the camera remotely to watch him in other parts of his room while he plays independently. We don't use the motion/sound detection features, so I can't speak to their efficacy.One downside is that getting it to connect can be a little tricky, and everytime you move the camera and have to unplug it, you have to delete the camera from the app and restart the connection process. It was frustrating getting it going, but it's been working really well for us the past couple of months. We also love that my parents can see the camera on their phones if they're watching him for us.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 16, 2020

Review Text: My husband and I were on the hunt for a baby monitor we could track using our iPhones and we stumbled upon this gem.  After reading the reviews, the details and description of the camera, and noting the price we decided to give it a shot.  The Nooie does not disappoint.  It was very easy to set up and the picture quality is excellent.  My husband set the camera up on his log in and I all created a log in. He was then able to share the camera with me through the app, so we can both view the camera at the same time.  It tracks movements and moves around 360 degrees dependent on where the movement is coming from.  We’ve practiced talking into the app and our voices come in clear on the monitor.  The unit must be plugged in and the wire isn’t super long but we make it work.  No subscription needed to access video.  We did purchase an SD card to put into the camera to record video we can review.  An overall excellent camera for $50.

Review Text: I used this for a camera in my daughter’s room. After 4 months, it no longer works. The camera shuts off and the picture/sound no longer loads on the app. I tried unplugging the camera, I tried deleting and redownloading the app, and I tried downloading a different version of the app. It boy works for a few minutes then shuts off.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 15, 2021

Review Title: Perfect baby monitor in my budget
Review Text: I was overwhelmed by the number of baby monitors available on Amazon. I spent days reading reviews here in Amazon and blogs. Most of them recommended monitors above $80-90. I wasn't comfortable spending that much.Then i found this  Nooie Baby Monitor, it fits all my criteria. There is an app using which you can connect more than one cam. App itself is very easy to handle and i can also move/turn the cam using the app. Great night mode and happy it also supports memory card. They do offer cloud storage but i dont need it. The cam itself is really well designed. Box it came in was also cool looking and minimalistic(Good for earth i guess).Bottom line: If you are like me who can't decide on which cam to buy which makes your life easier with a new born then trust me and go with this.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2020

Review Title: La mejor opción precio/calidad para monitorear a tu bebé.
Review Text: Excelente producto de muy buena calidad. Desde que abrí la caja y saqué el contenido del producto noté la calidad tanto del producto como del embalaje. La cámara es del tamaño preciso para ser usada como monitor de bebé, o cámara de seguridad. La instalación muy sencilla e intuitiva. Me encanto que fuese multivoltaje ya que no requiere de transformador especial. El sistema de seguimiento es bueno, tarda unos segundos pero cumple con su deber, muy silencioso el motor de giro. El único detalle que podrían mejorar es el lag que se produce al mover la cámara desde la App aún estando en la misma red wifi de alta velocidad. De igual forma la recomiendo 100% excelente relación producto/calidad/costo. Finalmente el envío fue espectacular el despacho a Chile fue 2 semanas antes de lo previsto.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2020

Review Text: I was nervous about this, however I am happy so far. Nicely packaged. Sleek camera. Set up was fast, for the most part, and it works. Camera has a little lag time but some other nice features like sound and movement alerts and two way talking. My husband also finds it cool. Great share feature, especially for deployed parents! Fun for kids (and to see what your pets do when you are away).I got it for a baby monitor and I think it will work out.Edit: dropped down from 5 to 3 stars. It works however you can’t use your phone for anything. If I get a call or need to reply to a text, it’s completely shuts out of all. Then after I find my poor baby is screaming hysterically for me. If I could login in on computer that would be fine- but I couldn’t find anyway to do so. I will be returning.

Review Text: I am not much into writing reviews however this warranted it. I bought this product to use as a baby monitor. The product looks good and sleek from the outside, However it's working has much left to be desired. The picture quality is good, however it has loads of issues primarily with the way app( on iphone) communicates with the camera device.1. the panning is not responsive.2. there's a lot of delay when using mic and speaker between phone app and the device.3. zoom is not responsive.4. it asks for firmware upgrade after setup which i thought would fix the issues, however it doesn't have any effect.5. camera app takes long time to connect to the device.I like the picture quality and night vision, however they need to fix these app integration bugs before this product can get useful.For now I will return the product and look for something else.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 28, 2020

Review Title: Very challenging to set up/pair with your phone.
Review Text: So, when this camera works, it's pretty great. Good image and good sound. The catch however, is that linking it, setting it up etc...is a BEAST. Its fickle, cranky and generally uncooperative. So, lets say you get it working in your baby's room (after much cursing) - great! But then you go on vacation, and bring the camera with, thinking its already paired with my phone, right? I'll just plug it in when we arrive. Nope! You have to go through the same rigamarole you did at your home, except now you're weary from travel and your problem solving akills are subpar. If you're a tired, impatient parent.... I'd save yourself a migraine and a bottle of wine and research some different cameras.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 7, 2020

Review Text: The camera itself is good and has a nice pic. Pan - Zoom is slow to respond using the Nooie App. But the worst part is two devices cannot use this camera using the same login at the same time. So you cannot have an iPad and iPhone logged in at the same time. The app only allows one device with the same account to log in. You either have to log off one device to use the app on another device or have two accounts. Should be more like Ring allowing multi-devices with the same account to be logged in at the same time. Needless to say returning this camer
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2021

Review Title: Good camera, works poorly with echo
Review Text: Camera works poorly with echo, good with iphone. When used with my echo, this camera has about a 20-30 second delay on the camera feed. It also crashes unexpectedly and the picture quality is terrible. Everything you don’t want in a security camera or baby monitor. It only seems to be a tech issue betwen the camera and echo though because running the nooie app on an ipad or phone works fantastic. It’s easy to pan and zoom, good quality picture, no tech glitches at all. I love the camera, just wish it worked better with the echo I bought to use it with.

Review Text: It worked great for a week but now the led flashes white rapidly and the app doesn't see the camera.  I reset it by pushing the little button with a paper clip and went through the setup process again but, it seems to be broken.  It still records video to the SD card so, it's not completely broken.  I'm returning it because it stopped working and it doesn't really do what I need it to do.  I wanted a camera that only records when it detects motion.  This camera does detects motion but it records all the time in an endless loop of short video clips about 17MB each.  The recording files do not open in common video players like Windows Media Player or VLC, but it does open in ACG Player.

Review Text: We’ve had this product for a few months now. I love the quality of the picture and the night vision. I love the 360 degree rotation. What I do not love is now, 5 months later, the camera will no longer rotate all the way down. I’ve tried emailing with the company to solve the problem and they’ve stopped responding after about 12 emails. Customer service for this brand is not good, and it’s clear it’s not the same person emailing me since I keep getting the same suggestions for solving the problem. For the record, I was never rude or aggressive in emails because I know that accomplishes morning. :) Regardless - Now I have a camera that cannot fit my needs. This product did start out great, and I assume I have a dud. I will not buy another to find out though.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2020

Review Text: I love how easy this camera is to use from my phone. I can get a whole view of my child’s room and super clear picture. I like how I don’t have to spend a lot of time adjusting its location while setting up to get a good view. I can just move the camera angle with my finger. The only thing that didn’t work for me was the notification settings. I set it to notify me of baby crying during the hours that my child normally sleeps but I was getting notifications all the time for other sounds around the house that weren’t crying so I just turned all notifications off. At some point I’ll try giving someone a call to figure out how to adjust my preferences. My house is small enough though that I always hear my kid from any room I’m in so right now it’s not a necessary feature. One other thing that would have been nice to be logged in to multiple devices at one time. When a babysitter is with him I’d like to be able to see him when I’m gone but then the babysitter wouldn’t be able to monitor him. Great product overall!

Review Text: We bought two Nooies and we are quite happy with the purchase. In terms of quality/price, this camera is definitely worth the price. The night vision is very good, quite impressive indeed. There is very little lag in terms of sound and the speaking option works fine. There is an option to film or take pictures that will be downloaded on your phone/tablet, but you can also use the SD card for continued recording.My only complaints are:1) every time you open the up it takes a bit to  get the live view running and if you switch on your phone to another app and then return, it will take again a bit to reload the live view. Sometimes you actually need to close the app and reboot.2) the camera is supposed to track movement but none of mines do it. It detects movement and sends you an alert but it doesn’t actually follow the movement.

If they fixed the interface and the random restarts this would be a 5 star camera budget or not.

Review Title: Great camera, we have peace of mind using it

Review Title: Best pet camera I've ever got

Review Text: I am absolutely blown away at the quality we’ve received with this camera and the price we paid for that quality! In the past we have always purchased Motorola monitors for our babies/children and found they they were reliable but only for a somewhat brief period of time. The picture with Motorola was subpar, connection was alright, sound quality was meh...customer service was ridiculous. Charging eventually crapped out.Right from the jump, this camera exceeded my expectations. I enjoyed the simple packaging, and what I read in the directions pamphlet. Setup was easy - the part that tripped me up a bit is when the QR code pops up, you have to CONTINUE to hold it in front of the camera even after the first ding you hear. I didn’t do that the first time and ended up having to start the process over. Very minor hiccup in the scheme of things. You can tell that setup was meant to be simple and very user friendly. The phone app is very easy to use (I have the app on my iPhone 12pro max) and the picture quality from the monitor is SO SO SO much better than what we are used to. Sound quality is also great! I am looking forward to seeing how this camera holds up over time and eager to purchase more for the rest of our home.EDIT: Since ordering our first Nooie 360 camera, we have since ordered two more! Setup was easy peasy with those too and the Nooie app still works great. And customer service was superb - Alma helped to make sure my ordering experience went above and beyond. Emailing back and forth was a bit cruddy but otherwise great. The only issue we’ve encountered thus far has been with the app itself when we try to do the two-way talking feature. The camera feed starts to lag pretty bad and my voice through the camera does not come in very clear. Picture is still amazing though and for the price you get a good product.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 2, 2021

Review Text: I had read this comment and similar ones before I made the purchase: "Only works on 2.4 and if your router password is longer than 13 charters don't buy...I'm not going to ... mess up all my other wifi equipment"  But I thought it was a good price and I'm pretty comfortable with electronics and my iPhone. WRONG. I should have taken heed. Get one that works with the more secure Wi-Fi most of us have in our homes in 2021!

Review Title: Absolutely worth the $50 perfect baby monitor
Review Text: The nooie360 is a perfect baby monitor, the video is very clear during the day and night, it has a speaker so you can hear the baby, you can zoom in to get an up close view of your baby. Another cool feature you can do is add alerts so if the baby makes a sound it can alert your phone or if the baby moves it will alert your phone. This feature is great if you want to enjoy some time outback by the fire pit 🔥 or if you want to step out back on a nice day to do some yard work. Also they have a good support team that can assist you if you need any help with your product. I contacted the support team and Alma was able to get back to me quickly and resolve a problem that I had. Absolutely worth the money and beets spending hundreds of dollars for an over the top monitor.

Review Text: I bought this camera to transition my ASD son from a crib to “big boy” bed. It drains your phone battery a little quick but that’s expected. I went back and forth for a while before buying this and I’m so glad I did it.

Review Text: Crystal clear image under both daylight and night vision. The sensitivity of motion detection alert can be adjusted in the app (the most sensitive settings can trigger alert when a small bug flies by). Make sure you have strong and stable Wi-Fi signal at the spot to have smooth video & audio stream.Setup was straight forward and the app was easy to use. I found there are 2 apps in the app store: one is "nooie" with blue icon and the other is "nooie cam" with grey icon. Both works but the "nooie cam" app (the grey icon one) is only for cameras and it is faster, while the nooie app also control other products like smart light bulb under the same brand but video feeds have more delay. Each account can only login to one app on one device at a time.  When you log in on a new device, the old device you previously logged in will be log out automatically. I believe this is for security purposes and is great.

Review Title: Ok camera, doesn’t deliver on all its features.
Review Text: 5/31 Update: Nooie support contacted me and sent a new camera and guided me to a their new app. Most everything works as expected now. The tilt on the camera still is lacking but we've learned to work around it. Two way voice and connection issues seem to be resolved now.Original: This gets 3 stars purely because it fulfills its primary purpose of us being able to watch our baby. The night vision works great, and we can hear what’s going on pretty well.What the camera lacks is enough downward tilt to be used close to her crib. In order for it to see our child we have to elevate it a couple feet above the crib and a few feet away.The second downside is the 2 way audio just doesn’t work. There is a huge delay from t the time you talk to the time the camera tried to play what you said, and 90% of the time it comes out garbled and choppy.The app can’t always connect to the camera after it has been set up, and we routinely have to back out and try again.Lastly these things need to be able to use 5ghz wireless. It’s pretty standard these days and has been for years. It might clear up some of the issues people experience.

Review Text: LOVE! LOVE! LOVE! I bought 2 and I’m going to order more.So I have 3 kids the boys share a room they are 4/6 and baby has her own room.I was only using a super simple baby monitor. Like the old school one for the baby I only needed it at night to hear her if she woke up. I decided to buy a camera monitor bc I got tired of sneaking in at night. Hoping not to wake her....I always check on my babies before bed. So now I just open the app and watch her sleep! The day/night vision is so clear.The camera moves around the room with ease.Microphone works great! I use the feature at night to help my boys go to sleep. I don’t have to go in there over and over anymore.Okay, so I feel like I almost didn’t buy this bc there a lot of negative reviews. But most were wanting to use this for security. That’s not what this is for...it’s a perfect baby monitor.I am the least tech savvy person. These were an absolute breeze to set up! Download the app plug them in and BAM!I did read the reviews and so I saw where someone said to make sure your WiFi is not 5g or dual lol or something like that? Still have no idea what it means ....so anyway I called ATT to make sure my router was compatible. They even looked up the product for me to be sure.The only negative is my husband can’t log on at the same time. But I still love everything else that is not worth taking a star away for. It’s a $40 camera.You pay for what you get....in this case though it’s really a bang for your buck.I do want to say one more thing. I use this in addition to my baby monitor (the cheap one) bc if she cries at night or is awake I know immediately. Like I said remember the price of the product you are buying.I also use it during the day when she naps and I’m outside with my boys to check on her. It always shows live I have never had a problem with it not...We were just out of town and I got on the app just to see our house and so now I’m going to buy several more for our house. They also make great nanny camsI have an iPhone so I can save videos directly to my phone.*********If you are mom and you basically want to watch your kids sleep at night or during naps. Or even want more accountability for sitters these cameras are PERFECT***************

Review Title: Great picture clarity, motion sensing, etc. and plenty of setting options
Review Text: Very quick and simple to set up and log in with clear and easy instructions. Happy with the picture, range, and variety of options. You can turn on motion sensing and night vision. Not a five star because it makes an double click noise when it switches from night vision to regular, I have color changing lights around my house so the clicking is on and off every 30 sec ish, which is audible both while viewing on your end, and if you are in a room with the camera (it took me a bit to find the constant click as it sounded like a faucet dripping). But that can be solved by turning the night vision to manual, and the quality is just as great. The cord plug in is a bit short and I’m hoping I can order and use a regular usb but longer. Overall, it has great audio and clear view so it serves excellent for what I need if for but maybe not so much for discretion.

Review Title: Best baby monitor camera we've found.
Review Text: We're grandparents and were looking for a baby monitor to watch our grandchild while she was napping at our house. We borrowed or bought four different cameras. This provided the best image quality and features by far, and surprisingly at the lowest cost. The only down sides are that there are some limits to the range of motion since we mounted ours on the ceiling.  It can't look straight down. Also this is not a good choice for a security camera since it's rather obvious and recording is done on an optional SD card inside the camera. The software is great and it allows us to share a live feed with our daughter. Not having a dedicated display is not a problem because the display on our cell phones is better than any dedicated screen we've seen.

Review Text: I bought this camera with not very high expectations. I was amazed at how well it does work. The audio is poor but the images are very good quality. The motion sensing is pretty good as well. The application runs well on my iPhone. The pan and tilt function is a Slow on the phone but still works fine. I have not tried the motion detection notifications. I will remark that set up of the camera is relatively easy but the camera has to have the code very still to connect properly or it will error.  In other words you have to set the phone on a surface so it doesn’t move at all. It took repeated attempts to set up the camera with the scan code. You have to reset up the camera after firmware updates so this is also very frustrating. For the cost of the item I am very pleased with my purchase and would recommend. The image I took is with the camera with no additional lights very early in the morning.

Review Title: Works when it feels like it.

I took a screenshot of it happening at 2 AM. And when it disconnects, I have to go back in there and set it back up. I couldn't go in my kids room at 2 AM to set the camera back up. Not to mention it's supposed to notify my phone when a motion is detected. It never has. My husband walks in, in the middle of the night to test it. Not one notification. Review Title: Great value with full Echo Show integration
Review Text: Glad I came across this product as I was about to pay 4x for a fancy baby monitor. Review Text: I love this camera so much! We were replacing our OG baby monitor due to awful night vision, and were looking for something with an app. I had never heard of the brand, so after reading reviews, we took and chance and are THOROUGHLY impressed with Nooie!!PROS:- Amaaazing night vision! Our night light in the room doesn’t affect the camera (a previous problem), and the black and white coloring doesn’t constantly readjust (if you have an old camera, you know what I mean). This is hands-down the best night vision camera!!- Quick response time!My other worry with an app camera (versus standard monitor and camera) was the response time in opening the app to seeing the room. I’m happy to say this performs well, and I see a clear picture in less than 3 seconds. A plus for first-time moms.- Motion/sound detection is on point! I turned on all of the alert options (crazy first-time-mom-ness), and it easily picks up noises, cries, and movements of our sneaky toddler. It even has a high-medium-low setting for this detection—a feature I love!- Picture on Point! The picture is incredibly clear, even when zooming in. I was worried about the clarity during night vision too, but it’s just as great as day!- Great price!! Since it was on the lower price point, I was pleasantly surprised with the quality and features.Cons:- The only thing I would change is vision directly below the camera. We mounted this on the ceiling facing down, so it rotates well to view about 90% of the room. The only spot we’re missing is right under the camera, since it cannot point straight down. It might have a slightly better view mounted in the corner of the room, but this small blind spot for us is not a big deal.

Review Text: The camera quality in bright daylight is fine but that's about where the cameras pros end.The camera does not have good range. You cannot see below the camera for a good 4 feet from the wall, not great for a nursery. Maneuvering the screen to get the camera to move is annoying and somewhat difficult.  The quality of photo isn't anything spectacular and in night mode it is worse. It freezes and I have very good wifi. The mic picks up more background noise than anything. Aside from that, the app is terrible. Only one person has access to everything. The camera CONSTANTLY disappears from the added cameras and you have to keep force closing and hope it returns. Sometimes it takes over 5 minutes to pull it up. I paid for the ability to access recorded videos. The playback is terrible and not user friendly. Now, this is the last straw, I was logged out and it is telling me my account doesn't exist. Just started using it for the nursery but am out of my return window so I'm stuck eating the cost. Disappointing.

Review Text: I use this camera in lieu of a baby monitor and it’s perfect for us. The sound and motion detections are both capable of being set to very sensitive so they detect even the slightest sound or movement from baby.Pros:- turn camera on/off easily within the app- clear picture and sound- excellent night vision- take snapshots or record video through the app- motion tracking (I haven’t used this feature yet but I like that it’s available)- adjustable and scheduled motion detection (when set to high sensitivity it can even detect the mist next to it coming from a humidifier)- adjustable and scheduled sound detection- rotate image to hang camera upside down- you can share the camera live feed with another user as long as they have a separate account- you can speak through the camera- 360 feature is amazing, you can move the camera up/down/left/right through the app with ease- ability to zoom in with clear enough images- status light allows you to know whether your camera is on or off- easy setupCons:- if you want to playback footage you need to purchase a monthly subscription to their cloud storage or an SD card- if you bring your camera to a different house you need to reset the camera to use it again- you cannot login to your account on two devices, the app will automatically log you out of one- startup can take longer than 30 seconds- if you leave the camera on consistently the lens area does get very warm (note: this is not an issue when the camera is plugged in and off)Overall, I honestly love this camera. I bought it through an amazon lightning deal, but I would purchase another one full price. I would (and do) recommend this camera to my friends and family. I don’t think you need to be particularly technologically savvy to use this item, but if you are someone who struggles with texting, taking pictures, or using apps on your phone then a virtual camera isn’t for you. Please note that you must have WiFi to use this camera.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2020

Review Title: Low price, low quality, but good customer service
Review Text: We’ve had the Nooie 360 for several months now, and overall I’m pretty unsatisfied. The camera has always taken a very very long time to load up the feed, sometimes requiring multiple closing out of the app and reopening. The image quality is just fine, not great. Very slow FPS. I also don’t love that it tries to sell you cloud storage and other products within the app.More recently, as in the last week or two, the camera will randomly just stop working altogether for hours at a time. It displays a message saying your camera is offline, despite no wifi issues with any other device in my home, and the camera itself displaying the white light indicating it’s on and working.I definitely regret going the cheap route. You get what you pay for with this product.UPDATE June 2021:Nooie customer support did reach out to me after I posted my review and they asked me to double check the app I was using and offered three solutions to my poor experience: a full refund, another camera, or another item from their line of products. I went ahead and took the full refund which was processed quickly. Overall I would say the product review remains the same, however I do appreciate the effort and timeliness from their customer service department. Updating to 3 stars for that reason.Also note for future customers - I did notice when double checking my app that in the iOS app store, there are actually TWO different Nooie apps. One is called "Nooie Cam", and the other is called "Nooie". Both from the Nooie development team. The correct app to use is the one called "Nooie".
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 6, 2021

Review Title: 90% of the RING 4K functionality at less than 10% of the price!
Review Text: I am not one to write reviews all the time but I had a baby not too long ago and a camera to watch her while sleeping was a must... I just saw a review on the RING 4K camera and I was impressed but then I saw the $500 price tag, wtf? No way... for a webcam????So I decided to try a cheap version first to see if I needed something as bad-a as the ring 4K and let me tell you. I DO NOT, and neither do you. This cam has great picture quality you can aim it remotely and 360 degrees, and it works all the time without problems. There’s a tiny little of lag about half a second. There’s a slot for an SD card to record video.The night vision is awesome. I have this in a room that isn’t too big (14x14) and it can see across the room perfectly.You can access the webcam remotely with no additional hubs or subscriptions!!!Webcams are old technology I don’t know why companies try to charge so much for just adding a couple of “smart” features.We should all support those companies that are reasonable and sell you items like this, packed with the functionality you need and nothing crazy or useless just to charge you a ton.

Review Title: Pretty awesome camera for the price
Review Text: We received this camera few days ago and so far it is pretty awesome, especially for the price:-Packaging was Simple and elegant.-Setup was easy and quick.-Sound detection, motion detection, and night vision are all working great (you can turn all off and use it as a live camera if you want)-Can listen and speak two-ways.-Camera can record videos (both live or motion/sound based, very good for monitoring the baby). Viewing of recording is available in the app, but could be improved to make it easier to navigate within the video (when rewinding or trying to skip just a little).Overall, we are very satisfied and Happy with this camera. It surves the purpose we got it for and gets job done well.

Review Title: Initially great- then a nightmare! Buyer beware...
Review Text: Easy to set-up and clear picture. We can't wait to use it when our baby comes.Update:  camera stopped connecting to wifi for some reason. Review Text: Build Quality seems excellent.  Set up is straightforward.  Video AND Audio quality is superb.  The only issue I had was that there was nothing in the instructions that indicates the Logo should be removed from the lens.....I didn't notice this at first and thought the camera lens was defective; then I realized that the "Logo" is a small piece of plastic that protects the lens during shipment and must be removed prior to use.  Also, make sure the device you pair it with is using the 2.4 GHz WiFi band and not the 5 GHz band.This is my first webcam and I had it up and running within 15 minutes.  A more experienced and tech savvy person should be able to do it in less time.You will be impressed with the overall quality.  I hope it will work for many years.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 14, 2019

Review Text: Wow! Best $50 I spent this week.  Shipping was so fast. I ordered it Saturday and got it Sunday.  Super easy set up, great picture and sound.  I love the 360°.  I watch my granddaughter while momma is at work and needed a monitor. We bought the owlet duo with smart sock baby monitor for my daughter for Christmas. It was $400! I really feel ripped  off right now.  This is a great camera, better then the owlet and she doesn’t ever use the stupid sock thing. I highly recommend.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 21, 2022

Review Title: High quality, especially for the price! ... never mind pass on it
Review Text: Got this camera for the nursery & I love it. Some of the reviews said you couldn't unplug it & move around without having to set up again, so I tested that right away as we will use this for travel too & I had zero issues. As soon as I plugged it back in it rebooted & linked back up fine. Initial set up was a breeze as well.I like you can set the sound or motion detection at 3 different levels & you can turn them off completely. The picture quality is great too. It really is a great camera, especially for the price point. With our first born I spent twice this much & the picture quality was crap & it died before our babe was 6months old. This one definitely appears much higher quality!So far I haven't found any cons, but will update my review if I do.UPDATEall of a sudden when trying to see the camera through the app it fails & says check internet connection, which is fine. Planning to return camera.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 30, 2020

Review Title: Great affordable choice for a WiFi camera
Review Text: This camera is great for keeping an eye on my 2 year old in his room. His bedroom is upstairs, so it’s nice to be able to check on him without having to go into the room and disturb him unnecessarily. It’s also nice that I can go outside and do yard work while he’s sleeping, and the sound notifications let me know when he wakes up. I turned the motion detection off because the notifications drive me crazy if someone is in the room moving around. The picture is great, sound is not as good as my fancy baby camera, but I don’t need it to be perfect for a toddler’s room. Would be great in a playroom also, or any room you want to be able to keep an eye on. We have it mounted on the ceiling, which is nice...I can pan the camera to see the whole room. We just had to buy a longer cord to mount it on the ceiling, as the one it came with was pretty short. Easy to mount and remove the camera if necessary. I wish nooie offered a longer cord, as the first third party one we ordered was a dud and we couldn’t get the picture, only sound. Ordered another and it’s working great again.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 16, 2021

Review Text: I got my first Nooie cam back in the summer to have something I could watch my 6 month old when I was in another room or not at home and have been very satisfied with these cameras. The app is extremely simple and easy to setup and sync multiple cameras to, in addition to saving sections of video or taking photos out of a video if desired. After a few months of use I decided to order a few more and now have a total of 3 of the nooie cam 360 and one of the stand alone kind that does not move. I would highly recommend these cameras to anyone looking for something simple and reliable with excellent night vision capabilties and can be moved around to see nearly an entire room!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2019

Review Title: Affordable, great picture and quality, and piece of mind for surveillance of child, house, and pets!
Review Text: I received this product on October 23rd, 2020. I waited to do my review in order to get a real good sense of how it performed and how well it held up after 3 months of use. I will say that I am incredibly happy with it!The cam replaced an older Cacoon Cam, that though performed great, was ultimately a bust when it went out of business and had a new App paired with it. Long story short, it was a terrible user experience.The Nooie, when received and unboxed, had trouble syncing with the app. Maybe it was human error, but was a breeze after I got past that trouble spot. The movement detection can be a bit sensitive, which in turn is a good thing, though I turned it off in the end because it blew up my phone with notifications. I just check in my child from time to time which is all I really need. The quality of picture and manual direction are a real game changer compared to our older cam.Overall, my wife and I are pleased with the Cam and would recommend this product comfortably to anyone else looking into a price friendly product and piece of my mind for children and/or pets. I'm sure their surveillance versions (which may be the same product I'm assuming) are just as great!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2021

Review Text: It took a little bit to figure this out, but now I am so pleased! I purchased a longer cord separately to accomodate placing the camera in a good spot. I realized I don't want to use the "rotate image" feature since I'm not going to mount the camera at this time. I love the 2-way audio, the day versus night settings, AND I can make the camera turn or zoom in simply by basically using my phone screen as a controller. I feel like I'm more excited than I should be! I have a 1.5 year old and will soon have a newborn, so I may purchase another camera because I love it so much, and I've only used it 2 or 3 days!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 18, 2020

Review Text: The picture quality is great.  The night vision is great and it takes no time for the motion detection to send a notification to your phone. Probably the best camera we have bought for our kids. I actually can lay my baby down for a nap and feel comfortable knowing that I can keep an eye on them at all times amd I can go outside of the house and do yard work and keep my phone on me to check every 5 or 10 min. You can use it while your away on vacation to check up on your house. As long as the camera itself is connected to your home internet you can watch your house anywhere on your phone. The only thing I don't like is you can't use two phones at the same time you have to take turns logging in to the camera.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2021

Review Text: Excellent product. Transitioning from another type of camera I have had for a while. So happy with first Nooie 360 that I got another. I like the overall performance and simplicity of the product. Easy to use and setup.  Took a few minutes to get used to moving camera with swipes instead of onscreen buttons but much better. Reason for purchase is took keep track of pets. Nice bonus is checking on house. Only inconvenience is that I have not been able to send motion alerts directly to my email and instead need to be in the app to get alerts. Hoping Nooie adds nonvideo motion sensors for doors/windows to add to home security options. Overall great product and I am very happy.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2019

Review Title: Its a work in progress but..
Review Text: This camera has a load of features, albeit a bit raw, simply cannot be beat for the price.Pros:- camera quality is surprisingly good. Night vision is not necessary for me to use so no comment.- sound detection is nice but is a bit inconsistent- 360 degree horizontal and nearly 90 degree vertical angles are amazingCons: Now this is where this otherwise great product falls off and most of it falls on the lack of development and maintenance of the application (This is on the iOS)- the application is user friendly but many users have reported multiple issues with it.- the two way audio is a lacking advertised feature. You can listen to the audio the camera picks up on your app but sending audio through the app to the camera is slow and unusable.- As i mentioned in the pros, sound detection notification does not come in consistently. Maybe it needs to have a moment of silence before sending the notification for sound detection? I am not sureRegardless, I am happy with the purchase especially considering competing baby monitors are overpriced.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2021

Review Text: If I could give zero stars I would. Unfortunately, that’s not an option. I ordered this camera loving the description and the fact that you had a secure log in to view your chosen placement. However, what I received is nothing that was described. It looks nothing like the pictures and didn’t even come with an American equipped outlet plug. As you can see in the pictures, what I received was a very cheaply made camera and a European outlet plug. I obviously can’t even use it Since I don’t have European outlets, but if it was able to be plugged in, I wouldn’t feel comfortable using a camera I can’t identify. It literally feels and looks like a child’s toy, or a request to be watched by someone you don’t know. No thanks!  I received it less than an hour ago and already have the return processing. Will be getting my money back and going with another option. I guess you get what you pay for. I’m not sure how this has such good reviews. And not to mention, the bar code that was on the plastic wrapping is different than the one on the box itself. Like they covered up the fact that it was not the right product. Very shady feeling.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 28, 2020

Review Text: I bought a Nooie360 about a month ago. I was impressed enough that I bought a second one. We use them to keep and eye on an elderly family member who has fallen, slept in a chair over night, etc.  She is okay with the setup. The Nooie gets a thumbs up on most features. IMO, the thing that needs improvement is the speaker system.  I am soft spoken but my voice comes out quite sharp or harsh. I think it might frighten an infant or young child. The sound is the same on both cameras so it does not appear to be an isolated occurrence.  Additionally, there is no volume control.  The family member has a hearing loss but there is no way to turn up the volume. It ts at a fixed level. Overall, this is great technology for the price.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 22, 2019

Review Text: Picture quality is amazing even when fully zoomed in.Motion and Sound detection sensitivity is adjustable and has timers so that we can choose when we want to get notifications.Set up is really easy tooThe only thing I’m not satisfied with is that the camera doesn’t pan around when I try to move it using the app. We know that it can move because it did when we first turned it on but it won’t move around like the video showed
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2021

Review Text: The picture quality on this camera is impressive. I wasn’t expecting much for that price. We bought this camera after investing in a horrible and expensive baby monitor that crashed on us at least twice within an hour. This camera was fairly easy to install and you can access it from everywhere. We only connect it during my baby’s nap/bed time or when I leave her at home alone with a sitter, we have never had an issue with it. The only downside of the camera is that it gets very after a while and that the speaker doesn’t work that well when I talk to my little one. Other than that it works great! I will be buying more whenever I am ready to go back to work. It has given me peace of mind the times I have left home without my baby.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 1, 2020

Review Text: Bought the camera and absolutely loved it for months it worked great.Then they did a update... Now the camera is useless.I no longer receive notification for anything, It does takes a while to connect and move the camera, I have also lost the ability to hear sound and speak via the camera.I have contacted Nooie multiple times and haven't heard a peep. I will not buy another nooie product, and have switched to Eufy 360 camera that has 2k vs nooie's 1080p for the same price.Thanks for nothing Nooie..
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2021

Review Text: This camera works great as a nanny cam for our kids. Regular daytime picture and night vision is clear and motion/sound detection alerts are sent to my phone to let us know if they're up and not asleep like they should be. Motion tracking is a little sensitive and sometimes turns itself to the wall even when no one is moving but other than that this is a great camera and has helped solve our issues with kids staying up all night playing in their room instead of going to sleep.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2021

Review Text: I have used this camera for 8 months now. Here are strong points of this cam:- You can connect multiple devices to this cam. For example, I am using an iPad as the primary display device for this cam, and I have two additional iPhones connected to it.- The additional phones do not need to be connected to the same wifi. It can access the camera with LTE. I use it outside the home to access the camera without any problem.- Awesome customer service. Very responsive and kind. I asked for a way to buy an additional wall bracket, but they have sent me one as a gift.So far, I am so satisfied with the product and company.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 27, 2021

Review Title: Product works okay, app glitchy. Doesn't completely turn off.
Review Text: The product works okay in terms of all the advertised functionalities (360, night vision, mic, etc). My issue is with the app, which is glitchy. Sometimes one camera would randomly go offline, and the only way to reset it is to unplug and replug it from the power source. ONE TIME, all my cameras went offline at once for more than 12 hrs and would not come back online even after resetting and replugging. I had to email Nooie customer support and it took another 12 hrs for them to reset it. Another suspicious point is that I always toggle my cameras off at night, but the camera is still warm in the morning. Just to test, I unplugged one camera overnight and touched it again in the morning-- it was much cooler than than the warm camera that was still plugged in but toggled off. So the cameras  don't completely turn off even if you toggle it off in the app, so who knows if it's just idle or continuously recording.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2020

Review Title: Update ** 5 star to 1 star in a month**
Review Text: Updated my review from 5 star to 1 star!**I loved this baby monitor and raved about it at first! It worked great, about a month after having it it stopped working...while my child was sleeping. We are in the middle of a move and staying with family for a few weeks, so the crib was packed up and we were letting our son nap in the bed with the baby monitor on. I work from home so I had my phone out watching him like usual while I work. Little did I know the baby monitor had froze and our son rolled out of bed. I didnt know until I heard a thump and then him crying and I instantly knew. We took him to the er and he was fine thank god! After coming back and looking at the monitor it now keeps saying network connection error and wont connect, it just wont work. We grabbed the crib out of storage and are sure to use that now. If you buy please dont leave baby or go away hoping you'll see when baby wakes up. Stay within distance to hear them fussing because camera may randomly stop working! **Absolutely love this camera! I got is as a baby monitor. I was expecting something half decent because of the price and I was shocked at how great it was! The video is super clear, you can move the camera by swiping the screen, you can zoom in and even talk through the camera. Night vision is perfect also. It awesome and worth every dollar I would absolutely buy it again!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on April 30, 2021

Review Title: Easy to step up , affordable , works well & great night vision/ day vision
Review Text: Received my Nooie 360 Cam shipped quickly & affordable. I wanted to be able to keep an eye on my dogs when I was not with them. It was simple to set up - downloaded the free Nooie App, connected it to Wifi, plugged it in. The app takes you thru a few simple steps and you are all set. The Night Vision is awesome. You can set the Nooie via the App to notify you when sound or motion happens. You set your preferences to suit what you want. You can hear thru the Nooie. You can move the 360 camera by touching the live picture in the app . It is compatible with Alexia and will eventually get around to adding it to our current Alexia. Ascetically pleasing . I would recommend the Nooie 360 , with a lot to choose from I am glad I choose this one.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2020

Review Text: We were surprised to find out we are having baby number 5. I had used a Zebora & Motorola Pet Scout66 before hand. We are living in a Shouse (Shed type steel house) that we just built. WiFi doesn't like steel and the other cameras i still had never would work properly for me. This one had the range I need & it picked up the WiFi right away. Its actually clearer than the Zebora and doesn't drop video like the last two brands did. We have about a second delay from live, but we live in rural Minnesota so that's the internet for you out here. I recommend this one. Im using it in the garage when baby gets older. Set up is easy. Mounting is easy.  Maneuvering is easy. the Zebora was backwards of what you were doing on the screen and Motorola didn't move. We love it for when we are away and the sitter is over.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2020

Review Text: We love the camera, especially the night vision.  When we look in on our little ones at night, the quality of the picture is awesome.  It allows us to make the picture larger without the picture being grainy. The other thing we also love is the 360 making out so convenient to look around the room when they're playing around. We often listen in and sometimes when talk to them thru the camera and they get a kick out of us talking to them. I would recommend this product to anyone who's looking for a good camera with night vision and a quality picture.
