Review Title: Great camera but the app sucks
Review Text: Love the night vision and the quality of the image on this camera. I’d only give nooie a 3 though because the app is horrible. I have to close it and open it multiple times to finally get the camera to load. I find it irritatingly ironic that it freezes on “always be there” and just loads and loads when clicking on the camera to view. It would be faster to go to the nursery and check on my baby 95% of the time, but I have a camera so I don’t have to and accidentally wake the baby if they aren’t up. Nooie app is seriously lacking but the camera is great and looks great. Hopefully they will update the app soon.

Great item and a great pric.

Review Title: Great picture quality, live viewing from app

Review Text: I just got this in the mail with in the last hour. I'm already crazy about it! It looks very nice and is not a eye sore like some camera monitors can be. The set up was super easy and took like a minute. The boxing of it made it look and feel like a very expensive device but the price of this is super affordable. I got it for my son's room so i can check on him playing while im downstairs or when hes sleeping as we use to share a room but now that my boyfriend and me have a house, i want to get him to sleep in his own bed but im so anxious about this transition. The camera moves and you have control over it, i find that very cool. I will have to get my boyfriend to put this on the ceiling as my son has a loft bed but that looks like a simple thing for him to do. I think it'll require a drill as it has plastic anchors and screws with a plate that the camera then attaches to. I was hoping to love this monitor as we are planning for a baby in the future, i do like it and think ill be buying a second one soon. The image is great and since i havent had it overnight i can't say what itll be like for the nighttime detection feature but I imagine itll be perfect. I also have recorded the camera as I moved it and took pictures from it. So worth every penny.

Review Title: A couple months in, literally no complaints!
Review Text: I don't often write reviews, but exceptionally good product experiences deserve them as much as exceptionally bad ones, so I'm here with nothing but good things to say about my Nooie 360 camera!  Installation and pairing could not have been much simpler and in 2+ months, I have had no connection or other issues with the camera. Thanks for a really solid product experience so far!

Review Title: It’s good when it works! Not good for travel!
Review Text: I have bought two now and have had issues with both. Either the sound stops working or the picture stops working or both. Or if you take it off a WiFi network and move it, you have to hard reset the device to get it to connect to the new network and when you are traveling with two babies it is a pain!! I have two Cameras and it takes about 20 mins per camera to get set up. Also the app has a long buffer time and does not always connect to the camera! There’ve been multiple times that I heard my baby crying in the other room and when I open the app to see them, the screen is just black! Very frustrating and potentially dangerous. With how many other products are on the market I would recommend getting a different one.The only two positives are that the picture quality is good (when it works) and I like that you can share the feed with others.

Review Text: Great camera, been using it as a baby monitor with my echo show. It allows me to take screenshots and video, and the image quality is quite remarkable (night vision is also impressive). I am able to add users in the app which allows whoever you share access with to view. Cloud service is pretty unnecessary but for those who are interested I should also mention that it is not bad at all, really it’s the most inexpensive that I have seen ($33-50/1yr).I would definitely recommend as a baby monitor.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2021

Review Title: Clear images, great quality product, easy to set up, works well with app.
Review Text: I got the Nooie 1080p indoor camera to keep an eye on my new kitten while I’m at work. It’s great! It picks up on people movement easily. My kitten is so tiny though and blends into my floor, so sometimes the nooie misses the movement, especially when he is in stealth mode. But it picks up the sound really well, even on medium sensitivity so I get the sound detected alert when he’s up and about.Night vision is super clear. On auto it will switch in the daytime when it is overcast outside, but if this is an issue, you can turn off the auto function.If you do not want to get the cloud storage, you can save live images and video to your phone from the app. That’s what I’ve been doing since I don’t have a memory card, and this is more for me to watch the kitten than for home security.I like the versatility of being able to mount the camera upside down. Initially I didn’t know where I wanted the camera so I plugged the usb into a portable battery pack so I could move the camera around the room while monitoring the images on my phone. I ended up liking the view I got from having the camera in my bookcase. The only thing is that I couldn’t get a good enough look at the floor directly in front of the bookcase from the camera just sitting on the shelf. The top of the camera has more vertical range so by mounting the camera upside down to the bottom of one of the shelves I could see much more of the floor.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 11, 2020

Review Title: Not working.  Does not even deserve a star
Review Text: I bought this monitor for my grandson who turns one year today and after trying to use this monitor for the past 12 months no one can get it to work.  Our tech savvy people have been trying all year and it is no use.  So disappointing.  I am not sure if something is missing from the box.  The wifi is great and worked well with another monitor which we had to purchase but  this one was clearly no use.  Such a waste of money in Covid times.

Review Text: This has worked well for us. I wanted a camera to check on our little dogs while we are out during the day. The picture quality is excellent - even in night vision. The coverage area is very food and manipulation is pretty smooth via the app. This is an especially great purchase since I picked it up as a lightning deal!

Review Title: Really like it, great customer support
Review Text: The sound stopped working for no reason so I contacted customer service and they put a patch through that fixed the sound. Now the app and camera are working great. Only thing is when the camera restarts the lens rolls to the back so you have to manually bring it back forward, which is a pain when you have a sleeping baby you don't want to disturb. But otherwise they thought of everything and it's great.

Review Text: I decided to go with this baby monitor for the fact that I can use my phone as the screen. It is very convenient because I always carry my phone! The price was exactly what I wanted it to be and the quality is good. The only thing I am not too happy about is that there is a little lag when you try to move the camera around, but I'm not sure if that is because of my internet speed or just the way the app is. Either way, I am still very satisfied with this product and would recommend it!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2020

Review Text: PROS & CONS:The Good: This product is ideal for a baby monitor. We have it on the edge of our newborn’s crib and use it so we can be out of the room while he sleeps or check him at night without turning on the light. Camera quality is fantastic, and it makes no sound nor emits any light which would startle him. Love it for these things.The Bad: Motion Tracking can be “switched” off, but the toggle turns back on whenever it decides and camera moves to track inanimate motions in the room, when we just want it to stay on the baby. Night Mode can be “switched” to either OFF or AUTO, and frequently turns itself OFF when we need it on in the dark. It will actively do this even while you’re watching the toggle after you just switched it to AUTO. Camera has frequent “Buffering” times, even with quality internet, located close to router.Summary: If you need to check on your little one, and want full room views, get this camera. For constant, live-feed view, without interruption…perhaps…get a better version of this. Not sure if we have defective product or if a “defective company” is at fault here
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2021

Review Text: Works great. Got as a baby monitor. Baby is not here yet but have it set up in my 3 year olds room to test out. A little slow to load if I have the motion tracking on and there is a lot going on, like multiple kids playing and the dog running around. Understandable though as there is a lot of motion and the camera doesn’t know who to follow. Once I turned that off I stopped having the loading issues. It still tells me there is motion detected and I can go onto the app and turn the camera to track it myself. I can also turn the tracking back on when baby comes and don’t have a million things going on in one room at the same time. Overall a great camera and I’m thinking about keeping this in my daughters room and getting a second for the new baby.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2021

Review Text: Honestly, I’m so annoyed that the camera itself is great. The image is clear and the night vision is great too, but the app you have to use for the whole thing is the ABSOLUTE WORST! It takes FOREVER to load up just so you can see anything. since you see everything on your phone, you’re not always going to have it open on your phone while using it for other things, so when you leave the app and come back to it, it takes a lifetime to load it all back up again, which defeats the purpose of us trying to see if our kids are ok, quick, rather then having to run upstairs, but now running upstairs is so much faster then waiting for it to load any video. The lag is insane, you can’t use the speaker well to talk to your kids, and the motion sensor is too sensitive, so if the air moved a curtain the camera moves away from where you have it positioned and it’s super hard to position it back on the app.I wish so badly I could return this and get something that comes with a monitor so we don’t have to use this horrendous app on our phones.

Does not have the issues the nooie has. I was trying this one because every time the power goes out, the amcrest will only reconnect by unplugging. Which in California there are rolling blackouts and old houses have flickers.

Review Text: This cam and its reviews kind of convinced me to take a chance on a no-name company. I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the camera and super clear night vision. Review Text: Setup with the app was pretty self-explanatory and the picture quality is great. I got this to use as a nursery room camera.A major issue that I’ve had is the delay time in the two-way speaker mode; it often takes up to a minute to register my voice into the room and the camera itself is delayed when using the voice communication rendering that function useless. Another issue is the motion detection and the fact that the camera does not seem to be wireless. It didn’t come with an instruction manual so maybe I’m just missing something, but it turns off when not connected so I don’t see how it could be wireless anyhow. The motion detection is often delayed and/or difficult to adjust when using the app.I wanted to love this camera. It looks minimalistic and has great picture quality compared to others I’ve seen. However, the issues I’ve had plus the delay when connecting to Alexa makes this purchase kind of pointless. I am considering returning and trying a different camera. Oh well.

Review Text: The most important feature doesn’t work: audio. Cuts in and out. Microphone is horribly static-y, if it works at all. Video quality is great, if only it were in real time. Used it for a 4 & 5 year old so audio wasn’t as important but it never saved me any trips when I needed to speak to them. Definitely can’t be used with a non-verbal child/person. 1/10 cause the video quality is decent. Wouldnt purchase again.

Review Text: I purchased this camera based off the reviews. Upon receiving the camera I was shocked that it came without any instructions. I was left to find the mobile app soley on what I could find online. I contacted customer service after downloading the wrong app. (grey icon) When I down loaded the correct application (blue icon) I was only able to sign into it ONCE. I have tried everything to sign back in. I've deleted the application and re installed it. I've closed out of the app completely and nope!! The mobile app is complete GARBAGE! Camera was decent. Quality was decent. Not able to say much about how easy or simple it was to navigate because I only sign into it once and that was to test it out. This is very frustrating. How good is the camera if I can't access it! If you view the comments in the app store they all say the same thing. Application is trash, it fails to sign you in, ect. Do not waste your time on this. There are better cameras out there with better improved applications.

Review Text: *Update to previous review*Nooie CS contacted us on their own and offered us a replacement camera. We've been using the 360 for a few months now and I'm pleased to say it has been working much better. The connection issue has gone away which was our biggest complaint.Had it two months. (1.)the sound is already not working. (2.)When daylight arrives, the camera can’t decide if it should be night or day vision and it clicks between the two. It wakes us up And it clicks in my sons room as well sometimes waking him up. (3.) Way too many steps to sign in the app.  So if you hear something going on in the room it takes a bit to Login. Only one phone at a time can be logged in. So it’s an extra step to “force” them out. (4.) it constantly loses connection to the Wi-Fi, you have to either physically reset your router or the camera to reconnect. Often This happens in the middle of the night when you’re unaware that it’s been turned (logged) off. When it does reconnect it makes this loud music sound that has also woken up my son. (5.) there’s no temperature gauge on it, A feature I liked on the baby monitors.Here’s what’s good. It’s a clearer picture, and the zoom in feature is nice.

Review Text: Design is sleek and picture quality is great! Review Title: Great value! Amazing baby/home camera for a fraction of cost.
Review Text: This is NOT a paid review.I bought this product (for our nursery) on lightning deal this week. I placed the order in the morning, and to my surprise the package arrived at 5:30 PM at my door step!PROS:Overall I am extremely impressed with the camera, quality, price, branding, packaging. (I own a few Arlos, and this one gives Arlo a run for their money)1. The app has a wonderful and intuitive user interface (As a professional IT product manager for one of the leading e-commerce companies, I am a sucker for such nuances).2. User experience is also well thought off (e.g.  allows you to format SD card via app, if you chose to store camera feed locally on SD card)3. The camera looks so cute, reminds us of Jeebo (AI robot). Sleek and modern design. Very light.4. The camera feed has a time stamp running. Believe me, with someone who’s home has been broken into, I know the importance of this to add as a corroborative evidence (legally).5. Motion detection (slow/medium/fast options) are smooth and covers our really long living room area.Scope for improvements:1. There are 2 apps from Nooie. Nooie Home and Nooie Cam. I had accidentally downloaded Nooie Home first and signed up for an account. Later realized I should have downloaded Nooie Cam. When I opened the Cam app, my sign in info was not detected by the app. I had to register. It would be nice to have “one app” experience for all Nooie devices and a “single user account/sign in” experience, across all apps.2. Would be nice if Nooie cam detects sound (pan to a space where there is noise) besides just motion3. Electrical cord’s length is about 3-4 ft. Would be nice to have a longer cord if you end up having sockets far away from camera. (Perhaps provide options)We bought this for our nursery. Tested it now. Love it so much, that we ended up using it for our living area. We will definitely buy another one for our nursery. It’s value for your money!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2019

Review Text: This is just a awesome baby cam. Buy this, buy this, buy this. The motion detection picks up the smallest movement.  Picture quality is clear even in night vision. Anyone is able to sign on if you give the the password and login, but whoever's is the maine person will get alerts when there is another sign on that isn't you.I just love this and the price makes me love it even more.

Review Text: Wasted hours of my time trying to get this camera to work. I was impressed with all the high reviews on Amazon and very disappointed when I downloaded that app to see that it has horrible ratings. Despite that I tried it anyway and realized after trying to get it to connect and read the QR code that it only works if you set it up on its own Wi-Fi connection to 2.4 GHz. Almost all routers these days are either 5GHz or a combination of 2.4 and 5. Mine is a combination and it still doesn’t work unless I separate them into 2 separate accounts which all internet service providers don’t recommend because it will make your internet connection worse. Totally not worth the time of trying to figure all this crap out and then to hurt your own internet speeds just to use this crappy camera. Literally buy anything else that you can easily connect to.

Review Text: We are a family of seven (7), so it is important to keep track of everyone 24/7, and this WiFi camera is just SPECTACULAR! We have six (6) other cameras (which are okay), and we needed one more, so we tried the Nooie — honestly, until now, we didn’t realize what we had been missing! The Nooie clarity and color are superior to all our other cameras. The App is extremely easy to navigate. Motion is terrific, and you can follow anything around a room. Review Title: Easy to set up, must purchase!

I am keeping both of my kids home, and I needed something to help me keep an eye on them while I work. Review Text: Annoying feedback if you keep audio on even with mic off. Some annoying tick sounds from camera speakers again if audio kept on the iPhone. Some disturbances if WiFi isn’t strong so lots of scrolling to wait thru. I can hear in room well but my voice to the room is often garbled and delayed. Frustrating. Maybe would be excellent in home with impeccable WiFi but my experience isn’t great. Also wish it was silent when mic was off so as not to wake sleeping babies/elderly family.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2020

Review Text: We have had many vehicles being stolen and houses getting broken into in our little country town so I decided it was time for some security without paying $200+ for a security system. So far I love it! You can set times for every day of the week where you want the nooie 360 to sense motion and sound and automatically start filming and tracking the moving object. Also the quality seems great! I'm even able to see my face from 10 feet away with the sun shining behind me. Without the sun blaring I'm able to see my facial features up to 20 feet away in daylight. So far in my opinion With this camera you definitely get the bang for your buck. I've only had the nooie for one day but I will definitely update in the future with some of my pros and cons.

Review Title: An amazing value for the price
Review Text: This is an amazing camera for the cost. Night vision is great, clear out to ~8 feet and you can see beyond that but not clearly. The motion detection works very well, tracks whatever is moving. I like the interface on my phone and the ability to talk as well as listen. Syncing the camera to the network and to my phone was as easy as 1-2-3! I just returned a camera that we could not setup. We are ordering a second as we are so happy with the first.

Review Text: The camera itself is good. Quality is clear and does well in light or night vision. App is a little glitchy when trying to speak, but mostly works. Biggest issue, which isn’t bad, just a little annoying, is that you can only log on to view monitor from one device at a time. If you switch the device you view from, like from phone to iPad, it logs you out and you have to log back in. We are happy with it overall, though.

Review Text: Ok, the picture quality is amazing. I love the motion and sound detection. However when watching the video I can't hear the sound half of the time, so whether you're using this as a baby monitor or a security camera, you can't really rely on it when it comes to listening. I like that the camera can follow movement, and that you can change the view of the camera so easily. I'm just disappointed about the sound quality, it's very hit & miss

Review Title: Great customer service but can't connect to wifi unless sitting next to router
Review Text: Update: great customer service. The customer service team reached out after seeing my first review and immediately shipped me another camera at no cost (even though I returned the first.) unfortunately this camera has the same issue so I can’t increase my review to 5 stars. I did increase to 3 stars though, bc I was very impressed with the level of customer service and speed of action. Just wish this one would have worked.I have a modest split level home and this monitor could not connect to my wifi unless I was sitting right next to the router, which is on the lower level. All other devices work in every room of the house, but the minute I brought this into my daughter's room, it wouldn't connect. The wireless range ability is horrible on this product. Returning.

Review Title: Good for home. TERRIBLE for travel.
Review Text: Picture Quality is awesome. If you’re using it for your home camera, it’s probably great. We wanted to use it for travel only, which I would definitely NOT recommend. We loved the idea of being able to see the kids while we’re out and about and the kids are with a babysitter, but it’s terrible for traveling. Setting it up is a PAIN. It setup easier at my parents house, but when when we took it to my in-laws I could only get one to work and it took me over an hour to get that one to work. It was on 2G network, I checked everything in their troubleshooting, and reset it a million times. I was so frustrated with them it ruined my first night of vacation. The same thing happened when I took them to my sister in laws house. I think one of them was defective...I only got it to work one time and never again. The one that did work, again took many attempts to setup and is just really frustrating. It’s so much easier to use a camera that is just plug and play and does not connect to the internet. It didn’t work in their basement bedroom, which was where one of our kids was staying. So, if you’re using it for home, it’s probably great, but do NOT get it for traveling.

Review Title: Great product, especially for the price!

Review Text: I had an expensive $170 Owlet camera that  I received on my baby shower and I had to return it because there were apps glitches all the time. The signal was not very good and the sound was not working.I’ve done a lot of research and found Nooie camera. I absolutely love it! I didn’t experience any disturbance with it. I find amazing price/ quality ratio too !  The camera is very good and you can zoom in and out AND the most important thing for me is that you can manually move it in all directions. Very impressed of the night vision camera quality too and it has the option to switch off the white light and so the baby will not wake up. Review Text: Excellent HD camera with multiple uses. Currently used as a baby monitor with the phone app which allows you to view live feed, record video, or take a picture. The app will send a notification to your phone based on noise and/or motion detection. The camera can also follow motion in the room tracking movement. A bonus feature is the ability to turn off the LED power light indicator on the unit as to not shine the light on the baby.WiFi connectivity is stable unlike traditional baby camera/monitor combos that would beep and wake everyone up when it lost a signal connection between camera and monitor. (I’m looking at you Motorola)Excellent value and quality of the camera with Apple-like feel and packaging.Strongly recommend and would purchase again. (Currently own 3 cameras)

Review Title: Amazing picture quality and real time motion
Review Text: This is a great camera. I bought this so I could check up on my dog when I am not home & detect if anyone goes into my place. I love the design & colors. Most of the cameras on Amazon were ugly, but this blends in with my house style.I had an issue with other cameras lagging a couple of seconds behind the motion and an ANNOYING echo, but this camera shows real-time motion with little to no echo. The picture quality is great in day and night vision, and the motion detector is accurate (you can adjust the sensitivity).I did have an issue with the 2 way speaker at first, but it resolved randomly within an hour.I wish is paired up with Alexa, but I am not taking off a star for that.This is the best camera for the right price I have had so far.I wish to get another Nooie cam 360 from them.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2020

Review Title: Awesone camera and with a few tweeks, it'd be super-awesome!
Review Text: I do not normally leave reviews, but I really like this product! The picture is great, both daytime and night time. The audio and speaker functions work great and it is super quiet even when rotating. For the price, it's got to be the best out there! The app is very easy to use and set up was a breeze, it also looks cute and I've named mine "Eve" from Wall-E, you'll see why. :) Ps. I know that this is advertised as a baby monitor, which it would work great as due to its quietness, but I use it for an indoor home "security" camera. I'll probably get another to put in my Ferret's room to see what they are up to as I think, like the other reviewers have said, since the motion works so well it's great for watching your fur-family while you aren't home.I have noticed, though, that it doesn't rotate a full 360° around, more like point A to point B then from B back to A but not A to A, if that makes sense. So, if sitting on something I am not sure if it would catch a person walking behind it where the void, albeit small void, is as it has no way to "track" past that stopping point unless it goes back to the the other side which I have not seen it do yet.Although I give it 5 stars, here are a few recommendations for the developers:- Make the directional control to be more like a video game up, down, right, left control as opposed to the screen drag controls. I think this will result in more user control and less covering of the screen/image with fingers.- Either make the plug in port, on the camera, higher or provide a plug in that points straight out. The current port of the base on the plug that goes into the camera makes it a little difficult to sit flat without bending the cord, although the existing cord does fit well and looks nice.- The length of the supplied power cord is not really adequate to be placed on the ceiling, higher up on the wall or higher up on a piece of furniture. Maybe think of an option for a cord free option with rechargeable battery pack? I realize this would probably make the entire unit bigger. Or a USB extension for higher up applications.Other than that, I think it is a solid camera and again, for the price, it works great. I will definately be getting another one and am looking at their outdoor camera as well!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 18, 2020

Review Title: You get what you pay for
Review Text: UPDATE A YEAR LATER- Camera itself is fine, but software is total garbage and doesn't work, rendering the camera useless for security purposes.  I'm literally walking around in front of the camera now and no alerts are occurring.  It seems that nowadays when you turn the alerts off (if you will be around in front of the cameras, thus triggering them) and later turn them back on when you are away,  they just never start working again.Updating the rating because the company replaced the camera and seems to be working at improving their product.EDIT: Removing a star because in the few days I have written this review, the audio on the camera stopped working.  This camera is less than six months old!!If you need good security, just spend the money on the main competitor that is more expensive but much more reliable.  I regret not doing that now.  The app is inconsistent, the alerts are hit or miss, and we had a burglary attempt AND a full enclosed trailer stolen , NO alerts.  By the time we discovered the illegal activity, any evidence was gone from my cloud storage.  As I am writing this review, there is a family member inside the residence covered by the cameras and has been in front of the outside camera as well - you guessed it, no alerts.  And yes, I double and triple checked my settings and they are all set for alerts.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 3, 2020

Review Title: Excelente camera for a fair price
Review Text: I got this camera with 20% off so it came just a tab above $40 w/ tax. It is a great camera for these few days that I had it.I have seen some complaints about the setup process and security. For the initial setup the camera read the QR code right away and prompted me to updated it.After the update it says that you need to factory reset the camera to continue using. I tried without doing it so and it kept me locked on the white solid light. So you need to grab a thin paper clip and reset it. Then it connects without any issue.About security I enabled two-factor-authentication within the app. So for someone to connect to my camera would need a code that’s sent to my email. Now if this is a concern to you I suggest looking for offline solutions as I don’t thing they come more secure than what Nooie offers with 2FA. Just remember to secure it with a nice password. I suggest using Last Pass’ generator to create random stuff.The image is good for a 1080p camera and it follows you like crazy. I have to put some google eyes just to make it more easy to have something following you left and right. You can also program the time in which the camera looks for motion and sound. Haven’t noticed any lag with the feed also.The main issue that I have is the mounting situation. They offer you a wall mount that you can screw but that’s it. If only they had a tripod mount too it would be perfect. Now you have folks who have designed mounts on Thingverse.

Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2021

Review Title: This is a cheap camera, that mostly works, if what you care about is cheap.
Review Text: This was a constant source of frustration because it did not behave consistently.  If it never worked, we would have thrown it out and bought a different camera within a week of our son being born.  But it worked.  Most of the time.  The camera's interaction with our wifi was consistently terrible, it was buffering (or whatever you call the little spinning Nooie icon when video isn't streaming) probably every 10 seconds.  I don't know if that is the camera's fault or our network's fault, but it is under 40 feet from our router, and considering none of our other devices have any issues I can only assume it is the camera. And it would eventually catch up and push through the sound to let us know when the baby woke up within 30 or 60 seconds.  The reason I decided to finally post this review is that three times within the past month, I have turned on the app, the camera was working properly, I went to sleep, and when I woke up I was getting no video transmission at all, just a constant spinning Nooie icon.  Each time, I rebooted the Nooie app, and it told me that my camera was off.  If I went into the baby room, unplugged and then replugged the camera, the camera reappeared in the app, but at this point I can't trust this to consistently stay online, so I am back sleeping in the family room where I can hear the baby for the next three  or four days until the new camera we ordered arrives.If you absolutely can't afford anything better, this mostly works, but I would not recommend it.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2020

Review Text: This is our third baby monitor that we have had since becoming parents and I think this one is my favorite. The picture quality is exceptional! I like that this one doensn't have an actual monitor, rather you have the app on your phone. This is nice for us for so many reasons! I am truly shocked by the quality of this product due to the small price I paid for it. Would 100% recommend and will likely order more in the future!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2021

Review Text: It took me days to set up this camera. I was about to return it but I contacted Nooie and told them I had the “failed to connect” message. They sent me a list of things to check and I thought I did them all and turns out the simplest of things caused me the biggest problem. I had an apostrophe in my WiFi name! I took that out and the spaces between my WiFi name just to be sure and the camera connected! Ugh! I was so relieved! So much headache for something so simple.The cameras picture quality is amazing! Night vision isn’t the best but it’s great compared to my old camera. Motion detection is nice. Pan and tilt is laggy. Not sure if that’s the camera or my crappy internet. Overall this camera for the price is a steal! Just be aware that you may have problems connecting if you have any special characters in your WiFi name.

Swiping your finger is inaccurate. I never know if the camera is going to move a little, a lot OR just keep spinning nonstop until it's looking completely backwards. This could be due to latency between mobile phone connection.My suggestion is that rotating the camera should be done with buttons. A compass system would work too, where 0° is straight forward, and I can adjust that number to rotate. ...or a mixture of both.ANYTHING but this inaccurate and arbitrary finger swiping system and it's easily 5 stars.

Review Text: Don’t recommend this product! Please don’t buy.This Nooie camera is a hassle. I’ve had this camera for about a year now and it’s not reliable. It seems every two months, the camera is disconnected from the app and it has to be setup again. For example, I used the app/camera at night then in the morning, I open the app and it says I have to connect a camera. It’s as if there was no camera connected even though I had just used it the night before. And the setup process might look simple but it has major flaws. First of all, the app requires to use an internet connection of 2.4G and not the standard 5G. The steps to setting it up seem simple: plug in the camera, connect to the internet, then it SHOULD work. But it doesn’t! Then there’s help instructions, which basically says to unplug then plug it back in and that should fix the problem. But it doesn’t! It’s just frustrating.Also, the picture quality is okay. But the night vision option isn’t reliable either. There has been numerous times when all of a sudden the camera goes black and nothing has changed in the room. Then it might decide to fix itself in 10-20 mins or sometimes the app has to be closed and opened again or the camera has to be set up again. It’s just isn’t a reliable productI don’t recommend this product and if I could I would return it.

Review Text: My wife asked me to research and buy the best baby-cam, so of course I assumed the most expensive one and biggest one with the reputable electronics name would be the best. It was 6 times as expensive, bulky, terrible user experience on the product and app, and didn't do some of the things this Nooie does right out of the box.When I received the Nooie, the first thing you notice is the quality packaging. As an industrial designer, I was pleasantly surprised with the overall design of both the packaging and the product itself. The product doesn't feel cheap at all, sturdy construction, fine crafting, and quality materials. The App is no nonsense simplicity, even setting it up was super-easy. I shared the camera with my wife, and boom she has it. I love that it uses euro-time 0-24 hr to set motion and sound detect timers, which are easily configurable. Push alerts on the phone are great, and the Nooie makes no noise but follows motion around intelligently.If there was one thing I would have liked, it only came with one wall hanger piece. Would have been nice had it come with two, so you can move your Nooie from one wall to the next with ease.One of the best bang for the buck products I have ever bought on Amazon, and very pleased to submit this glowing review. Will be buying more Nooie products soon.

Review Title: Good camera til it was hacked and got my network hacked
Review Text: Bought this a few months ago. Cam worked well with fair quality. Night vision in the dark worked well. The only downside was in light the night vision mode would constantly flicker on and off waking up my baby if I didn't wake up in time to turn it off.Other than that last night around 2am (over 4 hours of camera being on and untouched while baby was asleep) I believe my camera was hacked as it started moving on it's own. It moved strangely at first, like looking around the room. After entering the nursery nothing happened. I looked directly into the cam then moved. Nothing happened. A few seconds later the camera turned toward me. I moved where my face wasn't completely visible, it moved to see my whole face. A few seconds later it moved back to my sleeping baby who was completely still. Then back to me. Wanted to contact nooie about it, but they just have janky emails and no numbers. So no idea what to do about it being hacked other than reporting it to the authorities.  two stars cause cam was nice til it wasn't safe anymore.

Review Text: Using this in our baby room, it works as expected and at a great price. Came as advertised and works well. Would recommend to anyone looking for an affordable camera.Pros- price- easy to setup, had it on my network, streaming video to my phone in less than 5 minutes- IR and image/video quality are good (except when zoomed - see below)Cons- App doesn't have many customization options, 3 levels of "motion" or "noise" sensitivity, lowest setting is still a little sensitive, users you share the camera with are unable to adjust these settings for their own account.- Would like to see a wifi only mode instead of interacting with the cloud, dont really need cloud access in my case.- Zoom quality isnt great. looks like the camera itself doesnt zoom, just zooms the image on your phone which results in poor image quality and really low FPS- Would have liked better alerting options built into the app instead of making so many adjustments to my phone. for example, I leave my phone on silent/vibrate, it would be nice if this app could override volume options and always plays a noise when motion/sound is detected. Although to be fair this is likely more of a phone limitation than app.

Review Text: Just received this monitor today. It has a very sleek design, and is pretty aesthetically pleasing in my opinion. I was able to set it up on my iPhone 8 without any major problems, and it seems to be working well so far. Holding the QR code in front of the camera was a little tricky, I kept holding it too close, but once I figured that out it was fine. The little booklet has some pretty straightforward directions and a guide for the light indicator so you should be able to figure out pretty easily what the problem is, if any. I’m wondering if the issue some people have is that it will only connect to a 2.4 gig wireless network. In the app you have the option to mute sound, take a photo or record video to your device, and turn the camera off. Overall I’m pretty pleased so far with all of the features that it has, especially for the price. I will update my review once I have used it for a few weeks.

Review Title: The camera is great but the app is another story
Review Text: I am writing this review because I believe in this product, and I want the product to improve in the future especially the product's companion app.I can say that the camera's image quality is really good. The live video feed that I got from my phone was really clear. The audio does not pick up a lot of static noise from the surrounding area. The camera rotates smoothly and precisely.Overall, it seems the hardware is built well, however, the main issue I have is the product's app.I was not able to reconnect to the camera after I closed the app. For reference, I used both android and apple iOS and neither of the phones managed to reconnect to the camera.  Whenever I open the app to check the live feed camera, it just keeps me on the loop of the loading screen.I am currently in the process of returning the product as it does not meet my expectations.

Review Title: Great camera, but a few flaws.
Review Text: I really like this camera but couldn't give it 5 stars because there are a few flaws. Let me start by saying that I am mainly using this camera as a baby monitor so this review is based on that use. The biggest flaw for me is that the sound comes out of the phone ear piece instead of the phone speaker making it very hard to hear without putting your phone to your ear. Can we get an update to change this? (I am using a Samsung Galaxy S8 Active phone.)The second biggest problem is that you cannot listen in while using another app. As soon as you change apps or turn your phone screen off the listening feature turns off. My previous monitor I could turn off the screen or use another app and still listen in to the baby room.There is a delay in the camera motion when moving it from your phone screen and we did have a little trouble getting the camera to connect to our wifi, but it eventually worked.This is a great camera otherwise. The picture quality is great (day and night vision) and motion detection is pretty accurate. I love being able to remotely connect so that I can check in when away from the house.

Review Title: Frustrating set up and too many problems
Review Text: It is difficult to set up. The view is limited (can’t look up or down past a certain point). The mic and speaker are low quality (can’t communicate via the camera). One of the most frustrating things is how often it requires an update, at which point the only way to connect is to reset to factory settings and go through the initial set-up all over again (which can only be done if you’re sitting with the camera; so good luck if you leave for vacation during one of these episodes). Sometimes it will refresh/think repeatedly without showing the camera feed, even though it’s sitting right next to the Internet router. I was initially pleased with the purchase, but quickly became disappointed. I plan to replace both cameras with a different brand.

Review Title: Best indoor camera under $50.  Hands down.

Review Text: As long as you have a good stable internet connection for it the quality is great. There can be a little lag, and at times it may freeze in the app if you have it open for a long time. However it's easy enough to reset and you can tell when it's stuck by checking the time in the corner.If you plan to use it as a baby monitor, as I was, it's useful to have a dedicated viewing device other than your phone, say an iPad or the like. Haven't had any problem with the detection, just make sure you have your notifications set to alert you in case you need to be woken. Overall can't find picture quality like this in traditional baby monitors which I find useful when looking for those tiny signs of breathing.It can take a few seconds to load so be mindful of that as well. If you're looking for instant, constant monitoring of a young baby you may want a more traditional monitor that takes a dip in picture quality for more consistency and no need to worry about your connection.Overall very pleased with the product and happy that it will find use beyond being a monitor once we no longer need it for the baby.

Review Title: Great camera. Bang for your buck. Pros and cons.
Review Text: The product for the price is outstanding. I like how easily I can open the app and look at the live footage of the camera and the quality of the picture is clear.Some pros:The camera is easy to install. Just download app and follow the few steps it asks.The camera has recording feature either on a disk on the cloud or on the phone which is nice to have those features.The quality of the picture is clear.The night vision is great especially in small rooms like a bedroom.The camera is quiet when it turns to follow to motion.The motion detector is accurate to a decent distance which the sensitivity can be controlled.The audible detection is a nice feature which as well is pretty sensitive and can control sensitivity.Comes with a mount if you want to place up on ceiling to make it more hidden (unless you have bright vibrant colored walls or ceiling).You can simply move camera to different parts of the house.You can speak into the camera to ward off criminals and also just to say friendly hello to your fur babies or children.The pano of the camera is a decent width to where I can almost see the entire 11X10 room.Cons:The power supply is a simple three foot power cord which can be unplugged and therefore turn off camera. Would be nice to have internal battery source as backup.The camera is a size in which you can’t really hide.The camera only works if your internet is 2.4g thus if your internet is 5.0g it will not be compatible. You could have dual band so just check with your internet company.The motion detector only follows one item thus a second person can sneak past the camera.If camera is sitting on desk height you won’t be able to see what’s beneath it up to about three feet (if placed on ceiling you have better angle).I got this as a gift from family because I got a puppy and it is awesome to watch her in her play pen while I’m at work and I can speak to her through the camera. For the price of this camera you can’t beat it. Good picture quality and good live feed connection and easy installation. Hope you enjoy it as much as I do and hope this review helps.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2019

Review Title: Easy set up, decent camera. Satisfied customer

Review Text: I have three of the 360 Nooie cameras, nursery, living room, and bedroom. and last I had my daughter sleeping in my bedroom and I was watching her on camera. Now this camera(bedroom) is the only one that does anything odd out of the three. But what it did last might bothered me. She was sleeping with her arm up above her head as she usually does, and then the camera screen went and flashed white and her arms were down to her side and she had moved straight.... Then a couple seconds later the screen flashed white again and she went back to her arms above her head like they were before! Really weird, she was dead asleep, she didn’t move in real life (was standing in the doorway to bedroom as it happened and didn’t see or hear actual movement). Idk if you’d consider it to be more paranormal then hacking. But still something big I’m curious to see if anybody else has experienced?

It will automatically go to night vision if you apply that setting, as well.Setup was done within 10 minutes and very easy to do.  Just follow the instructions.  I also connected my fiance’s phone to it (we both have iPhones).  I simply had to send an invite to her email address from within the app.I’d be interested in purchasing more cameras in the future for other rooms, as this is very helpful and convenient!  Thank you!

Review Text: For the price, the camera is okayPros: I can see my baby when I’m at work from my cellphone.Cons: I cannot be logged in on multiple devices. However even with my phone volume cranked up all the way I could not hear anything. Knocking against the camera you do hear a faint sound.I also see the Nooie Android App has a lot of bad reviews. Another thing to consider.

Review Text: This has been a great product, I use it every day. I am now able to keep an eye on my child in the other room while I am working in my home office. Review Text: I bought the Nooie 360 Cam on a whim one day, just to try one of these motion cameras out. It was affordable (it was the Amazon deal of the day) so I wasn't expecting too much out of the camera. Boy, was I wrong. I was really impressed at the quality of the video. I put the camera inside next to the window, facing my backyard in an area I can't normally see from the living room. This so I can peek on my dogs (make sure they're not up to no good!) I already caught on camera one of my dogs trying to bite one of the sprinklers. The motion detector follows them, which is great because I don't lose sight on whatever it's detecting.  The night vision works great, but I don't normally use it because the nv reflects on the window so I just leave the backyard lights on. It was an easy install, just make sure you run it on 2.4GHz because it does not run on a 5GHz network. The only con I can think of is that sometimes when I'm out and about the camera fails to connect on the app. Not sure if that's the camera's fault, the app or if I'm just in a bad reception area at the moment I checked. When I'm home it never has that issue. Overall I was really impressed by this buy and at the value I bought it at.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 15, 2019

Camera features The camera itself is a plain-looking device, there is a tiny LED as a status light. A hidden microSD card slot which you will find by rotating the camera lens upward 30 degrees.3. Setting up Nooie Cam 360Before setting up , make sure your phone is connected to WiFi via 2.4Ghz access point.Once the camera is plugged into the mains, the LED blinking and power up. Syncing to the network with APP and selecting the model and WiFi credentials. The Nooie cam APP will wall you though the steps, it’s easy to set up.  4. 4. Viewing the camera feed on your phoneTo see the feed from your mobile device will need to install the mobile APP and it is easy to use. Review Text: The pet camera is not different from other models, but has a special feature. I'll talk about this particular feature in the next section of my review. The accessory in addition to the camera consists of 1.5m power cord, USB charging cable, user manual and wall mounting plate.The installation in your own Wifi network is completed quickly. The in-house app is available through both the Google Play Store and the App Store. The camera resolves in Full HD and accordingly the recordings look good. The biggest feature is the camera has a 360 degree all-round visibility. The camera does not have to be rotated manually. The integrated motion sensor allows the cam to be automatically rotated and track an object in this way. The night vision mode could do a little better job. The quality is not bad. If the picture were a bit clearer, it would fit better with the  good features of the camera. 2-way audio function can be spoken through the camera. Live notifications when the motion sensor detects something moving are working properly. Recordings can be stored both on a micro SD card and in a cloud.The camera does your job very well. The price-performance ratio is perfect. All in all, it is a good pet camera

Review Title: Great product, easy to use once you set up!
Review Text: Finding a baby monitor was so hard as we didn't want to pay a ton of money but wanted something functional to just have when baby is asleep and we need to leave the house for a couple minutes. I received this product in a day and was super excited to find such a good looking device when it arrived. Its super sleek in design! The set-up was a little difficult, simply because you have to have your wi-fi connection set to 2.4ghz instead of 5.0ghz. I'm not very tech savvy so it took me reading forums on how to get a dual-broadband modem from automatically connecting your phone to 5.0. Once I figured out how to separate the two connections via my internet provider, I was able to manually choose 2.4 for the pairing and it immediately worked. We did some trial runs with it and so far we're super pleased by the quality for the price of the product. Can't wait to use it once baby arrives!

Review Title: Exceptional camera, perfect for indoor home security use

I've put in a 32 GB card, but I do pln to switch to the cloud service for storage if it works well.While I've placed the camera on a table, it has a setup that allows it to be attached to a ceiling, making it pretty versatile.I just wish the microusb power cable was longer (it's just 2 feet long), and that the camera worked with Google Home and Google Assistant (there's nothing online or in the guide that tells me if/how it works with either Alexa or Google).

Review Text: This camera fits in your budget and has a lot of features. Saves the motion detection videos, real time alerts, stream lag is almost nil, app is user friendly, time setting for motion/sound detection, good IR night vision with extended range and sensitivity of motion/sound detection.Only problem is multiple device viewing. You have to create multiple accounts and share from the main one (the one account in which you set up the camera) in order to view. It's kind of double work, because everybody uses at least two devices. For me I had to setup three accounts. Otherwise I dont see any problem at all with this bad boy!

Review Text:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   This camera is awesome! My favorite features are the fact that I can pan around the room and zoom in/out. The camera adjusts the video according to the light in the room, which is helpful especially since we have dimmable lights that have a spectrum of brightness. I have a screen recording that shows the camera adjusting the light as I open and close the door for a dark room. In terms of the video quality, it captures a nice wide view and is pretty sharp - we’re able to tell when our baby’s eyes are open/closed/blinking (and he’s got small eyes!). I also appreciate the security feature where only one person can be signed into an account at a time - others who want to view the same camera can be added if they’ve set up their own Nooie account, and it was such a simple and straightforward process.

Review Title: Great quality camera and sound especially for the price. Alexa compatible
Review Text: I’ve been using this camera since my baby came home 5 months ago!! Great camera for watching my baby! The quality is GREAT and you can hear and speak to baby! The audio, day and night vision is great!!! I love that it’s compatible with Alexa Show 8!! I also like that you can have your main login and then grant access to others (such as your spouse or grandparents). I personally granted access to my husband and to my other email so that I can use it on my iPad while I’m in the kitchen. So that’s 3 devices (my phone which is the main account, and the granted access on my iPad and my husband’s phone). On their accounts they cannot mess with the settings of the camera and cannot turn the camera off. Only on yours account. I just tell Alexa “show me nursery” (my camera is named Nursery because it’s going to live in the nursery once I move my baby upstairs in the crib) and she shows it to me. She does sometimes say “ok” and then doesn’t load the live view. Then I just repeat the command and she loads it up no problem. I’ve already recommended this camera to family that have recently had babies too!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2020

Review Title: Amazing number of features for the price!
Review Text: We got this for or newborn baby to monitor her at night. It's a perfect camera for this role. The 360 degree turn feature is amazing. Instead of placing the camera on a shelf like most baby cams, you can put this upside down on a ceiling in the center of the room and have 360 views of everything. It's not just limited to baby watching. In the future I can use this for home security, nanny-cam, or a pet cam. It's extremely versatile. Additionally the tracking and night-vision work really well. You can see very clearly at night in the dark.The tracking is not the smoothest and random movements like curtains from a blowing window will set it off. The tracking is also a bit jerky and not a smooth pan but honestly it works and I'm not all too much concerned. The app lets you control the camera remotely which is super cool. You can just use your finger on the image via the phone app and drag the camera around to move it. The controls for the camera are a bit clunky as it is reversed (drag left to go right, drag down to go up) and I wished you could change it as it takes some time to get used to. The motor is a bit noisy, not completely silent.The only thing that I would say needs to be improved is the picture quality. It's not super crisp even though it claims to be 1080p, but for its purpose it's good enough. Finally instead of purchasing the cloud storage, you can just buy a large SD card that will store weeks of videos.Overall this is a great camera. I imagine we will be keeping this around for years for several different uses and the price is amazing for so many features.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2021

Review Title: Has some good things, and not-so-good things.
Review Text: I placed mine in the crib to keep an eye on my newborn.Good things- App is pretty user friendly for anyone who has a basic understanding of how things should work- Initial set up was also pretty straightforward- picture quality is good for the price- Night vision is good- hardware is small and light- you get notifications when sound is detected and you can set the sensitivity from your phone- you get notifications when motion is detected and you can turn it on or off fro your phone-has a live feed, as well as a back up option either using cloud service or SD card- can take screenshots- can invite other users to join the feed (they have to sign up for an account and get the app though)Bad things- short power cord- in hindsight, I wish I bought one with a battery- picture is fine and audio too, but horribly laggy if you try to turn in the mic. It makes no sense to use it.- takes a while to power up- sometimes will get confused and rotate on its own so you lose the focus. I kinda sorta remedied this by turning off motion detection- can’t use one account on multiple devices. So if I try to log in on my iPad, it logs me out of my phone. That is pretty annoying- not the best at balancing on soft surfaces.- laggy if you leave the app and returnOverall, I’m satisfied with it as I can live with the negatives. I’m not sure I would buy again without shopping around first though
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2022

Review Text: I thought this was going to be perfect for being a nursery camera and camera to 2 way talk to our 2 year old. First of all it was impossible to find a spot in the room that our 2 year old could not reach without having half of the room not visible in the camera. Massive blind spots and limited range of view.The camera was excellent quality and we liked the motion tracking. Unfortunately, the app was terrible and took forever to try to move the camera to view the room if it stopped tracking the movement. The app was also very spotty on reception. Sometimes we couldn’t even get it to open to view the room and we have the fastest internet that our cable company provides. The audio is absolutely terrible and ultimately why we returned it. The audio was constantly cutting out on the app and when trying to 2 way talk it worked 10% of the time.This could work for someone who just wants to check on their pet or home throughout the day with no sound, but beware of app issues and inability to pull up the viewing screen. Would not recommend.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 20, 2021

Review Title: Easy to use. Failed decide after 9 months but there’s good!
Review Text: Set up took a few tries because the camera wouldn’t pick up the wrong code right away. ultimately this camera is easy to use though. The picture is very clear and motion sense is accurate. The App is easy to navigate if you are familiar with nest or other camera accessible apps.About 9 months into using my first 360 camera it shut off and never came back on. I tried resetting the device while plugged in but nothing. I contacted support and Ms. Alma was very helpful. I sent her a video of what was going on and she offered to send me a brand new device to replace it. I can appreciate a company that takes pride in their product enough to do this for the customer.Update…it’s just a few months after receiving the new device and it stopped connecting to my wifi. My other nooie 360 connects but then disconnects too. I even purchased a wifi extender even though my house is only 1000 sqft. This did not help any. I reached out to customer service but was not able to get whatever issue it was resolved. I even asked to try a different product if possible but I Guess I have two useless cameras and will have to try another brand because I haven’t been able to see in my babies room for about 3 weeks now going back and forth with customer support as they only respond at 2am each day. It was fun while it lasted.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2020

Review Text: Goes offline, manufacturer’s suggestion was to use beta software on my phone… picture quality on Alexa is horrible. Review Text: We had this camera for over a year now, the reviews are pretty dead on.◇Cons◇For one: It has a major lagging issue. I'm a very paranoid mom and will get up if it doesnt connect fast enough. Alot of times I'll have to go out of my screen,and back in again which makes me very unhappy.Two: I haven't found a way for the camera to constantly remain on my phone screen,almost like a little screen on ny screen, there seems to be no way to have it both waysThree: read another review about hearing people talk on the camera, If I ever hear ANYONE talk through the camera my rating will automatically change to a 1 star just because noone should ever have access to someone else's camera.♡Pros♡One-Has awesome picture quality!Two- can hear if my baby is cryingThree- Camera moves very fast if I need to see something (when its not lagging)Four- Affordable
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on February 20, 2021

Review Text: Great little camera, setup was very easy.  I did have to turn WiFi off on one of my devices in the same room to get the camera to initially connect, but then it worked normal after that.  I liked that the included documentation there was a list of what the status LED lights mean, it made setup much easier without having to go online and find a FAQ page.Picture quality is very good, control is intuitive.  The talkback feature works well, but you might want to mute the sound on your device when talking, so the microphone on the phone doesn't pick up your voice playing out of the camera.It's a great way to keep an eye on our geriatric dog when at work.  Very happyUpdate:  We moved one of the 360 cameras to our front porch and it is doing a great job in both day and night modes.  This has inspired me to mount my workshop camera on the ceiling, but I didn't keep the wall mount., and Nooie Customer service is sending me a free replacement.  Thanks for the customer service!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 26, 2020

Review Text: I used this Camera for a month with my new rescue puppy. After a few weeks it continued having connectivity issues to wifi. I have a studio apartment, so my the router is within feet of the camera. All other devices work fine with no issues. After it looses connection, it's very hard to reconnect. I had to do factor resets multiple times to get it to reconnect, only for it to fail within minutes.I contacted the seller and had a replacement camera sent. Within a week, the replacement camera also failed. When I contacted Amazon for a refund, I was told I only have 30 days to return it, even though through my order history it said I still had a few more weeks left in the return window. I eventually got a refund. But this camera is poorly made. The seller is also through China, so the customer communication for a replacement took two weeks, since it was all through email and would only respond once per day. Even when I responded right away.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 11, 2022

Review Text: got the Nooie  360˚ camera as a promotion.  Unboxing was easy and high class packaging.  A bit tough to get the wall plug and cord out of the bottom of the box - but otherwise fine.  Installation was easy.  Install the NOOIE app.  then press add device/camera.  Link to your wifi - make sure your phone wifi is on first.  Then have the Nooie cam scan the shown code.  within seconds to a few minutes it will link with a light shown on the camera base.  It will then want to update and reboot.  This will take about 5 minutes.  Lots of settings, from sensitivity, to human detection, to time modes.  Full color HD 360˚ view.  No complaints here.  Well thought out and even better than the d-link  360˚ camera we already have.  highly recommended!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2021

Review Text: A friend bought this unit for himself and then decided he didn't need it so rather than returning it, he gave it to me to try. Since he bought it on sale, I thought it might be just a cheap camera, and so I didn't have high expectations. Boy, was I wrong! I discovered this would be a great little watchdog camera for my patio and backyard. I mounted it inside the house on a window ledge, behind the blinds, and facing straight forward. After experimentation, I learned it was far better than I expected, and faster to respond than a more expensive system that I use for my front porch. Setup was easy, I just plugged it in and followed the prompts on my phone, and it was up and running within 5 minutes. Mine is mounted close to the wireless router, so I had no problems with connectivity. At one point, I moved it about 15 feet away, and it performed well there too.On the window ledge, it picks up some reflectivity from the glass; however, during the day, this is barely noticeable. At night, the effect isn't enough to be bothersome. If the blinds are backlit with a lamp, visibility is affected, so I moved the lamp, and the view significantly improved. Also, I turned off the Night Vision mode because the glass reflects enough of it to blur the image and since the camera is inside, I disabled sound detection. What I found somewhat surprising was how well the camera picks up Motion, even though the glass. I have a dog door, and I can easily see which of my dogs has exited the house and watch it as it moves through the visible portion of the yard. It also reacts very quickly to any human in the frame, even with Motion set to Low. When I received the camera, I inserted a spare 8 GB card, and it records for about 36 hours before rolling over. Later, I swapped it out with a 128 GB card which often lasts two weeks before it begins to roll over. It is very easy to connect with the camera from my cell phone from anywhere and recording an existing video, or snapping a photo is quick and easy. I haven't tried the cloud account yet because I haven't needed it. If the unit were stolen, the video would be lost, so if you intend to mount this in a conspicuous place; the cloud account might be a good idea. For the time being, I'm content with using the SD card for storage. In the attached photos, the difference between day and night is illustrated. An external street light causes some glare. Even so, I am amazed at well this inexpensive camera performs when compared to more expensive units. I haven't used this unit inside my house, but it would be a simple matter to move it a few feet and do that too.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2019

Review Text: This camera was received as a baby gift that apparently one of my family members bought as a gift a couple months ago through Amazon as it was delivered by amazon. well now that we finally got everything settled and took it out of the box go to set everything up and it says bonded to someone's email and we can't even use it email support and haven't got a response so so far not a very good experience for camera that was supposedly brand new everything was wrapped on it there was nothing open and all the wires and everything were intact but somehow a brand new camera is bonded to someone else tells me that it isn't new not a good first impression
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on October 5, 2021

Review Text: This runs off of WiFi and is not a guaranteed signal. That will cause freezing of the camera and app and sometimes complete signal loss. It didn’t matter if we were using the internet or not the camera would still completely freeze. I also had to reboot several times when the camera doesn’t communicate at all. After about a few days of using it at night with the app on my phone it froze. I woke up and realized the screen was frozen and then found my baby screaming in her crib for an unknown amount of time. It it NOT reliable.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2021

Review Title: Unreliable camera connection. Temperamental app. Only ok image quality..
Review Text: App is terrible. Half the time it takes a minute to connect to camera. That would not be so bad except that this happens if you have the app in the background even for a brief moment. Some app features don't bwork. When I contacted the app developers recently about the multi account capability, they responded that they haven't added that yet despite being a selling point.Also, recently the Nooie servers were down and the camera stopped working altogether. Let that sink in. The camera only works when their servers are up and running. No reason the camera live stream needs to be dependent on Nooie servers.Picture quality is only ok.This could have been a great camera but poor app and design choices make it a sub par baby cam. Totally regret putting this on our registry.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2021

Review Text: We have been using a baby monitor with a dedicated handheld monitor but wanted to try one that connects to our phones and saw this on Lightening Deal.Overall, it's a great camera. It has a great modern look to it and it has a really amazing viewing area. The night vision is crazy good and clear. You can zoom in really, really well with a very clear picture.The only reason I docked it a star was because it's dropped from our Wi-Fi a few times. Not sure if this is just the nature of the beast, our wi-fi, or the monitor, but it is annoying. That, and I switch between my phone and iPad depending on time of day (I use my iPad overnight) but have to re-sign in every time. Not a huge deal, just slightly cumbersome.Overall, this is a MUCH better picture, viewing area and zoom capability than the other monitor that we had for literally 1/3 of the price. It is also nice that both my husband and I can access the feed and that when she's older, we can use it to check in when she's home with a sitter and we are out.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2019

Review Text: As for the pros to this item, it does have great picture and when you’re viewing in the app, the sound quality is pretty good too. The night vision is also very clear and a plus.For the cons, and what makes this item not worth it to me, is that the motion detection and sound detection do not work very well. And it’s hit and miss to notice anything. We’ve been interacting with our daughter in front of the camera and it won’t notify us that anything happened but will randomly pick up noise from across the house. We use it as a baby monitor and I do not trust it at all to notify us what’s going on in the room so we always have the app open. Also, the video occasionally goes out which is also not ideal for using it as a baby monitor. We will have to be returning this to get a different monitor. The playback is also confusing and hard to control.I will say if you’re using it to just check in on your pets or as a casual check-in, this may work great for you. I just don’t trust it to help me keep an eye on my baby.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 3, 2022

Review Text: I just read a negative review and decided to leave my own review.I've had this camera for over a year now. My sister bought it from my baby registry on Amazon and I recently purchased the other Noie indoor cam for her from her baby registry, as she's now expecting 😊.1. Set-up is a breeze once you follow instructions and are patient. If you need to change locations and go through the setup process again for any reason you'll breeze through it. Remember, set-up has to be done on 2G WiFi.2. The picture quality is great! - day and night.3. There's two-way audio, so you can speak to persons the camera is monitoring and they speak back to you.4. Motion detection is great, and u get notifications when movement is detected - this feature can be turned on or off in the Settings.My issues:1. I took the camera outside of the USA and am unable to have multiple persons log in due to cross-state issues as explained by a prompt response from Noie customer support.2. The Alexa app does not support the live view, and so I haven't been able to access the camera through the Alexa app, which would be nice for me as I have multiple Alexa devices and would like to manage them all from one place.3. The camera doesn't seem to go 360° continuously. You can swivel to a point and swivel back to the other side to a point, (I guess this is the 355° that I read just now. I came searching for a review regarding the Alexa app), but you are able to see 360° coverage.Overall the cam is well worth it for the price, and I don't mean the quality is poor or inferior, based on price. I mean it's a great buy as the quality is great and the cost doesn't break the bank.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2022

Review Title: The product look decent, the app is horrible.
Review Text: The app says my personal wifi pwd is too long. My password is a long-ish sentences of maybe 60 characters. This is a valid password according to 2.4G wifi spec, I know because I have many devices who only work on 2.4, that have no problem with it. The app has decided customer should have a shorter wifi password.I am not gonna change my 2.4g wifi password just because the nooei dev decided that 30 char or so should be the max someone pick a wifi pwd length.I can't even picture myself resetting all my lightbulbs, they are so annoying to setup!Other than that, I tried temporary to change my pwd, and the image look alright, I had challenges mounting this on a bassinet, I had to buy an other mount, which also did not work well, because the clamp would hook onto the upper part of the camera, which prevent rotation.An lastly, As I was seeing how poor the app look like, I started to have some doubts about the company and trusting them with security for something that can hear and see me at any times.
