Review Title: Smart home security with motion tracking & instant motion alerts
Review Text:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   Initial Impression:Arrived in nice minimal packaging - which I appreciate! The design of the actual camera is very small, simple, and elegant. Included instructions were easy to understand and even without them it wouldn’t be difficult to figure out the steps required to get the Nooie Cam 360 up and running. 👍Video Quality:Great video quality including night vision. Even when turning off the High quality setting and using just Normal video quality. Much better than most security cameras I’ve seen including the one we are currently using as our baby video monitor. I won’t mention names.Camera and App Set-Up:Setting up the camera requires pretty minimal effort. Once I downloaded the Nooie Cam app, and created an account, all that was required was to plug in the camera and wait until the status light flashed red. After clicking, “Add Camera” and confirming with the QR Code the camera was good to go.Camera and App Functionality:Motion tracking works great. Tested it with my son and had a lot of fun running around the living room letting it follow his movement. He thought it looked like Eve from the movie Wall-e. It doesn’t really look a lot like Eve but he’s 3 years old and having an imagination is important. 😁I tested the Motion Detention functionality and it worked great. Sends an alert to my phone immediately with the date and time code allowing the ability to simply click to view the video. This feature also allows for scheduling by time and days of the week so you can set it up for work schedules and not have motion alerts set for when you are at home.The two-way audio was also fun to play with and I can see how people with pets would enjoy this. In addition, if someone did break into your home you could politely let them know that the cops are on the way. 😉The only issue I had was with the Sound Detection. I tested it a few different times and for some reason this was not working for me. I contacted support and they advised me to reset the camera which took about 5 minutes and the problem was resolved.As for video storage I opted for the $5 per month Cloud storage option (by Amazon Web Services) rather than a Micro SD Card. The ability to record 7-day continuous storage for $60 a year made that decision pretty easy. 🤑Overall Impression:I think the Nooie Cam 360 is a pretty amazing little security camera. For $40 bucks this camera packs a lot of great features and I haven’t even explored them all. Looking forward to implementing this security camera with our existing smart devices to create a more efficient and secure home.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on June 28, 2019

Review Text: I initially ordered this camera just for its price point and because it had decent reviews. I gotta say though, I am thoroughly impressed with this little thing. A common fault mentioned by other reviews is poor connectivity or connection issues and I haven't experienced that at all.The picture quality is amazing clear in both day and night mode. I love that I have so much control through the app. I can zoom in, record, take screen shots, pan and tilt, mute the sound, and talk through the the camera. I love the storage option because it makes a time line of alerts for you to go back and view, instead if having to sit through hours of nothing to find activity.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2020

Review Text: The Nooie camera has all the features you would want in a camera 360-degree turn clear crisp day and night vision excellent two-way voice communication and motion detection. Give this camera a try you won't regret it.  I bought 8 cameras and have had no issues.  I highly recommend getting this for your family.The setup was very simple using your phone or tablet, running the free Nooie Cam app.  You need to download the Nooie app from the app store.  Start the Nooie Cam app and allow the app to access the Camera.  Enter the password for the wireless access point/router your phone is currently connected to Then the QR code appears on the screen of your phone. You now hold the screen of your phone in front of the Nooie camera's lens and it provides an audible tone and LED light indicator when it is finished reading the QR code. It's that simple.  Repeat the steps for multiple cameras.Now that the camera has been added, you simply select it to view the camera. To hear audio from the camera, you select the speaker icon within the app and now you can see and hear what's going on around the camera. The camera also has a built-in speaker that allows you to press the microphone button within the app and then speak through it. This is very useful. With this 360 degree camera, either from home, from work, wherever I have WiFi or cellular access I can pan the camera from left to right and up or down. Its range is great where you can place the camera in the center of the room and from the app, turn it from its left side behind it around the front, through to the right side behind it just by swiping across the screen with the camera's image live the whole time. You can pan it around to see the entire room. Beyond this, you can tilt the camera up and down from the app as well by swiping up and down on the camera's image live.The Motion Tracking feature, if your cat, or anything, moves in front of the camera's lens, the camera will follow it. As the moving option moves close to the edge of the camera's current visibility, the camera will move to center the moving object within its view and continue doing this until the moving object either stop moving or moves behind something where the camera can no longer see it. One thing to note with automatic Motion Tracking is the camera can pan 360 degrees.The audio and video can be recorded to either a microSD card or to the cloud. Cloud storage is a paid service. Given my usage, microSD recording is fine for me so I haven't tried the cloud storage option. MicroSD recordings are easily accessed through the app via a scrollable tape across the bottom of the screen.In summary, the Nooie 360 camera works great and has a clear video. The two-way communication capability is a bonus and could open up its use to more than just a security camera. It's the ability to automatically track motion as well as it's the ability to turn 360 degrees while automatically tracking motion and/or by manually swiping the screen coupled with its low price point of under $35.00 makes this a fantastic buy! We are thrilled to have this camera.  So much so we added 8 cameras and plan to add more.  I enthusiastically endorse the Nooie 360 camera.  If you get it for your home you won't regret it.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2019

Review Text: Was given this as a baby shower gift & love it! Was so easy to connect & set up. Picture is clear & even the night vision is great. Review Title: For Rotation, Download Blue Nooie App, Not Grey “Nooie Cam” App
Review Text: Purchased this monitor for my aunt whose husband, my uncle, had a couple strokes in 2015. He’s been more prone to falling lately and recently had to have surgery after falling and fracturing his hip/femur. She needs to be able to see him to have peace of mind to leave for any amount of time to ensure he hasn’t fallen and in need of help.The monitor works well. It has good picture quality. We ran into a problem where it wouldn’t rotate on demand like it was supposed to. It turns out we initially downloaded and used the wrong Nooie app. There are two: the blue Nooie app and the grey “Nooie Cam” app.Obviously, for our Nooie 360 *cam* we downloaded the grey Nooie Cam app. Everything, including the *automated* “motion tracking,” worked on it except for the *user controlled* rotation & turning, which is the feature we purchased it for. After downloading the blue Nooie app and signing in on it, the user controlled rotation worked instantly. So now there are no issues. Just make sure you have good wifi.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 26, 2021

Review Text: When buying a monitor for baby, there is a lot to consider - although you wouldn't think so at at the time.1. Does it travel well (no). Which isn't a big deal if you don't go home to visit family and need something to watch baby while they sleep in a new room2. Temperature?  No. Which isn't a big deal if you always have a ac on.. our parents keep their house so warm during summers. We bought a separate monitor that travels and shows temp, and glad we did cause the baby's room went up to 80+ in there at one point and we had to take her out and put in fans (heat increases SIDS).3. If your wifi is out will it work? No ... we loved the other monitor for when we had issues from time to time it works without wifi4. The BIGGEST question. Does it always work? NO!!!! The function to listen in on the room doesn't always work - so you can't exactly go outside to take the trash out or water the garden cause you won't hear baby on your monitor (phone). Speaking through the phone to the monitor has never worked. The camera sometimes turns itself a different direction when first started. The ability to save footage is a nice idea but the card stops working after a while (idk why!?) .It's just okay. Not the best thing. The only bit I love is being away at work and being able to see baby from where I am so I can tell grandma to check on her or get her up from nap.

Review Text: This is a great camera when it's working: the picture quality, motion detection and night vision is fantastic. We intially received it as a baby registry gift, but after getting a smart baby monitor we decided to use it as an indoor security cameraIt works great ... When it's not disconnecting, inexplicably offline etc. It's admittedly very frustrating. The setup is not the most intuitive and took a few times to get right. And when we change our WiFi system, we had to do it all over again.The most frustrating is that it works when it wants to, which makes it something you might not want to use as a baby cam or security cam. You want consistency and reliability, and unfortunately, after a strong start, I now finding this camera to be underwhelming in those departments.Their customer service is quite nice but a lot of the issues I was troubleshooting was solved by Googling forums and reading threads with other people having issues.I really loved this device and recommended it to people, but now I'm just disappointed.

Review Title: UNRELIABLE, faulty, annoying. Keep your child safe, get something better than this
Review Text: UNRELIABILE, very faulty product, very annoying to use. Been using it for over a year now and i wish other cameras were less expensive, would change my 2 Noomie cameras long time ago.I don't use it every day but whenever I have to the cameras are either offline for some reason or the want to update.So, the camera is offline for no reason... the only way to fix it is to restart it by unplugging it... how should I do that when I'm away...? or it's the middle of the night and it's in my son's room and I don't want to wake him up...? Or I just urgently have to leave his room but I want to keep an eye on him and don't have time to mess with the camera...Well... that happens VERY often! It makes it uselessAnd then you have situation when the camera needs an update (also happens rather often)... right when you need to see the live view... well then you CANNOT until you update it which (in urgent situation) feels like forever!I would say again... useless!Oh and the motion tracking stopped working a long time ago on both of my cameras...Overall, when it works it works, nothing special (video quality is ok, could be better).Like most of you I'm not a paranoid mother that needs to have all the cameras on constantly (which that would make it easy to keep them updated and online all the time).I just need to use it from time to time, usually in a urgent situation and that's when I need a RELIABLE device! What's the point of having it if you constantly have to fix it and in the moment when you really need it it's not working!And we're talking about something that supposed to "keep an eye " on your child....!VERY UNRELIABLE!Spend a little more money if you can and buy something better than this crap...And I'll just try to fix one of my cameras AGAIN as we speak...

Review Title: Good quality picture. Bad quality software
Review Text: I wanted to give this camera a few weeks before I wrote a review about it. The video quality is great and the night vision is great. I bought this camera for my husband who sleepwalks and won’t go to the doctor, I’m trying to document every instance of his sleepwalking. This camera did great for the first couple of weeks and then on the third week it just quit working on the night he got up and hurt himself. Very disappointed because he woke me up and asked me to check the footage and there was none. I even got the memory card out of the camera and it said the files were there but they were corrupted. The timestamp showed on the app but it said it didn’t recognize my card. It hadn’t had a problem with my memory card up until that point. And the card still had 100gb of free space. I guess the point to all this is that it will work for about 3 weeks and then the camera will quit reading your card on the night you need it so go ahead and buy a more expensive camera and don’t waste your money on this one.

Stuck looking at the load picture I attached. You get a notification that there was movement detected so you have to go to the app to see what happened and it takes so long to load. Anything could happen in that time. And the movement has already come and gone! And that’s even w purchasing their version of the “cloud” to playback and store video. Their customer service techs claim it’s my network…it’s not!The next problem I have is you have to have the app open the entire time and can’t be on any other apps and you can’t close the app because when you do anytime you come back in it takes forever to load the picture back up. I wish it was like a FaceTime call so that when you close the app you can still watch the video.I think with some updates and adjustments this app and product can be absolutely amazing! But for now it’s cool but frustrating.

Review Text: We got this for our new baby and decided to test it out in our 2 and 4 year olds bedroom. We had another camera in their room previously because they can get a bit rowdy in there, but our biggest issue had been that we couldn't always see them depending on where they went in the room. Not the case with Nooie 360! It really does move EVERY direction and makes it easy for us to locate them manually or automatically, depending on the settings. We set it to follow motion in the room and it keeps track of them pretty easily. The sound quality is good and the zoom is amazing. The only trouble we've had is with the microphone; it works fine, but our internet is a little slow so there's a lag in the speaking/listening. I don't think that's at all the fault of the camera, but if you have a troublesome internet like ours, you may find that issue as well. Anyway, I will definitely be getting a second one for the baby room and leaving this one with the toddlers! For the price, I don't think it can be beat. This is one happy momma!

Review Text: We had the camera for 6 months before finally getting it to work.  It took 6 months of trying to log in, detect wifi passwords, and pair (which is the most frustrating part) before it finally played ball.  We had to get this to work as my daughter started rolling to her front, so it became essential.  The app is not good at all.  it can only be used on one device at any time and logs any other users out.  It consistently resets so suddenly all the selected items are no longer on, like night vision which we need at night!  It also takes about 5 minutes to refresh and show the video feed. The camera quality is good, but that is if you can be bothered waiting for the app to ever function.  I wish it hadn't taken me so long to set this up, because I would love to return this and get a better camera I could actually use easily.  Would not recommend this to anyone using it for small children.

Review Text: This is my first home camera and it is great! we have a little one at home, and this camera allows us to keep an eye on her and continue to be productive at home, it gives us peace of mind knowing what she's doing all the time, it has motion detection so the camera always follows her without us needing to do anything, it also has night vision which is specially useful at night (obviously) but can be useful in the afternoon nap too, depending on how much light you allow in your baby's room. Review Title: Nice quality for a small device
Review Text: EDIT: after using it for the last year I can definitely say that the camera itself still is a good camera! The app is absolutely a horror to deal with! There’s no fast forward so it’s literally recalling the past in real time, additionally there’s no indications on the past clip as to when the active times were. The only reason it’s not lower is because the camera itself is still good.We got this as a gift for our baby registry. To say this exceeded our expectations is an understatement. Just create different logins! We are able to access it from each of our phones and iPad all at the same time. The night vision and picture quality are great! I also liked that it simply plugs into the wall and doesn’t need batteries or chargers. Super sleek look as well. The motion detection is great too. It picks up all types of sounds and motions. Highly recommend !

Review Title: Not good for long term use, app isn’t reliable
Review Text: My son is 5 months old, up until a few weeks ago this monitor worked great for us.  Now it disconnects from the app several times a night.  The only way to refresh it is to unplug the camera and plug it back in (not always the easiest to accomplish without waking the baby) and then when it does turn back on in makes a super loud chime noise that has woken my son several times.  5 months is around the time babies start rolling and sleeping on their stomachs, which can be scary and I like knowing I can check on him at any moment by pulling up the app.  But half the time it doesn’t work.  The actual camera itself is nice with good picture quality but what is that worth when you can’t see it?  (And no, it’s not my internet).  The connection between the camera and its app is unreliable which is unsafe.  I’ll be buying another monitor as I cannot trust this one.

Review Text: These cameras are awesome! I got 3 of them and I love them. I am using them for baby monitors. I had already ordered and returned so many expensive baby monitors and they were so complicated some to the point I couldnt even get them set up. I spent less on these and they are way better! Picture is so clear, you can attach multiple cameras to the app which is great because with the baby monitors I purchased you could only do up to 3 some only 2. They are super easy to set up they took my husband a whole 5 minutes, the WiFi is so easy to connect and they don’t get disconnected like the others were. The only suggestion I’d make is having some sort of base you can connect them to that moves around on different angles because you have to place these flat and in order to see the whole room they’d have to be up high but there’s no way to adjust them on a slant to see down to the floor. There is a crib base that’s bendable but I need to see the entire room not just the crib. If I could find some sort of slanted bendable base that connected to a wall these would be perfect!
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2021

Review Text: I purchased this camera primarily to use as a pet monitor.  My dogs prefers to be uncrated when left alone, and normally does fine, but on rare occasions decides to be naughty and forage for anything that is accessible.  The camera is simple to setup and pair with the app, and the camera controls through the app work fine.  The picture quality is good and on par with what I expected.  Although the voice/speaker features of the camera do not reliably work (e.g., lots of lag, breaking up speech, even with strong internet connections), this is not a deal-breaker as I did not purchase it with the intention of using this feature much.  The app is a bit clunky in some aspects, but overall works fine.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 15, 2021

Review Title: Amazon camera and great customer support!
Review Text: This camera has the best picture quality and moves up down and side to side with a swipe of a finger on your phone’s screen. When I first downloaded the app, I couldn’t get the movement feature to work… but my husband could.I emailed customer service and Alma answered me in less than 12 hours. They let me know I had possibly downloaded their old app and to try the new “blue” colored app. Voila!So not not only are you getting an exceptional camera, you’re backed by awesome customer service reps to make sure you’re satisfied!I will be shopping Nooie for our needs in the future !
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2021

Review Title: Nice Modern 1080p Indoor Security camera, perfect for a pet
Review Text: I was looking for an indoor security 1080p camera for my home, and right off the bat this is a win. Here are my quick pros/cons before a more in depth review:Pros:-Nice, modern looking device, fits right into any set up-clear, 1080p quality, and night vision-has motion tracking-local SD storage-2 way audio, so I can talk to tell my dog to leave something aloneCons:-Night vision takes a split second to click on-No temperature readingHonestly, this is a 5 star product for the price. The only con really is there's no temperature reading which I knew. If it did, it would be the perfect baby camera. But for those who don't care, this is probably the best indoor security camera you can buy for this price. I've tested it to check in on my dog to see what he is up to and you can see really clear.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on March 19, 2021

Review Title: Great Camera but app could use a few tweaks
Review Text: The unit has a solid camera and audio quality is good. The app could use some improvements. Transferring it between locations I had some trouble linking it to wifi and had to reset it. would be nice to have a way to have multiple wifi stored in the app. Also the zoom feature is nice but if you minimize the app it zooms back out. otherwise its been really reliable and easy to use after setup.
Review posted time: Reviewed in the United States on May 10, 2021

Review Title: Suck audio, app hardly functions update May 12
Review Text: Pro: affordable baby monitor, good picture, and night visionCon; the audio it’s TERRIBLE double talk nope. I sound like an old school sound system from the 90s trying to talk to my kids under water . The app hardly works . Review Text: This camera was bought to use in baby room. It is extremely inconsistent. It hardly ever gets to wifi and when it does, it only maintains its connection for maybe 4-5 hours. It will constantly say “wrong wifi password” even when the password is correct. You download an app the is extremely glitchy and most of the time you have to restart it several times before you will get the camera (on the off chance it actually connects to the wifi) to work. I have reset my wifi, my camera, deleted the app off my phone and reinstalled it repeated as per customer service to know avail. Customer service takes forever to reply and promise a new camera but will give you the run around on how to fix it. They tell me to try the same thing to fix the connection problem in every email. After a month of back and forth emails they said “we can only give you 50% off a new camera”. Waste of money for a cheap camera that works 10% of the time.

Review Title: Loved it, but has connectivity issues
Review Text: This was a great camera given that you were able to plug it in and place an SD card in it for continuous recording. Had no problems initially with controlling the camera from the app. Video was high quality and even had a speaker option. However, less than about 6 months in, the camera started having connectivity issues. Resetting, moving it closer to the router (and farther away from where it was supposed to monitor), and reconfiguring the Wi-Fi didn't help. For the price, it was all right, but don't expect a lot of longevity. It was good to find this out before I invested in additional indoor and doorbell cameras.

Review Text: The picture quality and night vision are good.The problems I have with this camera have to do with the sound.1) When the camera powers on, it make a loud bootup sound. I have had to relocate this camera for optimal viewing in the same room as a sleeping child and the sound is enough to wake them up.2) When the camera is rotated, it makes a sound as well, sometimes disturbing the child sleeping. This seems like a significant oversight. You could assume that a person might not want to unplug/plugin a camera while the child is sleeping, but you will almost always be rotating the camera while they are.3) After 1 year the audio feed has completely failed. We are unable to hear anything through the camera.  Since we aren't able to watch the video every second, we will have to throw this one out and get a more dependable camera.
